original_instructions:
Marinate the shrimp in the lime juice for one hour. Drain and reserve the juice. In a large bowl combine the shrimp, tomatillos, green onions, jalapenos, garlic, cilantro, avocados, salt and pepper and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 pound cooked, cleaned shrimp, chopped in 1/4 inch dice
1/4 pound tomatillos, husks removed and diced
1 small avocado, peeled and pit removed

step_by_step_instructions: Marinate the shrimp in the lime juice for one hour.
Drain the shrimp and reserve the lime juice.
In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, tomatillos, green onions, jalapenos, garlic, cilantro, avocados, salt, and pepper.
Toss the mixture to coat all ingredients.
Serve immediately.

recipe_title: Oven Roasted Cinnamon Sweet Potato Fries
original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Place a heavy duty sheet tray into the oven to heat.
Add the sweet potatoes to a large bowl and drizzle with the olive oil. Season with the cinnamon, cumin, salt and pepper.
Spread out on the hot sheet tray and bake until crisp, 25 to 30 minutes. Flip the fries halfway through roasting.
ingredients: 2 large (about 1 1/2 pounds) sweet potatoes, peeled & cut into thin fries
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Place a heavy duty sheet tray into the oven to heat.
Add the sweet potatoes to a large bowl and drizzle with the olive oil.
Season with the cinnamon, cumin, salt and pepper.
Spread out the sweet potatoes on the hot sheet tray.
Bake until crisp, 25 to 30 minutes, flipping the fries halfway through roasting.

recipe_title: Pan Seared Cat Fish with Red Roasted Red Pepper Lime Sauce and Toasted Sunflower Seeds
original_instructions:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Season both sides of fish with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Add fish fillets to skillet and cook 2 minutes per side flipping with a spatula or tongs, until golden brown and fork-tender. Remove from pan.
In a blender, combine roasted red peppers, garlic, lime juice, ginger, and cumin and puree until smooth. Transfer mixture to a small saucepan and bring to a simmer, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cilantro.
Serve half of the fish with all of the sauce spooned over top. Sprinkle the top with toasted sunflower seeds. Reserve remaining fish for heros, if desired.
ingredients: 2 1/2 pounds catfish fillets, or any white-fleshed fish fillets, about 5 ounces each
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Season both sides of fish with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Add fish fillets to skillet and cook 2 minutes per side flipping with a spatula or tongs, until golden brown and fork-tender.
Remove fish from pan.
In a blender, combine roasted red peppers, garlic, lime juice, ginger, and cumin and puree until smooth.
Transfer mixture to a small saucepan and bring to a simmer, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in cilantro.
Serve half of the fish with all of the sauce spooned over top.
Sprinkle the top with toasted sunflower seeds.
Reserve remaining fish for heros, if desired.

original_instructions:
Snip the chicks horizontally, starting at the heads, into 1/8-inch-thick petals. You should have about 8 petals of varying sizes.
Arrange 4 petals at 12, 3, 6 and 9 o'clock around the cupcake. Put the remaining 4 petals on top and between them. Put the gumball in the center.
ingredients: 3 pink marshmallow chicks, such as Peeps
1 frosted cupcake (about 2 tablespoons frosting works best)
1 large gumball or other round candy

step_by_step_instructions: Snip the chicks horizontally, starting at the heads, into 1/8-inch-thick petals.
You should have about 8 petals of varying sizes.
Arrange 4 petals at 12, 3, 6 and 9 o'clock around the cupcake.
Put the remaining 4 petals on top and between them.
Put the gumball in the center.

original_instructions: Juice, in this order, the pears, lemons and celery, following your juicer's specific settings for each. Stir in the chia seeds if using and let soak for 5 minutes. Serve the juice immediately over ice, if desired.
ingredients: 2 to 3 large, juicy lemons, peel and pith removed

step_by_step_instructions: Peel and core the pears.
Remove the peel and pith from the lemons.
Juice the pears using your juicer's specific setting.
Juice the lemons using your juicer's specific setting.
Juice the celery stalks using your juicer's specific setting.
If using, stir in the chia seeds into the juice and let soak for 5 minutes.
Serve the juice immediately over ice if desired.

original_instructions: Begin by seasoning the monkfish chunks with salt and pepper. Pour the bottle of white wine into a large pot and cook over medium heat until the alcohol is cooked out. Turn the heat to medium-low, and add the sliced garlic. In a medium sized pan over high heat, saute the pearl onions in a small amount of olive oil until they begin to brown. Add these to the wine pot. Next, saute the sliced fennel over high heat with some olive oil until they brown, add these to the wine pot. Wait for the onions and fennel to become soft. In a medium pan over high heat, saute the monkfish chunks with olive oil until they begin to brown as well, add these to the wine pot. Repeat the same process with the bay scallops and add them to the wine pot. While all ingredients are in the wine pot, add salt and pepper, to taste. Finally add the tomatoes and marjoram to the pot and cover for 2 minutes.
ingredients: 2 pounds monkfish fillet, skin removed and cut into chunks
2 heads fennel, fronds removed, bulbs thinly sliced
1 bunch marjoram, picked leaves, roughly chopped

step_by_step_instructions: Season the monkfish chunks with salt and pepper.
Pour the bottle of white wine into a large pot and cook over medium heat until the alcohol is cooked out.
Turn the heat to medium-low and add the sliced garlic.
In a medium sized pan over high heat, sauté the pearl onions in a small amount of olive oil until they begin to brown.
Add the browned pearl onions to the wine pot.
Sauté the sliced fennel over high heat with olive oil until they brown, and add these to the wine pot.
Wait for the onions and fennel in the pot to become soft.
In a medium pan over high heat, sauté the monkfish chunks with olive oil until they begin to brown, then add these to the wine pot.
Repeat the same sautéing process with the bay scallops and add them to the wine pot.
While all ingredients are in the wine pot, add salt and pepper to taste.
Add the tomatoes and marjoram to the pot and cover it for 2 minutes.

recipe_title: Garlic and Sun-Dried Tomato Corn Muffin
original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Grease 2 muffin tins.
In a large bowl combine the muffin mix, corn, garlic, and sun-dried tomatoes. Stir to combine. In a small bowl whisk together the buttermilk, sour cream, and eggs until well blended. Add the buttermilk mixture to the muffin mix. Stir to combine. Spoon the mix into the muffin tins, filling up the cups about halfway. Bake until golden brown on top, about 15 minutes.
ingredients: 2 cups frozen whole kernel corn, thawed
2/3 cup diced sun-dried tomatoes (from an 8-ounce jar)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Grease 2 muffin tins.
In a large bowl combine the muffin mix, corn, garlic, and sun-dried tomatoes.
Stir to combine.
In a small bowl whisk together the buttermilk, sour cream, and eggs until well blended.
Add the buttermilk mixture to the muffin mix.
Stir to combine.
Spoon the mix into the muffin tins, filling up the cups about halfway.
Bake until golden brown on top, about 15 minutes.

original_instructions:
Marinade: In a food processor or blender puree the onion, the scallion, the garlic, the thyme, the salt, the allspice, the nutmeg, the cinnamon, the jalapeno, the black pepper, the hot sauce, the soy sauce and the oil.
In a large shallow dish arrange the wings in 1 layer and spoon the marinade over them, rubbing it in. Let the wings marinate, covered and chilled, turning them once, for at least 1 hour or, preferably, overnight.
Arrange the wings in 1 layer on an oiled rack set over a foil-lined roasting pan, spoon the marinade over them, and bake the wings in the upper third of a preheated 450 degree oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until they are cooked through.
ingredients: 1/2 cup minced pickled jalapeno pepper, or to taste
6 drops hot sauce or to taste
18 chicken wings (about 3 1/4),pounds, the wing tips cut off and reserved for another use

step_by_step_instructions: In a food processor or blender, puree the onion, scallion, garlic, thyme, salt, allspice, nutmeg, cinnamon, jalapeno, black pepper, hot sauce, soy sauce, and oil to make the marinade.
In a large shallow dish, arrange the chicken wings in one layer and spoon the marinade over them, rubbing it in.
Cover and chill the marinated wings, turning them once, for at least 1 hour or preferably overnight.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees Fahrenheit.
Arrange the marinated wings in one layer on an oiled rack set over a foil-lined roasting pan.
Spoon the marinade over the wings again.
Bake the wings in the upper third of the oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until they are cooked through.

original_instructions:
Heat the oven to 425 degrees F. Press the wonton wrappers into 24 (1 1/2-inch) mini muffin-pan cups.
Cook the beef in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat until it's well browned, stirring often to break up the meat. Pour off any fat. Stir in the taco seasoning mix and picante sauce.
Spoon the beef mixture into the wonton cups. Top with the salsa and cheese.
Bake for 5 minutes or until the wontons are golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Garnish with sour cream and olives, if desired. Serve immediately with additional salsa.
ingredients: 4 ounces shredded Mexican cheese blend (about 1 cup)

step_by_step_instructions: Heat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Press the wonton wrappers into 24 mini muffin-pan cups.
Cook the beef in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat until well browned, stirring often to break up the meat.
Pour off any fat from the skillet.
Stir in the taco seasoning mix and picante sauce.
Spoon the beef mixture into the wonton cups.
Top with salsa and cheese.
Bake for 5 minutes or until the wontons are golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Garnish with sour cream and olives, if desired.
Serve immediately with additional salsa.

original_instructions:
Put the rutabaga in a large saucepan and cover by about 2 inches of water. Season the water generously with salt.
Partially cover the pot and bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil the rutabaga for 40 minutes; rutabagas take a long time to bring out their natural sweetness. Add the potatoes to the pot and cook until the potatoes are fork tender, about 15 minutes.
Heat the cream in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Drain the rutabagas and potatoes from the water and pass through a food mill. Add half the hot cream and cold butter into the milled rutabaga/potato mixture and stir vigorously to combine. Repeat this with the remaining cream and butter. Taste to make sure the seasoning is correct.
ingredients: 1 large rutabaga, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks
3 Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks

step_by_step_instructions: Put the rutabaga in a large saucepan and cover by about 2 inches of water.
Season the water generously with salt.
Partially cover the pot and bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat.
Boil the rutabaga for 40 minutes.
Add the potatoes to the pot and cook until the potatoes are fork tender, about 15 minutes.
Heat the cream in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Drain the rutabagas and potatoes from the water and pass through a food mill.
Add half the hot cream and cold butter into the milled rutabaga/potato mixture and stir vigorously to combine.
Repeat this with the remaining cream and butter.
Taste to make sure the seasoning is correct.

original_instructions: Put the couscous in a medium bowl; pour the hot stock over it and stir to combine. Cover and let sit for 10 to 15 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork. Add the apricots, scallions, and orange juice; drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Toss gently to combine. Garnish with chopped parsley.
ingredients: 2 scallions, sliced thin, green parts only
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley leaves, for garnish

step_by_step_instructions: Put the couscous in a medium bowl.
Pour the hot stock over the couscous and stir to combine.
Cover the bowl and let it sit for 10 to 15 minutes.
Uncover the bowl and fluff the couscous with a fork.
Add the chopped apricots, sliced scallions, and orange juice to the couscous.
Drizzle the mixture with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Toss the ingredients gently to combine.
Garnish with chopped parsley.

recipe_title: Variations on Stuffing 101: Sausage and Apple Stuffing
original_instructions: In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, cook 1 pound bulk pork sausage, breaking up the meat with a spoon, until cooked through, about 10 minutes. Add to the Bread Stuffing 101 along with the dried apples.

step_by_step_instructions: Place a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add 1 pound of bulk pork sausage to the skillet.
Cook the sausage, breaking up the meat with a spoon, until cooked through. This will take about 10 minutes.
Add the cooked sausage and chopped dried apples to the Bread Stuffing 101 mixture.

original_instructions: Place the onions in a medium saucepan and pour in enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, and remove from the heat. Strain and set the onions aside. Combine all the remaining ingredients in the saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook 10 minutes. Add the blanched onions and simmer an additional 10 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a container, cover and refrigerate at least a day before serving. Pickled onions will keep in the refrigerator up to month.
ingredients: 1 beet, trimmed, peeled and cut into 8 wedges

step_by_step_instructions: Place the onions in a medium saucepan and pour in enough water to cover them.
Bring the water to a boil, then remove from the heat.
Strain the onions and set them aside.
Combine the vinegar, black pepper, cumin seeds, oregano, garlic, sugar, salt, and beet in the saucepan.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
Add the blanched onions to the saucepan and simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a container, cover it, and refrigerate for at least a day before serving.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 500 degrees F.
Slice the shrimp in half, lengthwise. Heat the oil in a small nonstick skillet over medium heat and add the shrimp. Cook until the shrimp turn pink, about 3 minutes, and season them with salt and pepper.
Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface into a 10-inch round. Place the crust onto a parchment line baking sheet. Spread the sauce onto the pizza, leaving the edges clean for a crust to form. Put half of the cheese on top and spread the shrimp evenly over the pizza. Then add the mango slices, red onion, red bell pepper, and yellow bell pepper evenly on the top. Sprinkle the pizza with the red pepper flakes and top with the remaining cheese. Bake the pizza for 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and slightly brown. Serve immediately with more red pepper flakes sprinkled on top.
ingredients: 2 pinches red pepper flakes, plus more for garnish

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F.
Slice the shrimp in half, lengthwise.
Heat the oil in a small nonstick skillet over medium heat and add the shrimp.
Cook until the shrimp turn pink, about 3 minutes, and season them with salt and pepper.
Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface into a 10-inch round.
Place the crust onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Spread the sauce onto the pizza, leaving the edges clean for a crust to form.
Put half of the cheese on top of the sauce.
Spread the shrimp evenly over the pizza.
Add the mango slices, red onion, red bell pepper, and yellow bell pepper evenly on the top.
Sprinkle the pizza with the red pepper flakes.
Top with the remaining cheese.
Bake the pizza for 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and slightly brown.
Serve immediately with more red pepper flakes sprinkled on top.

original_instructions:
In a small saucepan, melt butter. When foaming subsides, stir in flour and cook, stirring continuously for about a minute or two. Whisk in the milk, bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Add horseradish, mustard and vinegar and remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper.
In a small saucepan, melt butter. When foaming subsides, stir in flour and cook, stirring continuously for about a minute or two. Whisk in the milk, bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Add horseradish, mustard and vinegar and remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: In a small saucepan, melt butter until the foaming subsides.
Stir in flour and cook, stirring continuously for about a minute or two.
Whisk in the milk, bring the mixture to a boil, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add horseradish, mustard, and vinegar, then remove from heat.
Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper.

original_instructions:
Set up grill for direct cooking over high heat. Oil grate when ready to start cooking.
In a food processor, combine walnuts, garbanzo beans, bread crumbs, grill seasoning, paprika, pepper flakes, oil and vinegar and pulse until coarsely ground.
In a small bowl whisk egg, add to food processor and pulse for 10 seconds, just enough to incorporate egg. Divide into 4 equal-size parts; roll into balls, and flatten with the palm of your hand into 3/4-inch-thick patties.
Place burgers on oiled grill. Cook 4 minutes per side.
Serve hot on toasted buns with lettuce, tomato, avocado and honey mustard.

step_by_step_instructions: Set up grill for direct cooking over high heat.
Oil grate when ready to start cooking.
In a food processor, combine walnuts, garbanzo beans, bread crumbs, grill seasoning, paprika, pepper flakes, oil, and vinegar and pulse until coarsely ground.
In a small bowl, whisk egg, add to food processor and pulse for 10 seconds, just enough to incorporate egg.
Divide the mixture into 4 equal-size parts; roll into balls, and flatten with the palm of your hand into 3/4-inch-thick patties.
Place burgers on oiled grill.
Cook 4 minutes per side.
Serve hot on toasted buns with lettuce, tomato, avocado, and honey mustard.

recipe_title: Artichokes, Asparagus, and Watercress Salad with Cumin Vinaigrette
original_instructions:
To prepare the dressing: In a small bowl, combine the vinegar mustard, cumin, and sugar; season with salt and pepper. Whisk to blend. While whisking, slowly drizzle in the olive oil, mixing until the vinaigrette is emulsified. Set aside.
To prepare the salad: Fill a medium bowl with 2 cups of ice cubes and cover with cold water. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the asparagus and blanch until tender but not mushy, about 3 minutes. Drain the asparagus in a colander and transfer to the ice water bath to stop the cooking. Drain again and place on a paper towel-lined plate to dry. Cut the asparagus stalks into thirds.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the blanched asparagus, parsley, artichokes, tomatoes, and watercress. Whisk the vinaigrette to combine and pour over the salad. Toss to coat and serve.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 (12-ounce) can artichoke hearts in water, drained and halved

step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, combine vinegar, mustard, cumin, and sugar.
Season with salt and pepper and whisk to blend.
While whisking, slowly drizzle in olive oil until the vinaigrette is emulsified. Set aside.
Fill a medium bowl with ice cubes and cover with cold water.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat.
Add asparagus and blanch for about 3 minutes until tender but not mushy.
Drain asparagus in a colander and transfer to the ice water bath to stop cooking.
Drain asparagus again and place on a paper towel-lined plate to dry.
Cut asparagus stalks into thirds.
In a large mixing bowl, combine blanched asparagus, parsley, artichokes, tomato, and watercress.
Whisk vinaigrette again and pour over the salad.
Toss to coat and serve.

recipe_title: Black-Eyed Pea Salad with Canadian Bacon
original_instructions:
Spray a large nonstick skillet with canola oil spray and heat over medium-high heat. Add the bacon and cook until very lightly browned, about 3 minutes per side. Cool slightly and cut into thin strips.
Whisk together the vinegar, olive oil and salt and pepper to taste in a large bowl. Add the carrots, peas and scallions and toss. Add the watercress and toss again. Transfer to a large platter and top with the bacon.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
One 15-ounce can no-salt-added black-eyed peas, rinsed and drained
1 bunch watercress, trimmed and separated into sprigs

step_by_step_instructions: Spray a large nonstick skillet with canola oil spray and heat over medium-high heat.
Add the bacon and cook until very lightly browned, about 3 minutes per side.
Cool slightly and cut into thin strips.
Whisk together the vinegar, olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste in a large bowl.
Add the carrots, peas, and scallions and toss.
Add the watercress and toss again.
Transfer to a large platter and top with the bacon.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F
Slice apples into mixing bowl and add sugar, cream, and rose water, and mix thoroughly, so that rose water will be distributed evenly. Line a 9-inch pie dish with favorite pastry. Fill with apple mixture and cover with top crust in which a few small vents have been slashed for steam to escape. Flute the edges well to keep juice from escaping. Bake in a moderate oven for 50 minutes.
In a bowl, rub the flour and lard together. Add enough water to make a dough (not too stiff).
On work surface, roll the dough out and spread with some of the butter. Fold over evenly and butter. Make a second fold. Roll out again, being careful not to squeeze the butter out. The layers of dough and butter repeated provide the flakiness of the crust.
Use a pinch of ginger in piecrust to eliminate the taste of lard in case it is not fresh.
ingredients: 3 cups peeled, sliced baking apples, such as Gravenstein

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Slice apples into a mixing bowl.
Add sugar, cream, and rose water to the apples, and mix thoroughly.
Line a 9-inch pie dish with pastry.
Fill the pie dish with the apple mixture.
Cover with the top crust and slash a few small vents for steam to escape.
Flute the edges to keep juices from escaping.
Bake in the oven for 50 minutes.
In a bowl, rub the flour and lard together.
Add enough cold water to the flour and lard to make a dough.
On the work surface, roll out the dough and spread with some butter.
Fold the dough over, spread with more butter, and fold again.
Roll out the dough carefully to maintain layers.
Optionally, add a pinch of ginger to the piecrust.

original_instructions:
Peel 1 medium kohlrabi or turnip and cut into matchsticks. Whisk the juice of 1/2 lemon, 1/4 cup chopped dill, 1/2 clove minced garlic, 1 teaspoon dijon mustard, and salt and pepper in a bowl; whisk in 3 tablespoons olive oil. Toss with the kohlrabi, 1/4 head shredded Savoy cabbage, and salt and pepper to taste.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos

step_by_step_instructions: Peel 1 medium kohlrabi.
Cut the kohlrabi into matchsticks.
Whisk the juice of 1/2 lemon, 1/4 cup chopped dill, 1/2 clove minced garlic, and 1 teaspoon dijon mustard in a bowl.
Add salt and pepper to the bowl and whisk in 3 tablespoons olive oil.
Toss the kohlrabi with the dressing, 1/4 head shredded cabbage, and add salt and pepper to taste.

original_instructions: In a large ball jar (or other transporting container), mix together the tea, lemon juice, and grenadine. Pour over ice when ready to serve.
ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice (1 to 2 lemons)

step_by_step_instructions: In a large ball jar or other transporting container, mix together the tea, lemon juice, and grenadine.
Pour the mixture over ice when ready to serve.

original_instructions: Cut the carrots into strips and saute all of the ingredients until soft. Add the Monterrey and Jack cheeses, mix together with a plain white sauce and top with piped Yukon gold potatoes. Bake for 30 minutes at 425 degrees F.

step_by_step_instructions: Cut the carrots into strips.
Saute the carrots, broccoli, mushrooms, onion, and garlic in butter until soft.
Add the Monterrey and Jack cheeses to the vegetables.
Mix together the cheese and vegetable mixture with a plain white sauce.
Pipe Yukon gold potatoes on top of the mixture.
Bake the entire dish for 30 minutes at 425 degrees F.

recipe_title: Couscous with Currants, Almonds, and Parsley
original_instructions: Check couscous package instructions to see how much boiling water you will need. Place couscous and currants in a large bowl. Pour boiling water over top, cover, and let stand for 5 minutes. Remove cover, add toasted almonds and parsley, and fluff with a fork until combined. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Serve hot or at room temperature.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Check couscous package instructions to see how much boiling water you will need.
Place couscous and currants in a large bowl.
Pour boiling water over top, cover, and let stand for 5 minutes.
Remove cover, add toasted almonds and parsley, and fluff with a fork until combined.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

original_instructions: Heat a large heavy-bottomed saucepan and cook the salt pork over medium-high heat until crisp. Add the red and green peppers, celery, onion, and garlic and cook 3 to 4 minutes. Add the rice and stir, coating the rice with drippings. Stir in the tomatoes, tomato paste, water, salt, and black and cayenne pepper. Cover and simmer until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed, about 25 to 30 minutes.
ingredients: 2 cups crushed, canned whole tomatoes, undrained

step_by_step_instructions: Heat a large heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-high heat.
Cook the salt pork until crisp.
Add diced red pepper, green pepper, celery, onion, and minced garlic to the pan.
Cook the vegetables for 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the rice to the pan and stir to coat with drippings.
Stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, water, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
Cover the saucepan and simmer until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed, about 25 to 30 minutes.

recipe_title: Quick Broiled Flank Steak with Quick Roasted Veggies
original_instructions:
Preheat oven broiler. Marinate flank steak in lime juice, salt and pepper. Do this right on the paper the steak comes wrapped in for easy clean up. Place on broiler pan and cook, turning once until medium rare, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. Remove to a cutting board to rest.
Preheat oven to 475 degrees F.
Toss broccoli and cauliflower with olive salt and pepper, pour onto a cookie sheet in a single layer. Roast, turning once, until tender and cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes.
Slice flank steak into thin strips, serve 3 to 4 ounces per person with a side of the veggies.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pound flank steak or the smallest one they'll sell you
Coarse salt and cracked black pepper
1/2 bunch broccoli, peeled, cut into florets
2 cobs shucked corn, cut into 2-inch slices

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven broiler.
Marinate the flank steak in lime juice, salt, and pepper, doing this directly on the wrapping paper for easy cleanup.
Place the marinated steak on a broiler pan.
Cook under the broiler, turning once, until medium rare, which takes about 4 to 5 minutes per side.
Remove the steak from the broiler and let it rest on a cutting board.
Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F.
Toss broccoli and cauliflower with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Arrange the broccoli and cauliflower on a cookie sheet in a single layer.
Roast in the preheated oven, turning once, until tender and cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes.
Slice the rested flank steak into thin strips.
Serve 3 to 4 ounces of sliced steak per person with a side of roasted vegetables.

original_instructions:
Add dry vegetable dip mix to sour cream and stir to combine. Refrigerate.
Prepare Farm Rich Boneless Buffalo Style Chicken Bites according to package instructions.
Place Chicken Bite in dinner roll.
Top with veggie dip.
ingredients: 1 package Farm Rich Buffalo Style Boneless Chicken Bites

step_by_step_instructions: Add dry vegetable dip mix to sour cream and stir to combine.
Refrigerate the mixture.
Prepare Farm Rich Boneless Buffalo Style Chicken Bites according to package instructions.
Place Chicken Bite in a dinner roll.
Top with veggie dip.

original_instructions:
Slice halibut as described in above recipe and arrange on plates.
Prepare the vinegar mixture in above recipe, adding the mitsuba, and coat the fish. Proceed with remaining recipe above, using grated daikon in place of sprouts and scallions in place of the red onion. Serve immediately with ponzu sauce alongside the halibut for dipping.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and let stand 24 hours. Strain through a cheesecloth and mature 3 months in a cool, dark place, or in the refrigerator.
ingredients: 6 scallions, white and light green parts, finely minced

step_by_step_instructions: Slice the halibut and arrange it on plates.
Prepare the vinegar mixture by combining the rice vinegar, dark soy sauce, tamari sauce, mirin, dried bonito flakes, and giant kelp in a bowl.
Add the finely chopped mitsuba to the vinegar mixture.
Coat the sliced halibut with the prepared vinegar mixture.
Use grated daikon radish in place of sprouts and finely minced scallions in place of red onion to garnish the dish.
Serve the halibut immediately with ponzu sauce for dipping.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Combine the cider, wine, honey, cinnamon sticks, zest, juice, cloves and star anise in a large saucepan, bring to a boil and simmer over low heat for 10 minutes. Pour into mugs, add an orange peel to each and serve.
ingredients: 1 (750-ml) bottle red wine, such as Cabernet Sauvignon

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the apple cider, red wine, honey, cinnamon sticks, orange zest, orange juice, cloves, and star anise in a large saucepan.
Bring the mixture to a boil and simmer over low heat for 10 minutes.
Pour the hot mixture into mugs.
Add an orange peel to each mug as garnish and serve.

original_instructions: Scoop ice cream into fountain drink glass add rootbeer and stoli. Garnish with whipped cream and shaved milk chocolate.;

step_by_step_instructions: Scoop ice cream into a fountain drink glass.
Add root beer and Stoli.
Garnish with whipped cream.
Top with shaved milk chocolate.

original_instructions: In a large nonstick pan over medium-low heat, saute the bacon and chorizo until the fat is rendered, about 10 minutes. Add the onions and saute until soft, about1 minute. Bring the heat up to medium and add the lobster meat. Cook until the lobster is cooked all the way through , an additional 3 to 5 minutes. Add the cheese, salsa and cilantro. Toss to form a gooey mess. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve inside tortillas and garnish with anything your heart desires.
ingredients: 1 pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: In a large nonstick pan over medium-low heat, sauté the bacon and chorizo until the fat is rendered, about 10 minutes.
Add the onions and sauté until soft, about 1 minute.
Bring the heat up to medium and add the lobster meat. Cook until the lobster is cooked all the way through, an additional 3 to 5 minutes.
Add the cheese, salsa, and cilantro. Toss to form a gooey mix.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve inside warmed corn tortillas and garnish as desired.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Peel and devein the shrimp. Place them on a sheet pan with the olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and toss together. Spread the shrimp on one layer and roast for 6 to 8 minutes, just until pink, firm and cooked through. Allow to cool for 3 minutes.
Meanwhile, make the sauce. In a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, orange zest, orange juice, vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. When the shrimp are cool, add them to the sauce and toss. Add the dill, capers, and red onion and toss well. The flavors will improve if you allow the salad to sit at room temperature for 30 minutes. Otherwise, chill and serve at room temperature.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Peel and devein the shrimp.
Place the shrimp on a sheet pan with the olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and toss together.
Spread the shrimp in one layer and roast in the oven for 6 to 8 minutes until pink, firm, and cooked through.
Allow the shrimp to cool for 3 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, orange zest, orange juice, vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper to make the sauce.
When the shrimp are cool, add them to the sauce and toss.
Add the dill, capers, and red onion to the mixture and toss well.
Allow the salad to sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to improve the flavors, otherwise, chill and serve at room temperature.

original_instructions: Place carrots, onion, celery, turnip, apple and garlic in a food processor and pulse until you have a coarse textured puree. Once roasting pan comes out of the oven (and meat is removed) set it over medium-high heat on the stove. Add a 2-count of olive oil then add vegetable puree. Sweat for 7 to 8 minutes until most of the moisture has cooked off, then dust with flour. Cook for 2 more minutes stirring well to incorporate all the flour with the fat in the pan. Add the apple liqueur and scrape the bottom of the pan. Gradually add chicken stock, stirring as you go to ensure there are no lumps. Bring to a simmer and season well with salt and pepper. Simmer then remove from heat and strain through a sieve - it's okay if some of the pulp goes through as this will naturally add body to the gravy. Serve with roast and stuffing.
ingredients: 1 medium turnip, peeled and roughly chopped
1 large Granny Smith apple, peeled, cored and chopped
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Place carrots, onion, celery, turnip, apple, and garlic in a food processor and pulse until you have a coarse textured puree.
Once the roasting pan comes out of the oven and the meat is removed, set it over medium-high heat on the stove.
Add a 2-count of olive oil to the pan, then add the vegetable puree.
Sweat the vegetables for 7 to 8 minutes until most of the moisture has cooked off.
Dust the vegetables with flour, then cook for 2 more minutes, stirring well to incorporate the flour with the fat in the pan.
Add the apple liqueur and scrape the bottom of the pan.
Gradually add the chicken stock, stirring as you go to ensure there are no lumps.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and season well with salt and pepper.
Simmer briefly, then remove from heat and strain through a sieve, allowing some pulp to pass through to add body to the gravy.
Serve the gravy with roast and stuffing.

original_instructions: Remove any rind from the cheeses and chop the cheeses into rough 1-inch chunks. Place the cheese in a food processor with the garlic, oregano, and red pepper flakes and pulse until reduced to the size of fine pea gravel. Stir in the green onion, olive oil and black pepper and pulse again. Cover and let stand at room temperature for at least 4 hours before using.
ingredients: 1/2 pound Asiago cheese, not too dry

step_by_step_instructions: Remove any rind from the cheeses and chop the cheeses into rough 1-inch chunks.
Place the cheese in a food processor with the garlic, oregano, and red pepper flakes and pulse until reduced to the size of fine pea gravel.
Stir in the green onion, olive oil and black pepper and pulse again.
Cover and let stand at room temperature for at least 4 hours before using.

recipe_title: Smoked Salmon Rounds with Black Sesame Seeds
original_instructions:
Combine salmon, shallot, chives, lemon zest and black pepper in a silver bowl.
Lay out sesame seeds on a plate. With your hands, form smoked salmon balls about 3/4 inch in diameter. Roll in sesame seeds and place on serving platter.
Serve with a tiny dollop of sour cream.
ingredients: 1/2 lemon grated with micro plane or zester

step_by_step_instructions: Combine salmon, shallot, chives, lemon zest and black pepper in a silver bowl.
Lay out sesame seeds on a plate.
With your hands, form smoked salmon balls about 3/4 inch in diameter.
Roll the salmon balls in sesame seeds.
Place the sesame-coated salmon balls on a serving platter.
Serve with a tiny dollop of sour cream.

original_instructions:
Chill a martini glass in the freezer. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the pineapple juice, vodka, orange liqueur, and lime juice. Cover and shake vigorously, until combined and chilled, about 30 seconds. (In general, by the time the shaker mists up the drink is ready.)
Scatter some turbinado sugar onto a small plate, wet the rim of the glass and dip into sugar. Strain the drink into the chilled glass. Skewer the pineapple and cherry and drop into the cocktail. Cheers.

step_by_step_instructions: Chill a martini glass in the freezer.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add pineapple juice, vodka, orange liqueur, and lime juice to the shaker.
Cover and shake vigorously, until combined and chilled, about 30 seconds.
Wet the rim of a chilled glass and dip into turbinado sugar.
Strain the drink into the chilled glass.
Skewer a piece of pineapple and a cherry and drop them into the cocktail.
Serve and enjoy.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a large (10- to 12-inch) saute pan, cook the butter and onions on medium-low heat for 12 to 15 minutes, until the onions are lightly browned. Don't rush this step; it makes all the difference when the onions are well cooked.
Sprinkle the flour into the pan, whisk in, then add the salt and pepper. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the hot chicken stock and Cognac, and cook uncovered for 4 to 5 minutes, until thickened. Add the cream, if desired, and serve.
ingredients: 2 cups chicken stock, preferably homemade, heated

step_by_step_instructions: In a large (10- to 12-inch) saute pan, cook the butter and onions on medium-low heat for 12 to 15 minutes, until the onions are lightly browned.
Sprinkle the flour into the pan and whisk it in.
Add the salt and pepper.
Cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the hot chicken stock and Cognac, and cook uncovered for 4 to 5 minutes, until thickened.
Add the cream, if desired, and serve.

original_instructions:
Place the rice in a large bowl and rinse under cold running water for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Heat the oil in a medium heavy saucepan over medium low heat. Add the onion and saute until soft, but not brown, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for 1 more minute to release the aromas. Add the peas, carrots and string beans, and cook slightly, about 2 minutes. Add boiling water and rice, cover tightly and simmer for 1520 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir with a fork and serve hot.
ingredients: 1/2 pound string beans, cut into small pieces

step_by_step_instructions: Place the rice in a large bowl and rinse under cold running water for 5 minutes.
Drain the rice and set aside.
Heat the oil in a medium heavy saucepan over medium low heat.
Add the onion and saute until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and saute for 1 more minute to release the aromas.
Add the peas, carrots, and string beans, and cook for about 2 minutes.
Add boiling water and rice to the saucepan, cover tightly and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.
Stir the rice with a fork and serve hot.

original_instructions: Whisk together the buttermilk, mayonnaise, chives, vinegar, sugar, lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a small bowl. Combine the walnuts, celery and apples in a separate large bowl. Pour three-quarters of the dressing over the celery-apple mixture and toss to coat. Let stand for 5 minutes at room temperature, then toss again. Adjust the seasoning as desired. Add the remaining dressing and toss again. Serve at room temperature.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
8 ribs celery, sliced about 1/4 inch thick on the bias
2 Gala apples, skin on, cored and diced

step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together the buttermilk, mayonnaise, chives, vinegar, sugar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Combine the walnuts, celery, and apples in a separate large bowl.
Pour three-quarters of the dressing over the celery-apple mixture and toss to coat.
Let stand for 5 minutes at room temperature, then toss again.
Adjust the seasoning as desired.
Add the remaining dressing and toss again.
Serve at room temperature.

ingredients: 1 pound jumbo lump crab meat, cleaned
Salt and fresh ground black pepper, to taste

step_by_step_instructions: In a bowl, put crabmeat, onions, scallions, pepper, and jicama.
Toss the mixture to combine.
In another bowl, whisk together curry oil, mayonnaise, and creme fraiche.
Add the curry mixture to the crab mixture.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
In a skillet, heat oil and curry powder slowly, stirring constantly until the curry is fragrant without burning.
Remove the skillet from heat and set aside to cool.
Let the curry settle overnight.
Pour off the oil and store it in the refrigerator.

original_instructions:
In a food processor, briefly whiz the pieces of smoked salmon with the thyme and lemon juice and zest. Scrape down the sides of the bowl, then add the butter and Boursin. Season lightly with the paprika, a touch of cayenne, and black pepper. Whiz again briefly until the mixture is combined, but still a little rough. Taste, and adjust the seasoning, salt, pepper or paprika. Chill for at least 20 minutes, longer if convenient. Remove from the refrigerator at least 10 minutes before serving.
Serve with or on slices of buttered rye bread, with a few watercress leaves.
ingredients: About 1 pound good smoked salmon offcuts, trimmed and snipped into small pieces
Tiny leaves from a few sprigs of thyme (or 1 teaspoon dried thyme)
Juice and finely grated zest of 1 small unwaxed lemon
Thinly sliced, buttered, light rye bread and a handful of watercress leaves, to serve

step_by_step_instructions: In a food processor, whiz the pieces of smoked salmon with the thyme and lemon juice and zest briefly.
Scrape down the sides of the bowl.
Add the butter and Boursin.
Season lightly with paprika, a touch of cayenne, and black pepper.
Whiz again briefly until the mixture is combined, but still a little rough.
Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt, pepper, or paprika if needed.
Chill the mixture for at least 20 minutes.
Remove from the refrigerator at least 10 minutes before serving.
Serve with or on slices of buttered rye bread with a few watercress leaves.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
On a work surface lay out 3 sheets of phyllo dough, brushing lightly with butter in between sheets. Cut stacked sheets into four squares. Place 1-ounce of chocolate in the center of each square. Gather the four corners of the phyllo square up around the chocolate and twist together to form a "purse". Repeat process for each square and then the remaining phyllo sheets and chocolate. Transfer the purses to a baking sheet. Brush purses with remaining butter and sprinkle with granulated sugar. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown.
In a blender combine the raspberries, liqueur, and water and process until smooth. Add additional water, if necessary, to achieve desired consistency. Pass the puree through a sieve to remove the seeds.
Serve the phyllo purses warm with the raspberry puree.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons framboise, raspberry or other liqueur

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lay out 3 sheets of phyllo dough on a work surface.
Brush the first sheet lightly with melted butter.
Place the second sheet on top and brush it with melted butter.
Place the third sheet on top and brush it with melted butter.
Cut the stacked sheets into four squares.
Place 1-ounce of chocolate in the center of each square.
Gather the four corners of the phyllo square up around the chocolate and twist together to form a purse.
Repeat the process for each square.
Continue this process for the remaining phyllo sheets and chocolate.
Transfer all the purses to a baking sheet.
Brush the purses with the remaining butter.
Sprinkle the purses with granulated sugar.
Bake in the oven for 10 minutes or until golden brown.
In a blender, combine raspberries, framboise, and water.
Process the mixture until smooth.
Add additional water, if necessary, to achieve desired consistency.
Pass the puree through a sieve to remove the seeds.
Serve the phyllo purses warm with the raspberry puree.

original_instructions:
Whisk the eggs with a pinch each of salt and pepper in a small bowl. Heat the peanut oil in a wok or large saucepan over high heat. Add the eggs and cook, undisturbed, until bubbles form on the surface and the bottom is set, about 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring gently to break up the eggs, until the tomatoes begin to soften, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the chicken broth, 3 cups water, the scallions, sesame oil, soy sauce and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Partially cover and simmer 5 minutes.
Stir in the chicken, spinach and rice and warm through. Season the soup with salt and pepper.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
2 large tomatoes, halved and thinly sliced
1 cup shredded rotisserie chicken, skin removed
1 1/2 cups cooked rice (white, brown or wild)

step_by_step_instructions: Whisk the eggs with a pinch each of salt and pepper in a small bowl.
Heat the peanut oil in a wok or large saucepan over high heat.
Add the eggs and cook, undisturbed, until bubbles form on the surface and the bottom is set, about 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring gently to break up the eggs, until the tomatoes begin to soften, 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the chicken broth, 3 cups water, the scallions, sesame oil, soy sauce and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt.
Partially cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in the chicken, spinach and rice and warm through.
Season the soup with salt and pepper.

recipe_title: Tomato, Cucumber, and Red Pepper Relish
original_instructions: In a large bowl toss together the red pepper, cucumber, and tomato. Add the oil, vinegar, oregano, salt and pepper, and toss to combine.
ingredients: 1 red pepper, seeded and finely diced
1 English cucumber, seeded and finely diced
2 large tomatoes, seeded and finely diced

step_by_step_instructions: In a large bowl, toss together the red pepper, cucumber, and tomato.
Add the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, oregano, salt, and freshly ground black pepper.
Toss to combine all ingredients thoroughly.

original_instructions:
To make mocha syrup, mix all ingredients except espresso. Add espresso to desired strength.
For the cherry buster drink, pour the cherry and mocha syrups in the bottom of a mug. Add the hot shots of espresso and swirl the chocolate and syrup together. Pour in steamed milk. Add whipped cream if desired.

step_by_step_instructions: Mix the cocoa powder, sugar, corn syrup, and boiling water together to make mocha syrup.
Add espresso to the mocha syrup to your desired strength.
Pour the cherry syrup and prepared mocha syrup into the bottom of a mug.
Add two hot shots of espresso to the mug.
Swirl the espresso, cherry syrup, and mocha syrup together.
Pour in the steamed milk.
Add whipped cream on top if desired.

original_instructions: Mix all ingredients in a salad bowl. Toss gently and season with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature family style.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds juicy tomatoes, cut into wedges

step_by_step_instructions: Cut tomatoes into wedges.
Prepare other ingredients as necessary.
Mix all cut and prepared ingredients in a salad bowl.
Toss the ingredients gently.
Season the mixture with salt and pepper.
Serve the salad at room temperature family style.

original_instructions: In a heavy kettle cook onions, garlic, and tomatoes, covered, over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until onions are very soft, about 40 minutes. Force mixture through a food mill fitted with coarse disk into a bowl. In a cleaned kettle stir together puree, sugar, and vinegar, and simmer, uncovered, stirring frequently to prevent scorching, until reduced by half, about 20 minutes. Tie cloves, allspice, cinnamon, and celery seed in a cheesecloth bag and add to tomato mixture with mustard and paprika. Simmer mixture, stirring until very thick, about 10 minutes. Discard bag and season mixture with hot sauce and salt. Ketchup may be made 10 days ahead and chilled, covered.;

step_by_step_instructions: In a heavy kettle, cook chopped onions, chopped garlic, and drained whole tomatoes, covered, over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally until onions are very soft, about 40 minutes.
Force the mixture through a food mill fitted with a coarse disk into a bowl.
In the cleaned kettle, stir together the tomato puree, sugar, and cider vinegar. Simmer uncovered, stirring frequently to prevent scorching, until reduced by half, about 20 minutes.
Tie cloves, allspice, cinnamon stick, and celery seed in a cheesecloth bag and add to the tomato mixture along with dry mustard and paprika.
Simmer the mixture, stirring until very thick, about 10 minutes.
Discard the spice bag and season the mixture with hot sauce and salt to taste.

original_instructions:
Heat oven to 325 F.
Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler over simmering water.
Stir sugar into chocolate until blended. Add eggs and vanilla. Stir in flour and nuts. Spread into a buttered 13" x 9" baking pan.
Bake 30-35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes up with crumbs (not batter). Cool in pan.
ingredients: 6 ounces SCHARFFEN BERGER 70% Cacao Bittersweet Chocolate

step_by_step_instructions: Heat oven to 325 F.
Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler over simmering water.
Stir sugar into chocolate until blended.
Add eggs and vanilla.
Stir in flour and nuts.
Spread into a buttered 13 x 9 baking pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes up with crumbs (not batter).
Cool in the pan.

original_instructions:
1. Put all the ingredients except the potatoes in a large soup pot. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the potatoes and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
2. Ladle the soup into bowls and serve with a dollop of sour cream on top.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons clam base, such as Better Than Bouillon (find it at superiortouch.com)

step_by_step_instructions: Put all the ingredients except the potatoes in a large soup pot.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Add the potatoes and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Ladle the soup into bowls.
Serve with a dollop of sour cream on top.

recipe_title: Sandwiches de Miga: Eggs and Roquefort Argentine Sandwich
original_instructions:
In a 2-quart pot, place the eggs. Cover with water by 2 inches and salt the water liberally. Bring the water to a boil and then cover, turn off the heat, and let sit for 8 minutes.
Grate the hard boiled eggs on a cheese grater. In a small bowl, combine the eggs, mayonnaise, and cheese. Adjust the seasoning of the egg mixture with hot sauce, salt, and pepper, to taste. Layer bread with egg mixture and serve as double decker sandwiches.
ingredients: 12 slices Argentine migas bread (sliced white bread, a couple days old, crusts removed can be used)

step_by_step_instructions: Place the eggs in a 2-quart pot.
Cover the eggs with water by 2 inches and salt the water liberally.
Bring the water to a boil.
Once boiling, cover the pot, turn off the heat, and let the eggs sit for 8 minutes.
Grate the hard boiled eggs using a cheese grater.
In a small bowl, combine the grated eggs, mayonnaise, and cheese.
Season the egg mixture with hot sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Layer the bread with the egg mixture to make double decker sandwiches.

recipe_title: Grandma's Watercress Salad All Dressed Up
original_instructions:
In a medium mixing bowl, toss watercress, gorgonzola, onion, nuts and vinaigrette. Season and decoratively place in the center of a chilled plate (be sure to divide all ingredients evenly amongst 4 plates). Garnish salad with slices of prosciutto, figs and a drizzle of fig balsamic vinegar.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium saute pan over medium heat, melt butter and then add nuts. Toss nuts in pan until well coated with butter, then add honey and toss some more until nuts are well coated. Season with salt, pepper and a touch of cayenne pepper. Put nuts in oven for about 5 to 7 minutes, tossing regularly so they toast evenly. Cool. Store in airtight container until needed.
Place all ingredients in blender except oil. Process until smooth and then slowly drizzle in oil. Adjust seasoning, as desired.
ingredients: 4 ounces red wine vinaigrette, recipe follows
Kosher salt and freshly ground white pepper
Kosher salt and freshly ground white pepper
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: In a medium mixing bowl, toss the watercress, gorgonzola, onion, nuts, and vinaigrette.
Season the mixture and place it decoratively in the center of a chilled plate, dividing evenly among 4 plates.
Garnish the salad with slices of prosciutto, figs, and a drizzle of fig balsamic vinegar.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium saute pan over medium heat, melt butter and add walnuts.
Toss walnuts in the pan until coated with butter, then add honey and toss until well coated.
Season with salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper.
Place the nuts in the oven for about 5 to 7 minutes, tossing regularly to toast evenly.
Cool the nuts and store them in an airtight container until needed.
Place all vinaigrette ingredients except oil in a blender.
Process until smooth, then slowly drizzle in oil.
Adjust seasoning as desired.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
To a blender carafe, add milk, vanilla bean seeds, strawberries, and ice cream. Blend until smooth. Pour into chilled mason jars, garnish with strawberries and enjoy.
ingredients: 1 fresh Tahitian vanilla bean, split and seeded
1/2 pound fresh strawberries, hulled and chopped, a few reserved for garnish
1 pint high quality vanilla ice cream

step_by_step_instructions: Split the Tahitian vanilla bean and scrape out the seeds.
Hull and chop the fresh strawberries, reserving a few for garnish.
Add the whole milk, vanilla bean seeds, chopped strawberries, and vanilla ice cream to the blender carafe.
Blend the mixture until it is smooth.
Pour the blended mixture into chilled mason jars.
Garnish with reserved strawberries.
Enjoy your beverage.

original_instructions: Scrub potatoes to clean. Slice potatoes into large, fry-like strips. Add sliced potato to bowl and cover with water. In large pot or deep fryer heat oil to 375 degrees. Drain potatoes and pat with napkin until completely dry. Blanch potatoes by briefly plunging into oil and frying until brown and crispy. Reheat oil to 375 degrees. Add blanched potatoes to oil and cook until tender but not browned. Remove fries to paper towel to drain. Season and serve.

step_by_step_instructions: Scrub potatoes to clean.
Slice potatoes into large, fry-like strips.
Add sliced potatoes to a bowl and cover with water.
In a large pot or deep fryer, heat oil to 375 degrees.
Drain potatoes and pat with a napkin until completely dry.
Blanch potatoes by briefly plunging them into oil and frying until brown and crispy.
Reheat oil to 375 degrees.
Add blanched potatoes to oil and cook until tender but not browned.
Remove fries to paper towel to drain.
Season and serve.

original_instructions:
Heat the oil in a heavy-bottom 8-quart stockpot over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until slightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
In layers, add the salt, pepper, potatoes, corn, sausage, clams, mussels and shrimp. Add the beer and thyme. Cover and bring to a boil, about 10 minutes. Lower the heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender and the clams and mussels are all open, about 20 minutes more.
Transfer to a large platter, sprinkle with the parsley and serve.
ingredients: 3 ears of corn, husked and halved
1 pound Andouille sausage, sliced 1 inch thick
1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley, for garnish

step_by_step_instructions: Heat the olive oil in a heavy-bottom 8-quart stockpot over medium-high heat.
Add the onions and cook until slightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
In layers, add the salt, pepper, potatoes, corn, sausage, clams, mussels, and shrimp.
Add the beer and thyme.
Cover and bring to a boil, about 10 minutes.
Lower the heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender and the clams and mussels are all open, about 20 minutes more.
Transfer to a large platter, sprinkle with the parsley and serve.

original_instructions:
1. In small bowl stir together flour and baking powder. Place zucchini in medium bowl. Sprinkle flour mixture over zucchini. Toss to combine. Let stand for 10 minutes.
2. In large heavy skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Meanwhile, stir KELLOGG'S CORN FLAKES cereal, cheese and onions into zucchini mixture.
3. Working in batches, drop zucchini mixture by rounded tablespoonfuls into hot oil. Use spatula to slightly flatten. Cook about 4 minutes or until browned, turning once. (Do not over-crowd the skillet.) Drain on paper towels.
For more great recipes, visit www.Kelloggs.com. ®, ™, © 2010 Kellogg NA Co.
ingredients: 2 medium zucchini, finely shredded (about 1 1/2 cups total)
2 cups Kellogg's® Corn Flakes® cereal (crushed to 1 cup)
1/2 cup finely shredded cheddar cheese (2 oz.)

step_by_step_instructions: In small bowl stir together flour and baking powder.
Place zucchini in medium bowl.
Sprinkle flour mixture over zucchini.
Toss to combine and let stand for 10 minutes.
In large heavy skillet heat oil over medium-high heat.
Meanwhile, stir crushed corn flakes cereal, cheese, and onions into zucchini mixture.
Working in batches, drop zucchini mixture by rounded tablespoonfuls into hot oil.
Use spatula to slightly flatten.
Cook about 4 minutes or until browned, turning once.
Drain on paper towels.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Combine the onion and cucumber slices in a clean spring-top jar.
Combine the remaining ingredients, with the exception of the garlic, in a non-reactive saucepan. Bring to a boil and simmer for 4 full minutes to wake up the spice flavors.
Add the garlic cloves to the jar. Slowly and gently pour the pickling liquid over the onion and cucumber slices, filling to the top of the jar.
Cool to room temperature. Top off the pickles with any remaining pickling liquid and refrigerate.

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the onion and cucumber slices in a clean spring-top jar.
Combine the water, cider vinegar, champagne vinegar, sugar, kosher salt, mustard seeds, turmeric, celery seeds, and pickling spice in a non-reactive saucepan.
Bring the mixture to a boil and simmer for 4 full minutes.
Add the garlic cloves to the jar with the onion and cucumber slices.
Slowly and gently pour the pickling liquid over the onion and cucumber slices, filling to the top of the jar.
Cool the jar to room temperature.
Top off the pickles with any remaining pickling liquid and refrigerate.

original_instructions:
Stir the cornstarch and 1/4 cup stock in a small bowl until the mixture is smooth.
Heat the remaining stock, garlic powder, broccoli, carrots, pepper and onion in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in the cornstarch mixture. Cook and stir until the mixture boils and thickens. Stir in the turkey and cook until the mixture is hot and bubbling. Toss with the spaghetti and cheese.
Tip: To save time, you can use 2 cans (4.5 ounces each) Swanson® Premium White Chunk Chicken Breast in Water, drained, for the turkey in this recipe.
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoons garlic powder or 1 clove garlic, minced
1/2 cup green or red pepper cut into 2-inch long strips
2 cups cubed cooked turkey or chicken
1/2 of a 16 ounce package spaghetti, cooked without salt, and drained (about 4 cups)

step_by_step_instructions: Stir the cornstarch and 1/4 cup stock in a small bowl until the mixture is smooth.
Heat the remaining stock, garlic powder, broccoli, carrots, pepper, and onion in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in the cornstarch mixture.
Cook and stir until the mixture boils and thickens.
Stir in the turkey and cook until the mixture is hot and bubbling.
Toss with the spaghetti and cheese.

original_instructions:
HEAT oven to 350 degrees F. Coat bottom of an 8-inch round cake pan lightly with no-stick cooking spray.
PREPARE brownie mix as directed on package using oil, water and egg. Stir in almond extract, peanut butter and peanuts until blended. Spread batter evenly into prepared pan.
BAKE 40 to 42 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan to wire rack to cool completely.
PLACE cake on serving platter. Stir fudge topping until smooth. Spread over cake, covering top and sides. Place the tip of a frosting knife at the center of cake, pulling the knife toward the outer edge in a slight arc. Turn cake a notch counter clockwise. Repeat knife pull several times to form a pattern around entire cake. Garnish center of cake with mint, if desired.
ingredients: 1 (12.35 oz.) pkg. Pillsbury® Reduced Sugar Chocolate Fudge Brownie
1/3 cup Crisco® Pure Vegetable Oil or 1/3 cup Crisco® Puritan Canola Oil with Omega-3 DHA
1 cup Jif® Extra Crunchy Peanut Butter
1 (11.75 oz.) jar Smucker's® Hot Fudge Sugar Free Ice Cream Topping
Mints leaves for garnish, if desired

step_by_step_instructions: Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Coat bottom of an 8-inch round cake pan lightly with no-stick cooking spray.
Prepare brownie mix as directed on package using oil, water and egg.
Stir in almond extract, peanut butter and peanuts until blended.
Spread batter evenly into prepared pan.
Bake 40 to 42 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes.
Remove from pan to wire rack to cool completely.
Place cake on serving platter.
Stir fudge topping until smooth.
Spread fudge topping over cake, covering top and sides.
Place tip of frosting knife at center of cake, pulling the knife toward edge in slight arc.
Turn cake a notch counter clockwise and repeat to form pattern.
Garnish center of cake with mint leaves, if desired.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook unpeeled squash in lightly salted water until crisp tender, about 15 minutes. Drain well. Scoop out most of flesh, leaving 1/4-inch thick shell. Season shell with salt and pepper. Coarsely chop chayote flesh. Set aside.
Heat oil in heavy large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and salt and saute until tender, about 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until most of liquid evaporates. Add garlic, jalapeno and cumin and saute until fragrant. Add tomatoes and reserved chayote flesh. Stir until most of liquid evaporates. Stir in epazote, bread crumbs and almonds. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Spoon mixture into shells. Sprinkle with cheese. Arrange shells in large baking pan. Pour enough hot water around shells to reach 1/4-inch. Bake until heated through, about 15 minutes.
ingredients: 1 to 2 tablespoons chopped epazote leaves or fresh oregano
1/2 cup grated Cotija or Parmesan cheese

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cook unpeeled squash in lightly salted water until crisp tender, about 15 minutes.
Drain well.
Scoop out most of flesh, leaving 1/4-inch thick shell.
Season shell with salt and pepper.
Coarsely chop chayote flesh and set aside.
Heat oil in a heavy large skillet over medium high heat.
Add onion and salt, saute until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms and cook until most of liquid evaporates.
Add garlic, jalapeno and cumin, saute until fragrant.
Add tomatoes and reserved chayote flesh, stir until most of liquid evaporates.
Stir in epazote or oregano, bread crumbs and almonds.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Spoon mixture into chayote shells.
Sprinkle shells with cheese.
Arrange shells in large baking pan.
Pour enough hot water around shells to reach 1/4-inch.
Bake until heated through, about 15 minutes.

original_instructions:
Heat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Slice the rolls into 1/4-inch pieces on the diagonal. Put them onto a baking sheet and bake them, turning once, until they are golden brown on both sides, about 10 minutes.
In a bowl combine the shrimp, tomatoes, basil pesto, and salt and pepper, to taste. Put a tablespoon of the mixture onto each piece of bread and serve.
ingredients: 10 reserved shrimp from Shrimp Scampi with Pesto Couscous recipe, tail removed and chopped
Reserved basil pesto from Shrimp Scampi with Pesto Couscous recipe
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Slice the hoagies into 1/4-inch pieces on the diagonal.
Place the sliced hoagies onto a baking sheet.
Bake the hoagies, turning once, until they are golden brown on both sides, which takes about 10 minutes.
In a bowl, combine the chopped shrimp, chopped tomatoes, basil pesto, and salt and pepper to taste.
Put a tablespoon of the shrimp mixture onto each piece of baked bread.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass. Strain into chilled martini glasses. Garnish with orange peels.;
ingredients: 1 ounce freshly squeezed honey tangerine juice

step_by_step_instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add 2 ounces of Absolut Mandarin to the mixing glass.
Add 3/4 ounce of Campari to the mixing glass.
Add 1 ounce of freshly squeezed honey tangerine juice to the mixing glass.
Shake the ingredients in the ice-filled mixing glass.
Strain the mixture into chilled martini glasses.
Garnish with orange peels.

recipe_title: Sliced Grilled Portobello Mushroom Sorta-Caesar Salads
original_instructions:
Heat a grill pan or outdoor grill to medium-high heat. Drizzle olive oil evenly over mushroom caps liberally then rub with rosemary and grill seasoning. Grill 3 to 4 minutes on each side - until dark and tender. Remove the caps and reserve.
While mushrooms cook, toast split rolls or bread under broiler until deeply golden then rub with 1 clove of cracked, split garlic. Drizzle extra-virgin olive oil over the bread and season with a little pepper then chop bread into cubes.
Rub the inside of a bowl with remaining cracked clove of garlic. Combine the lemon juice, Dijon, Worcestershire, hot sauce and anchovy paste. Whisk in 1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil. Add the greens and bread to the bowl and toss greens with dressing to coat. Add cheese to salad and toss again then season with black pepper, to taste. Top servings of salad with sliced mushrooms across the top.
ingredients: Extra-virgin olive oil for drizzling, plus 1/3 cup
8 large portobello mushroom caps, brushed clean with a damp towel
1 tablespoons finely chopped rosemary leaves, a few sprigs
1 tablespoon, a palm full, grill seasoning blend (recommended: Montreal Steak Seasoning by McCormick)
2 crusty semolina rolls or 1/2 small loaf semolina bread
2 cloves garlic, cracked away from skin
1 teaspoon hot sauce (recommended: Tabasco) eyeball it
2 teaspoons anchovy paste - a must for me, optional for you
1 cup grated Parmigiano or Romano, a few generous handfuls

step_by_step_instructions: Heat a grill pan or outdoor grill to medium-high heat.
Drizzle olive oil evenly over mushroom caps liberally.
Rub mushroom caps with rosemary and grill seasoning.
Grill mushrooms 3 to 4 minutes on each side until dark and tender.
Remove the mushroom caps and reserve.
While mushrooms cook, toast split rolls or bread under broiler until deeply golden.
Rub toasted bread with 1 clove of cracked, split garlic.
Drizzle extra-virgin olive oil over the bread and season with a little pepper.
Chop bread into cubes.
Rub the inside of a bowl with remaining cracked clove of garlic.
Combine the lemon juice, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, and anchovy paste in the bowl.
Whisk in 1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil.
Add the romaine hearts and bread to the bowl and toss with dressing to coat.
Add cheese to the salad and toss again.
Season with black pepper, to taste.
Top servings of salad with sliced mushrooms across the top.

original_instructions: Mix the ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Cook on low heat until the onions are tender and the mixture thickens.;
ingredients: Salt and cayenne pepper to taste

step_by_step_instructions: Mix the ingredients in a sauce pan.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Cook on low heat until the onions are tender and the mixture thickens.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 12-cup muffin tin. Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat and set aside. Mix flour, baking powder and salt in medium bowl. In another bowl, whisk the egg, then add the sugar. Whisk until thick and thoroughly mixed. Continue to whisk, adding the milk and melted butter. Add the sour cream and stir to combine. Fold the egg mixture into the flour mixture until well combined. Add the chopped peaches and stir until just combined.
Drop tablespoons of the batter into the muffin tins until half full. Bake for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into a muffin comes out clean. Cool muffins in tins for 10 minutes, then turn them out onto a wire rack to finish cooling. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container for up to 2 days.
ingredients: 2 large, ripe peaches (to make 1 1/2 cups chopped peaches)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lightly grease a 12-cup muffin tin.
Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat and set aside.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl.
In another bowl, whisk the egg, then add the sugar.
Whisk until thick and thoroughly mixed.
Continue to whisk, adding the milk and melted butter.
Add the sour cream and stir to combine.
Fold the egg mixture into the flour mixture until well combined.
Add the chopped peaches and stir until just combined.
Drop tablespoons of the batter into the muffin tins until half full.
Bake for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into a muffin comes out clean.
Cool muffins in tins for 10 minutes, then turn them out onto a wire rack to finish cooling.
Serve immediately or store in an airtight container for up to 2 days.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Add the tomatillos to a baking sheet along with the jalapenos and onion wedges. Toss with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and roast about 7 minutes. Turn the vegetables, add the garlic and roast until everything is slightly softened and charred, another 7 to 8 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Peel the garlic and remove the stems and seeds from the jalapenos. Add the roasted vegetables to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until still slightly chunky but well combined. Add the cilantro, lime juice and 1 teaspoon salt and pulse until incorporated. With the processor running, stream in the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil until the salsa is slightly runny but not smooth. At this point you can season with additional salt if desired.
Serve with chips or as a salsa for tacos and burritos.
ingredients: 2 pounds fresh tomatillos, husked and well rinsed
1/2 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro leaves

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Add the tomatillos to a baking sheet along with the jalapenos and onion wedges.
Toss with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
Roast about 7 minutes.
Turn the vegetables, add the garlic and roast until everything is slightly softened and charred, another 7 to 8 minutes.
Set aside to cool.
Peel the garlic and remove the stems and seeds from the jalapenos.
Add the roasted vegetables to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until still slightly chunky but well combined.
Add the cilantro, lime juice and 1 teaspoon salt and pulse until incorporated.
With the processor running, stream in the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil until the salsa is slightly runny but not smooth.
Season with additional salt if desired.
Serve with chips or as a salsa for tacos and burritos.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Heat canola oil to 350 degrees F. (Drop a very small piece of bread crumb into the oil if it starts to sizzle the oil is hot enough.)
Drain the olives.
Mix flour, garlic powder and chili powder together and place in a shallow dish. Pour eggs into another dish, and bread crumbs with ground black pepper into a third.
Roll the olives in the flour, then roll them in the beaten egg and finally roll them in the bread crumbs. Set on a plate to give the breading a chance to dry and form a crust while the oil heats.
When oil is hot, put half the olives into it, being careful not to drop them and splatter hot oil. Fry until golden brown, then remove and drain on paper towels. Be sure to tip the oil out of the center of the olive. Serve on a platter with Manchego cheese cubes and slices of serrano ham.
ingredients: 10 large or colossal green pitted olives
10 large or colossal black pitted olives

step_by_step_instructions: Heat canola oil to 350 degrees F.
Drain the olives.
Mix flour, garlic powder, and chili powder together and place in a shallow dish.
Pour beaten eggs into another dish.
Mix bread crumbs with ground black pepper in a third dish.
Roll the olives in the flour mixture.
Roll the floured olives in the beaten eggs.
Roll the egg-coated olives in the bread crumbs.
Set the breaded olives on a plate to allow the coating to dry and form a crust.
When the oil is hot, carefully put half the olives into it.
Fry the olives until golden brown.
Remove the fried olives and drain on paper towels, tipping out excess oil from the olives.
Serve the fried olives on a platter with Manchego cheese cubes and slices of serrano ham.

original_instructions:
Lay three layers of cheesecloth over a colander.
Add the milk to a large heavy pot and place over medium-high heat. Stir in the lemon juice and salt and heat until an instant-read thermometer reaches 175 degrees F. The milk will begin to just bubble and start to steam. At this temperature you'll begin to see the curds separate from the whey. Be mindful of over stirring the ricotta while the curds are forming, you don't want to make your ricotta stiff. Let it sit for 5 minutes undisturbed and you will be left with a very creamy and pleasant finished result.
Gently remove the curds from the pot to the colander. Use the side of the cheesecloth to very gently release some of the liquid. Tie up the curds using butcher's twine and let drain for 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from the cheesecloth and place in a bowl. Serve warm on toasted bread with lemon zest and a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons lemon juice, plus the zest of 1 lemon

step_by_step_instructions: Lay three layers of cheesecloth over a colander.
Add the milk to a large heavy pot and place over medium-high heat.
Stir in the lemon juice and salt.
Heat until an instant-read thermometer reaches 175 degrees F.
Watch for the milk to begin to bubble and steam, and for the curds to separate from the whey.
Let the mixture sit undisturbed for 5 minutes.
Gently remove the curds from the pot to the colander.
Use the side of the cheesecloth to gently release some of the liquid.
Tie up the curds using butcher's twine and let drain for 5 to 10 minutes.
Remove the curds from the cheesecloth and place in a bowl.
Serve the ricotta warm on toasted bread with lemon zest and a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil.

original_instructions:
Cook the chicken in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat for 10 minutes or until it's well browned on both sides. Remove the chicken from the skillet.
Stir the stock, orange juice, onion and rice in the skillet and heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Return the chicken to the skillet. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until the chicken is cooked though and the rice is tender. Stir in the parsley.
Tip: For a special touch, cook orange slices in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until they're lightly browned. Serve over the chicken.
ingredients: 1 1/4 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
1 3/4 cups Swanson® Chicken Broth or Swanson® Chicken Stock
1 cup uncooked regular long-grain white rice

step_by_step_instructions: Cook the chicken in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat for 10 minutes or until it's well browned on both sides.
Remove the chicken from the skillet.
Stir the stock, orange juice, onion, and rice in the skillet and heat to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 10 minutes.
Return the chicken to the skillet, cover, and cook for 10 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the rice is tender.
Stir in the parsley.
For a special touch, cook orange slices in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until they're lightly browned and serve them over the chicken.

original_instructions:
Combine the pork with 1 1/2 cups of the BBQ sauce in a medium saucepan, bring to a simmer over low heat and cook until heated through, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine the black beans, the remaining 1/2 cup BBQ sauce, a splash of water and some salt and pepper in a medium saucepan. Bring to a simmer and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, crack the eggs into the pan, season the tops with salt and pepper and cook until the whites are milky white and the yolks are slightly firm, about 4 minutes.
Scatter the chips on a platter and scatter half of the Cheddar and Monterey jack over the top. Now spoon on the hot pork and beans and top with the remaining cheese. Sprinkle the cilantro and green onions over the top. Slide the eggs in a single layer on top and sprinkle with the pickled onions. Cut into wedges and serve.
ingredients: 2 cups of your favorite BBQ sauce
2 cans black beans, drained, rinsed and drained again
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/2 cup pickled onions or chiles or a combination

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the pork with 1 1/2 cups of the BBQ sauce in a medium saucepan.
Bring the pork and BBQ sauce mixture to a simmer over low heat and cook until heated through, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine the black beans, the remaining 1/2 cup BBQ sauce, a splash of water, and some salt and pepper in another medium saucepan.
