Bring the beans mixture to a simmer and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Crack the eggs into the pan, season the tops with salt and pepper, and cook until the whites are milky white and the yolks are slightly firm, about 4 minutes.
Scatter the chips on a platter.
Scatter half of the Cheddar and Monterey jack over the top of the chips.
Spoon on the hot pork and beans over the chips and cheese.
Top with the remaining cheese.
Sprinkle the cilantro and green onions over the top.
Slide the eggs in a single layer on top.
Sprinkle with the pickled onions.
Cut into wedges and serve.

original_instructions:
In a large soup pot, heat the oil and saute the onion until softened. Add the broccoli and saute for one minute. Add the stock and salt and cook covered until broccoli is tender, about 10 to 15 minutes. Puree in a blender until smooth, thin with heated milk.
TIP:
LOOKS LIKE BROCCOLI.... BROCCOLI RABE
Trim off the bottom, tough stems of the broccoli rabe, wash well. Slice stems into 1/2-inch pieces and saute with whole peeled garlic cloves in olive oil. After 5 minutes add florets, saute until slightly tender, add a pinch of Italian red pepper and serve over pasta
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds broccoli, florets and top third of stalks, cut into chunks

step_by_step_instructions: In a large soup pot, heat the oil.
Saute the onion until softened.
Add the broccoli and saute for one minute.
Add the stock and salt.
Cook covered until broccoli is tender, about 10 to 15 minutes.
Puree in a blender until smooth.
Thin with heated milk.
Garnish with cheddar croutons.

original_instructions:
Finely grind coriander seeds in an electric coffee/spice grinder or with a mortar and pestle.
Bring water, 2 tablespoons oil, and salt to a boil in a 1 1/2 to 2-quart heavy saucepan. Stir in couscous and coriander seeds, then cover pan and remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes.
Fluff couscous with a fork and stir in remaining tablespoon oil, apricots, parsley, and salt and pepper, to taste.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon coriander seeds, toasted and cooled
1/3 cup dried California apricots, finely chopped
2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley

step_by_step_instructions: Finely grind coriander seeds in an electric coffee/spice grinder or with a mortar and pestle.
Bring water, 2 tablespoons oil, and salt to a boil in a 1 1/2 to 2-quart heavy saucepan.
Stir in couscous and coriander seeds, then cover the pan and remove from heat.
Let stand for 5 minutes.
Fluff couscous with a fork and stir in remaining tablespoon of oil, apricots, parsley, salt, and pepper to taste.

recipe_title: POTATO-HORSERADISH CRUSTED RED SNAPPER WITH ROASTED PEPPER RELISH
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Season each fillet to taste with salt and pepper. Combine the potato and horseradish and spread the mixture over the top of each fillet, pressing it down so it will adhere.
Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat until almost smoking. Sear each fillet potato-side down until a crust forms, about 3 minutes. Turn the fillets over and finish cooking in the oven until done, about 5 minutes for medium. Place on a large serving platter and top each fillet with some relish. Serve any remaining relish on the side.
In a mixing bowl, combine the bell peppers, olives, pepper flakes, garlic, thyme, parsley, vinegar, honey, and oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. May be refrigerated up to 1 day. Serve at room temperature.
ingredients: 8 red snapper fillets, 5 to 6 ounces each
1 large potato, peeled and finely grated
2 red bell peppers, roasted, peeled, seeded and diced
2 yellow bell peppers, roasted, peeled, seeded and diced

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Season each fillet to taste with salt and pepper.
Combine the potato and horseradish and spread the mixture over the top of each fillet, pressing it down so it will adhere.
Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat until almost smoking.
Sear each fillet potato-side down until a crust forms, about 3 minutes.
Turn the fillets over and finish cooking in the oven until done, about 5 minutes for medium.
Place on a large serving platter and top each fillet with some relish.
Serve any remaining relish on the side.
In a mixing bowl, combine the bell peppers, olives, pepper flakes, garlic, thyme, parsley, vinegar, honey, and oil.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
May be refrigerated up to 1 day.
Serve at room temperature.

original_instructions: Saute mushrooms in butter in a skillet 5 to 8 minutes over moderate heat until golden. Place all remaining ingredients in a bowl, add mushrooms and toss lightly to mix.
ingredients: 1/2 pound mushrooms, wiped clean and sliced thin

step_by_step_instructions: Saute mushrooms in butter in a skillet over moderate heat until golden, for 5 to 8 minutes.
Place all remaining ingredients in a bowl.
Add mushrooms to the bowl and toss lightly to mix.

original_instructions:
Put the milk and chocolate into an earthenware pot and cook over a low heat until the chocolate has melted. Stir constantly so that it does not stick to the pan.
When the chocolate comes to a boil, lower the heat and beat vigorously with a molinillo until a thick foam rises to the top.
Serve hot in earthenware mugs.

step_by_step_instructions: Put the milk and chocolate into an earthenware pot.
Cook over a low heat until the chocolate has melted.
Stir constantly so that it does not stick to the pan.
When the chocolate comes to a boil, lower the heat.
Beat vigorously with a molinillo until a thick foam rises to the top.
Serve hot in earthenware mugs.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Add all the ingredients to a bowl and mix well. Serve with black pepper potato chips.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Add all the ingredients to a bowl.
Mix well.
Serve with black pepper potato chips.

original_instructions: In a large bowl, combine cabbage and carrots. In a smaller bowl, make dressing by combining mayonnaise, vinegar, celery seed, sugar, salt and pepper. Toss dressing into cabbage mixture and let chill. Serve in a family style bowl.

step_by_step_instructions: In a large bowl, combine cabbage and carrots.
In a smaller bowl, make dressing by combining mayonnaise, vinegar, celery seed, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Toss dressing into cabbage mixture and let chill.
Serve in a family style bowl.

original_instructions: Juice, in this order, the beets, apples and carrots, following your juicer's specific settings for each. Stir in the chia seeds if using and let soak for 5 minutes. Serve the juice immediately over ice, if desired.
ingredients: 1 Granny Smith apple, peeled and cored

step_by_step_instructions: Juice the beets using your juicer's specific settings.
Juice the apple next using the appropriate settings.
Juice the carrots following your juicer's instructions.
Stir in the chia seeds if using and let soak for 5 minutes.
Serve the juice immediately over ice, if desired.

original_instructions:
Hollow out 4 tomatoes, . Season with salt and pepper and invert to drain. Cook 2 bacon slices with 1 garlic clove; chop, then toss with 1/2 cup chopped lettuce, 1/2 cup chopped stale bread cubes, 2 tablespoons mayonnaise and salt and pepper. Stuff into the tomatoes, then brush with the bacon drippings. Bake 20 to 30 minutes at 425 degrees F.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos

step_by_step_instructions: Hollow out 4 tomatoes and season with salt and pepper.
Invert the tomatoes to drain.
Cook 2 bacon slices with 1 garlic clove.
Chop the bacon and garlic, then toss with 1/2 cup chopped lettuce, 1/2 cup chopped stale bread cubes, 2 tablespoons mayonnaise, salt and pepper.
Stuff the mixture into the tomatoes.
Brush the stuffed tomatoes with the bacon drippings.
Bake the stuffed tomatoes for 20 to 30 minutes at 425 degrees F.

original_instructions: Combine the masa harina, water and salt in a large mixing bowl, and stir until smooth. The dough should be slightly sticky and form a ball when pressed together. To test, flatten a small ball of dough between your palms. If the edges crack, add water to the dough, a tablespoon at a time, until a test piece does not crack.
ingredients: 4 cups finely ground deep yellow masa harina

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the masa harina, water, and salt in a large mixing bowl.
Stir the mixture until it is smooth.
Test the dough by pressing a small ball between your palms.
If the edges crack, add water to the dough, a tablespoon at a time, and retest until the dough does not crack.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Rub the potatoes with some olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Put the potatoes on a foil-lined baking sheet and bake until the insides are soft and the outsides are crisp, 1 hour to 1 hour 30 minutes (the baking time will depend on the size of your potatoes).
Carefully split the potatoes lengthwise and scoop out the contents into the bowl of a stand mixer (reserve the potato skins on the baking sheet). Add the blue cheese, hot sauce, cream cheese, jalapenos and some salt and pepper to the mixer bowl and mix until combined using the paddle attachment.
Spoon the mixture into the potato skins, then top with the Cheddar. Bake until the contents are warmed through and the Cheddar is melted, 15 to 20 minutes.
Drizzle the potatoes with the ranch dressing and top with the chopped chives. Serve warm.
ingredients: Extra-virgin olive oil, for oiling the potatoes
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2/3 cup hot sauce, such as Frank's

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Rub the potatoes with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Put the potatoes on a foil-lined baking sheet.
Bake the potatoes until the insides are soft and the outsides are crisp, for 1 hour to 1 hour 30 minutes.
Carefully split the potatoes lengthwise and scoop out the contents into the bowl of a stand mixer, reserving the potato skins on the baking sheet.
Add blue cheese, hot sauce, cream cheese, jalapenos, salt, and pepper to the mixer bowl.
Mix the contents using the paddle attachment until combined.
Spoon the mixture into the potato skins.
Top the filled potato skins with Cheddar cheese.
Bake the potatoes until the contents are warmed through and the Cheddar is melted, 15 to 20 minutes.
Drizzle the potatoes with ranch dressing.
Top with the chopped chives.
Serve warm.

original_instructions:
Slice the cheese 1/2inch thick and place in a bowl of ice water for about 5 minutes. Pat the cheese dry and dust with the flour, shaking off any excess.
Heat a large cast iron skillet, over a high heat. Add the oil and fry the cheese, turning once, until golden brown. USE CAUTION: Standing far enough back so you do not get near the flames, ignite the tequila. Let the flames die out.
Remove the cheese and tequila to a platter and finish with a sprinkling of lime juice. Serve with pickled chipotle peppers and warm corn tortillas.

step_by_step_instructions: Slice the cheese 1/2 inch thick and place in a bowl of ice water for about 5 minutes.
Pat the cheese dry and dust with the flour, shaking off any excess.
Heat a large cast iron skillet over high heat.
Add the oil and fry the cheese, turning once, until golden brown.
Use caution: standing far enough back so you do not get near the flames, ignite the tequila.
Let the flames die out.
Remove the cheese and tequila to a platter.
Finish with a sprinkling of lime juice.
Serve with pickled chipotle peppers and warm corn tortillas.

recipe_title: Black Runner Bean, Rice and Mango Salad
original_instructions: Mix the ingredients together and season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: Up to 1/3 cup dressing of choice made with olive oil, white wine vinegar and toasted chili powder
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Mix the cooked beans, cooked rice, celery, mango, red onion, cilantro, and dressing together in a bowl.
Season the mixture with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Cook the bacon over medium-high heat in a 12-inch nonstick skillet, stirring occasionally, until crisp, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove the bacon using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Add the potatoes, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper to the pan juices. Cook, stirring frequently, until brown and crisp, about 25 minutes. Remove the potatoes using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Add the oil, onion, bell pepper, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the spinach, salami, nutmeg, orange zest, the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt and pepper. Cook until the spinach is wilted, about 4 minutes. Stir in the bacon and potatoes.
Make 4 indentations in the hash and break an egg into each. Cook until the eggs are cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes.
ingredients: 8 ounces apple-smoked bacon (5 to 6 slices), cut into 1/2-inch pieces
2 medium russet potatoes (about 1 1/2 pounds), peeled and chopped into 1-inch cubes
1 red bell pepper, cored, seeded and cut into 1/2-inch pieces
5 ounces dry salami, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes

step_by_step_instructions: Cook the bacon over medium-high heat in a 12-inch nonstick skillet, stirring occasionally, until crisp, about 10 to 12 minutes.
Remove the bacon using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Add the potatoes, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper to the pan juices.
Cook the potatoes, stirring frequently, until brown and crisp, about 25 minutes.
Remove the potatoes using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Add the oil, onion, bell pepper, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper to the skillet.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the spinach, salami, nutmeg, orange zest, and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt and pepper.
Cook until the spinach is wilted, about 4 minutes.
Stir in the bacon and potatoes.
Make 4 indentations in the hash and break an egg into each.
Cook until the eggs are cooked through, about 5 to 6 minutes.

original_instructions: Dip the rim of tall glasses into the egg whites, and then the sugar. Put the rum, Triple Sec, and juices into a cocktail shaker. Shake to mix. Fill the glasses with the ice and pour the cocktail over it. Decorate with cherries, pineapple, and/or orange slices, and drink with a straw.

step_by_step_instructions: Dip the rim of tall glasses into the egg whites.
Then dip the rim into the sugar.
Put the rum, Triple Sec, and juices into a cocktail shaker.
Shake to mix.
Fill the glasses with the ice.
Pour the cocktail over the ice.
Decorate with cherries, pineapple, and/or orange slices.
Drink with a straw.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Coat each Cornish hen with 2 tablespoons of the butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Into the cavity of each bird, insert a lemon half, an onion quarter, half a garlic head and 3 thyme sprigs. Set aside.
Spread the carrots and potatoes in an even layer in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish or roasting pan. Add the chicken broth and then the prepared Cornish hens. Roast until the juices run clear and the hens are golden brown, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
8 carrots, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces
4 potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Coat each Cornish hen with 2 tablespoons of butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Into the cavity of each bird, insert a lemon half, an onion quarter, half a garlic head, and 3 thyme sprigs.
Set aside the prepared Cornish hens.
Spread the carrots and potatoes in an even layer in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish or roasting pan.
Add the chicken broth to the baking dish.
Place the prepared Cornish hens on top of the carrots and potatoes.
Roast in the oven until the juices run clear and the hens are golden brown, about 45 minutes to 1 hour.

original_instructions:
To prepare the greens: cut away the tough stalks and stems from the collards and discard any leaves that are bruised or yellow. Fill the sink with water and salt, the salt helps to remove any impurities. Wash the collards thoroughly to remove the grit, 2 or 3 times, until the water runs clear. Dry thoroughly. Stack up several leaves and roll up lengthwise in a bundle, cut them into 1-inch ribbons. Repeat until all the leaves are shredded.
Heat a large deep skillet over medium flame and coat with the oil. Add the garlic and saute for 2 minutes to soften. Add the greens and toss well with the oil and garlic. Pour in the chicken broth and cook for 45 minutes to 1 hour until the greens are wilted and tender; take care not to overcook. Season with salt and pepper and serve.
ingredients: 2 bunches collard or kale greens, about 2 pounds
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Cut away the tough stalks and stems from the collard greens.
Discard any leaves that are bruised or yellow.
Fill the sink with water and salt.
Wash the collard greens thoroughly 2 or 3 times until the water runs clear.
Dry the collard greens thoroughly.
Stack up several leaves and roll them up lengthwise in a bundle.
Cut the rolled leaves into 1-inch ribbons.
Repeat until all the leaves are shredded.
Heat a large deep skillet over medium flame and coat with the oil.
Add the garlic and saute for 2 minutes to soften.
Add the shredded greens and toss well with the oil and garlic.
Pour in the chicken broth.
Cook for 45 minutes to 1 hour until the greens are wilted and tender, ensuring not to overcook.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve.

recipe_title: Cafe au Lait Pots de Creme
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 275 degrees F.
Combine heavy cream, half-and-half, vanilla bean, and sugar in a 1-quart heavy saucepan. Heat over medium-low heat until mixture reaches 180 degrees F. Stir in instant coffee until dissolved. Place egg yolks in a heat-proof bowl and temper the yolks by gradually adding some of the hot cream mixture. Return the egg mixture to the pan with the remaining cream mixture. Stir in the vanilla. Strain custard and then ladle 5 to 6 ounces into 8 custard cups or ramekins. Bake, covered, in a water bath for about 40 minutes or until set. Check at 30 minutes; you may need to reduce the oven temperature to 250 degrees F for the remaining 10 minutes. The centers should not be firm. Cool to room temperature and then refrigerate if not serving right away. Bring to room temperature before serving. Garnish with whipped cream.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 275 degrees F.
Combine heavy cream, half-and-half, vanilla bean, and sugar in a 1-quart heavy saucepan.
Heat mixture over medium-low heat until it reaches 180 degrees F.
Stir in instant coffee until dissolved.
Place egg yolks in a heat-proof bowl.
Temper the yolks by gradually adding some of the hot cream mixture.
Return the egg mixture to the pan with the remaining cream mixture.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Strain the custard.
Ladle 5 to 6 ounces into 8 custard cups or ramekins.
Bake, covered, in a water bath for about 40 minutes or until set. Check at 30 minutes; you may need to reduce the oven temperature to 250 degrees F for the remaining 10 minutes.
The centers should not be firm.
Cool to room temperature.
Refrigerate if not serving right away.
Bring to room temperature before serving.
Garnish with whipped cream.

original_instructions: Combine the water, honey, lemon juice and mint leaves in a pitcher. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to allow the flavors to meld.

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the water, honey, lemon juice, and mint leaves in a pitcher.
Cover the pitcher and refrigerate the mixture for at least 2 hours to allow the flavors to meld.

original_instructions:
Whisk 2 or 3 minced garlic cloves with 2 egg yolks. Gradually whisk in 1 1/2 cups olive oil. Add lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste; thin with water as needed. Serve with crudites.
Olive Aioli
Make Aioli. Stir in 3 tablespoons store-bought olive tapenade.
Orange-Saffron Aioli
Make Aioli with orange juice instead of lemon. Steep 1/2 teaspoon saffron in 2 tablespoons Pernod for 5 minutes, then add to the aioli
See all 50 Game-Day Dips
Photographs by Antonis Achilleos

step_by_step_instructions: Mince 2 or 3 garlic cloves.
Whisk the minced garlic cloves with 2 egg yolks.
Gradually whisk in 1 1/2 cups of olive oil.
Add lemon juice, salt, and pepper to taste.
Thin with water as needed.
Serve the aioli with crudites.

recipe_title: Chicken Fried Steak and Creamy Gravy
original_instructions: Season steaks with salt and pepper. Reserve 1/4 cup of flour. Dredge each steak in flour, egg and cracker crumbs. In a large cast iron skillet over medium high heat corn oil. Add steaks and cook until golden brown and crisp. Transfer to paper towels to drain. Pour off all but 4 tablespoon remaining oil and set over low heat. Whisk 1/4 flour into hot oil and bring to simmer. Gradually whisk in milk and bring to a simmer. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: 2 pounds round steak, cut 1/2-inch thick and pounded with mallet

step_by_step_instructions: Season steaks with salt and pepper.
Reserve 1/4 cup of flour.
Dredge each steak in flour, then egg, then cracker crumbs.
In a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat, add corn oil.
Add steaks to the skillet and cook until golden brown and crisp.
Transfer steaks to paper towels to drain.
Pour off all but 4 tablespoons of remaining oil and set over low heat.
Whisk 1/4 cup of reserved flour into hot oil and bring to a simmer.
Gradually whisk in milk and bring to a simmer.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper.

recipe_title: New York Strip Steak with Cognac Butter and Portobello Mushroom Ragout
original_instructions:
To prepare the steaks: Rub steaks with garlic clove, salt and cracked pepper. Marinate in Worcestershire sauce for 1 hour, minimum.
To prepare the ragout: Grill mushrooms whole, then coarsely chop into 3/4-inch cubes. Pour olive oil in pan, add mushrooms and shallots, and saute until soft. Add tomatoes, heavy cream, and stock. Simmer and reduce for about 10 minutes. Add herbs and seasonings and remove from heat. Keep warm if using immediately.
To cook steaks and prepare cognac butter: Sear steaks in a heavy skillet on high heat to desired temperature, remove from heat. Add cognac and flame off, then whisk in the butter.
Place mushroom ragout on plate. Cut steaks across the grain into 1/2-inch slices. Fan steaks on top of ragout and drizzle with cognac butter. Garnish as desired. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 4 (12 ounce) NY strip steaks or tenderloin or sirloin steaks

step_by_step_instructions: Rub the steaks with the garlic clove, salt, and cracked pepper.
Marinate the steaks in Worcestershire sauce for 1 hour, minimum.
Grill the mushrooms whole, then coarsely chop them into 3/4-inch cubes.
Pour olive oil into the pan.
Add mushrooms and shallots to the pan and saute until soft.
Add tomatoes, heavy cream, and stock to the pan.
Simmer the mixture and reduce for about 10 minutes.
Add herbs and seasonings, then remove the pan from heat and keep warm if using immediately.
Sear the steaks in a heavy skillet on high heat to the desired temperature, then remove from heat.
Add cognac to the skillet and flame off, then whisk in the butter.
Place the mushroom ragout on a plate.
Cut the steaks across the grain into 1/2-inch slices.
Fan the steak slices on top of the ragout.
Drizzle the steak with cognac butter.
Garnish as desired and serve immediately.

original_instructions: Heat oil in fryer to 350 degrees F. Add French fries to the hot oil (may need to do in separate batches). Shake the basket so they do not stick. Let them reach a golden brown and then drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.
ingredients: 2 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and cut into French fries

step_by_step_instructions: Heat oil in fryer to 350 degrees F.
Add French fries to the hot oil. You may need to do this in separate batches.
Shake the basket so the fries do not stick.
Let the fries reach a golden brown color.
Drain the fries on paper towels.
Sprinkle the fries with salt.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Bake the potatoes on a rack for 1 hour or until soft. Allow them to cool slightly.
Cut the potatoes in 1/2, scoop out the pulp, and place in a mixing bowl, setting the skins aside. Add the butter, salt, black pepper, and cayenne. Mash well, adding enough milk to make a fairly stiff mixture. Add the beaten egg yolks and stir well.
Spoon the mixture into the potato skins and top with shredded cheese. Place on a cookie sheet and bake for 20 minutes, until well browned.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
Bake the potatoes on a rack for 1 hour or until soft.
Allow them to cool slightly.
Cut the potatoes in half and scoop out the pulp, placing it in a mixing bowl and setting the skins aside.
Mash the potato pulp with butter, salt, black pepper, and cayenne.
Add enough milk to make a fairly stiff mixture.
Stir in the beaten egg yolks.
Spoon the mixture back into the potato skins.
Top each filled potato skin with shredded cheese.
Place the filled potato skins on a cookie sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, until well browned.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 10-inch springform pan.
In the top of the double boiler over simmering water, combine the chocolate and butter. Heat until melted and smooth. Transfer to a medium-size bowl and whisk in the egg yolks and vanilla. Sift in the sugar, salt, and cocoa while continuing to whisk.
With a mixer, whip the egg whites to soft peaks. Fold one third of them into the chocolate mixture. Repeat with the remaining whites, then pour the mixture into the prepared pan. Place on the lower rack of the oven and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove to a cake rack and immediately loosen the springform collar (sides). Slip a plate inside the collar on top of the cake and push down slightly to push the air from the cake. Remove the plate and springform collar, and allow the cake to cool before serving.
ingredients: 7 ounces extra bittersweet chocolate (do not use baking chocolate)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Grease a 10-inch springform pan.
In the top of the double boiler over simmering water, combine the chocolate and butter.
Heat until melted and smooth.
Transfer to a medium-size bowl and whisk in the egg yolks and vanilla.
Sift in the sugar, salt, and cocoa while continuing to whisk.
With a mixer, whip the egg whites to soft peaks.
Fold one third of them into the chocolate mixture.
Repeat with the remaining whites, then pour the mixture into the prepared pan.
Place on the lower rack of the oven and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove to a cake rack and immediately loosen the springform collar (sides).
Slip a plate inside the collar on top of the cake and push down slightly to push the air from the cake.
Remove the plate and springform collar, and allow the cake to cool before serving.

original_instructions:
Make the tuna sauce: Puree the tuna, anchovies, mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons olive oil, the lemon juice and 2 tablespoons water in a blender until smooth.
Place each turkey cutlet between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound with a meat mallet or heavy skillet until 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick. Brush with the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and lightly brush with olive oil. Grill the turkey, in batches if necessary, until just cooked through, about 2 minutes per side.
Pile the arugula, tomatoes and capers in the center of the turkey cutlets. Drizzle with half of the tuna sauce and roll up to enclose. Drizzle with the remaining sauce and sprinkle with the basil.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos
ingredients: 1 5-ounce can tuna packed in olive oil (preferably Italian), drained
3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Make the tuna sauce: Puree the tuna, anchovies, mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons olive oil, lemon juice and 2 tablespoons water in a blender until smooth.
Place each turkey cutlet between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound with a meat mallet or heavy skillet until 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick.
Brush with the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and lightly brush with olive oil.
Grill the turkey, in batches if necessary, until just cooked through, about 2 minutes per side.
Pile the arugula, tomatoes and capers in the center of the turkey cutlets.
Drizzle with half of the tuna sauce and roll up to enclose.
Drizzle with the remaining sauce and sprinkle with basil.

original_instructions:
In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil and butter until the oil is shimmering and the butter is melted, about 2 minutes. Add the onion and carrots and saute until the onions are tender, 5 to 8 minutes. Add the mushrooms and rice and cook for 5 minutes more, toasting the rice. Add the garlic.
Add the stock. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Add the kale and kohlrabi, cover and simmer until the wild rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
ingredients: 2 cups (about 12 ounces) fresh cremini mushrooms, quartered
6 cups chicken stock, plus more as needed
1 bunch kale, stemmed and cut into bite-size pieces
1 kohlrabi, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch half-moons
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Heat olive oil and butter in a large saucepan over medium heat until the oil is shimmering and the butter is melted, about 2 minutes.
Add the onion and carrots and saute until the onions are tender, 5 to 8 minutes.
Add the mushrooms and rice and cook for 5 minutes more, toasting the rice.
Add the garlic and chicken stock.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low.
Add the kale and kohlrabi, cover and simmer until the wild rice is tender, about 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

original_instructions:
1.In a large mixing bowl, coarsely mash avocados, leaving some chunks.
2.Add the remaining ingredients and mix.
3.Season with salt & pepper.
Serving Suggestions: Serve with fresh, warm tortilla chips.
Beverage Pairings: Try with a locally brewed Southern California beer or a Southern California wine.
ingredients: 7 ripe, Fresh California Avocados, seeded and peeled * (See Cook's Note)

step_by_step_instructions: Coarsely mash avocados in a large mixing bowl, leaving some chunks.
Add chopped cilantro, chopped tomato, chopped red onion, lime juice, cumin, chile powder, chopped roasted poblano chile, and minced garlic to the avocado.
Mix all ingredients together.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the mushrooms and garlic and sweat. Add the beet greens and mix well. Remove pan from heat. Season with salt and pepper.
In a separate bowl, combine the egg yolks, ricotta, Parmesan cheese, and salt. Combine everything and put into a lightly oiled 9 by 11-inch baking dish. Top with the crumbled crackers and bake for 30 minutes covered. Uncover and bake for an additional 15 minutes.
ingredients: 1 pound beet greens, cleaned and picked
Kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Melt the butter in a saucepan.
Add the mushrooms and garlic to the saucepan and sweat.
Add the beet greens and mix well.
Remove pan from heat and season with salt and pepper.
In a separate bowl, combine the egg yolks, ricotta, Parmesan cheese, and salt.
Combine everything and put into a lightly oiled 9 by 11-inch baking dish.
Top the mixture with crumbled crackers.
Bake for 30 minutes covered.
Uncover and bake for an additional 15 minutes.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut the cores from the tomatoes, removing as little as possible. Cut them in half crosswise and, with your fingers, remove the seeds and juice. Place the tomato halves in a baking dish.
In a bowl, combine the bread crumbs, scallions, basil, parsley, garlic, thyme, and 1 teaspoon salt. Sprinkle the tomato halves generously with salt and pepper. With your hands, fill the cavities and cover the tops of the tomatoes with the bread crumb mixture. Bake the tomatoes for 15 minutes, or until they're tender. Sprinkle with the cheese, drizzle with olive oil, and bake for 30 seconds more. Serve hot or at room temperature.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups fresh white bread crumbs (5 slices, crusts removed)
1/4 cup minced scallions, white and green parts (2 scallions)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut the cores from the tomatoes, removing as little as possible.
Cut the tomatoes in half crosswise and remove the seeds and juice with your fingers.
Place the tomato halves in a baking dish.
In a bowl, combine the bread crumbs, scallions, basil, parsley, garlic, thyme, and 1 teaspoon salt.
Sprinkle the tomato halves generously with salt and pepper.
Fill the cavities and cover the tops of the tomatoes with the bread crumb mixture.
Bake the tomatoes for 15 minutes or until tender.
Sprinkle with cheese, drizzle with olive oil, and bake for 30 seconds more.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
For the vanilla-white chocolate whipped cream: Heat the cream and vanilla in a pot, stirring, until it starts to steam (do not let it boil). Discard the vanilla bean. Place the white chocolate in a bowl, and pour the cream on top, mixing until melted. Refrigerate covered until completely cool, about 1 hour. Whip until soft peaks form using a whisk or electric hand mixer.
Mix the strawberries with the sugar in a bowl. Spoon some whipped cream into the bottom of a glass, and then top with a layer of strawberries and a layer of cake. Repeat until the glass is full. Garnish with a dollop of whipped cream and more strawberry slices.

step_by_step_instructions: Heat the cream and vanilla in a pot, stirring, until it starts to steam. Do not let it boil.
Discard the vanilla bean.
Place the white chocolate in a bowl, and pour the cream on top, mixing until melted.
Refrigerate the mixture covered until completely cool, about 1 hour.
Whip until soft peaks form using a whisk or electric hand mixer.
Mix the strawberries with the sugar in a bowl.
Spoon some whipped cream into the bottom of a glass.
Top with a layer of strawberries and a layer of cake.
Repeat the layering until the glass is full.
Garnish with a dollop of whipped cream and more strawberry slices.

original_instructions: Soak the slices of bread in cold water. When tender, squeeze the bread to express the water. In a food processor puree until smooth the almonds, pepper, cucumbers, vinegar, sugar, scallions and olive oil. Slowly add the ice water until you reach the consistency you like; season to taste with salt and pepper. Chill, covered, until serving time; garnish with cucumber, chives and bell pepper.
ingredients: 3 1inch thick slices French bread, crusts removed
2 ounces blanched whole almonds, roughly chopped
1 green bell pepper, seeded and roughly chopped
3 kirby cucumbers, peeled, seeded and chopped
4 cups (more or less) iced cold water
Salt and freshly ground white pepper
Garnish: seeded finely diced cucumber, chives and finely diced seeded red bell pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Soak the slices of bread in cold water.
When tender, squeeze the bread to express the water.
In a food processor, puree until smooth the almonds, pepper, cucumbers, vinegar, sugar, scallions, and olive oil.
Slowly add the ice water until you reach the desired consistency.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Chill the mixture, covered, until serving time.
Garnish with cucumber, chives, and bell pepper before serving.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until softened, about 1 minute. Add 1 cup water, the quinoa, chicken broth, tomatoes, 1/4 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper; bring to a simmer, stirring. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover and cook until the quinoa is tender and the liquid is mostly absorbed, 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the cheese and parsley. Cover to keep warm.
Meanwhile, toss the broccoli with the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil on a baking sheet; season with salt and pepper. Add the kielbasa to the baking sheet. Roast until the broccoli starts browning and the kielbasa is hot throughout, 15 to 18 minutes. Let cool slightly, then slice the kielbasa. Serve the quinoa topped with the kielbasa, broccoli and more cheese.
Photograph by Charles Masters
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
1 small head broccoli, cut into florets

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until softened, about 1 minute.
Add 1 cup water, the quinoa, chicken broth, tomatoes, 1/4 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper; bring to a simmer, stirring.
Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover and cook until the quinoa is tender and the liquid is mostly absorbed, 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove from the heat and stir in the cheese and parsley. Cover to keep warm.
Toss the broccoli with the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil on a baking sheet; season with salt and pepper.
Add the kielbasa to the baking sheet.
Roast until the broccoli starts browning and the kielbasa is hot throughout, 15 to 18 minutes.
Let cool slightly, then slice the kielbasa.
Serve the quinoa topped with the kielbasa, broccoli and more cheese.

original_instructions:
Slice a piece of cucumber and reserve for garnish. Peel, halve and seed the remaining cucumber. Puree in a blender until smooth, then strain through a fine mesh sieve.
Fill a highball glass three-quarters of the way with ice. Add 2 ounces cucumber puree, the gin, lime juice and simple syrup and stir. (To make a batch of simple syrup, simmer equal parts sugar and water in a saucepan until the sugar dissolves, then cool.) Fill the glass with seltzer and stir again. Garnish with the reserved cucumber slice.
Photograph by Jonathan Kantor

step_by_step_instructions: Slice a piece of cucumber and reserve for garnish.
Peel, halve and seed the remaining cucumber.
Puree in a blender until smooth, then strain through a fine mesh sieve.
Fill a highball glass three-quarters of the way with ice.
Add 2 ounces cucumber puree, the gin, lime juice and simple syrup and stir.
Fill the glass with seltzer and stir again.
Garnish with the reserved cucumber slice.

original_instructions: In an ice-filled mixing glass, stir together 3 dashes Peychaud bitters, 3 dashes Angostura bitters, 2 ounces bourbon, and simple syrup or sugar. Into chilled rocks glasses, add a splash of Ricard, swirl, and pour out. Strain the Sazerac into the chilled rocks glasses. Garnish with lemon peels.
ingredients: 1 ounce simple syrup or 1 teaspoon sugar

step_by_step_instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add 3 dashes of Peychaud bitters.
Add 3 dashes of Angostura bitters.
Add 2 ounces of bourbon.
Add 1 ounce of simple syrup.
Stir the mixture together.
Add a splash of Ricard to chilled rocks glasses.
Swirl the Ricard around the glasses and pour out the excess.
Strain the Sazerac mixture into the prepared rocks glasses.
Garnish with lemon peels.

original_instructions:
In a skillet heat olive oil until smoking. Dredge eggplant slices in flour and fry in skillet for about 1 minute. Turn slices and cook for another minute. Remove from skillet and drain on paper towels. Let cool for about 15 minutes. Blanch spinach in boiling salted water for about 3 minutes. Remove, drain, and chop coarsely. To a blender add chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, salt and pepper, to taste.
Place 2 to 3 tablespoons of the spinach-ricotta mixture on 1 slice of eggplant. Roll up and serve with tomato sauce.
In a saucepan, heat olive oil. Add garlic and cook for about 3 minutes. Add tomatoes, simmer for about 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: 1 large eggplant, peeled and sliced into 1/8-inch thick slices, lengthwise

step_by_step_instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet until smoking.
Dredge eggplant slices in flour.
Fry eggplant slices in the skillet for about 1 minute.
Turn the slices and cook for another minute.
Remove the eggplant from the skillet and drain on paper towels.
Let the eggplant cool for about 15 minutes.
Blanch spinach in boiling salted water for about 3 minutes.
Remove, drain, and chop the spinach coarsely.
In a blender, add chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, salt, and pepper.
Blend the mixture until smooth.
Place 2 to 3 tablespoons of the spinach-ricotta mixture on 1 slice of eggplant.
Roll up the eggplant slice.
In a saucepan, heat olive oil.
Add garlic and cook for about 3 minutes.
Add tomatoes and simmer for about 30 minutes.
Season the tomato sauce with salt and pepper.
Serve the rolled eggplant with tomato sauce.

original_instructions:
To make the dressing, whisk all ingredients together in a small bowl; cover, and refrigerate until ready to use.
For the salad, toss macaroni in a large bowl with ham, celery, peas, pickles, red pepper and scallions; add dressing and toss again. Garnish with cherry tomatoes.
ingredients: 1 pound lean, cooked ham, cut into 1/2-inch cubes

step_by_step_instructions: Whisk buttermilk, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and black pepper together in a small bowl.
Cover the dressing and refrigerate until ready to use.
In a large bowl, toss cooked elbow macaroni with ham, celery, peas, pickles, red bell pepper, and scallions.
Add the dressing to the macaroni mixture and toss again.
Garnish the salad with cherry tomatoes.

recipe_title: Brown Rice with Balsamic and Tarragon
original_instructions: In a medium size, heavy-bottomed pot, bring the chicken stock and balsamic vinegar to a boil. Add the bags of rice and cook according to box directions. Remove bags and open. Garnish with tarragon.

step_by_step_instructions: In a medium size, heavy-bottomed pot, bring the chicken stock and balsamic vinegar to a boil.
Add the bags of rice and cook according to box directions.
Remove bags and open.
Garnish with tarragon.

recipe_title: Grilled Moroccan Spiced Pork Tenderloin with Creamy Harissa Sauce
original_instructions:
In a small bowl, combine the cinnamon, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt and olive oil. Rub the mixture evenly over the pork tenderloins. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.
Prepare a grill for high heat cooking. Place the tenderloins on the grill and cook until browned and nicely marked, 8 to 10 minutes. Turn the tenderloins and cook until a meat thermometer inserted into the center of each registers between 155 degrees F and 165 degrees F, 8 to 10 minutes longer. Transfer the tenderloins to a cutting board, tent with foil and let rest for 10 minutes. Slice and serve hot or at room temperature with Creamy Harissa Sauce.
In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, oil, harissa and garlic until combined. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: Kosher salt and cracked black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, combine the cinnamon, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt, and olive oil.
Rub the mixture evenly over the pork tenderloins.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.
Prepare a grill for high heat cooking.
Place the tenderloins on the grill and cook until browned and nicely marked, 8 to 10 minutes.
Turn the tenderloins and cook until a meat thermometer inserted into the center of each registers between 155 degrees F and 165 degrees F, 8 to 10 minutes longer.
Transfer the tenderloins to a cutting board, tent with foil and let rest for 10 minutes.
Slice and serve hot or at room temperature with Creamy Harissa Sauce.
In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, oil, harissa and garlic until combined.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper.

recipe_title: Minted Melon Iced Honey Green Tea
original_instructions:
Crush honeydew and mint with wooden spoon in 1-quart glass measuring cup. Stir in Pure Leaf™ Not Too Sweet Honey Green Tea. Strain and serve over ice. Garnish, if desired, with additional honeydew and mint sprigs.
For a pitcher, simply double the recipe.
For a cocktail version, simply add ¼ cup vodka.
ingredients: 6 chunks honeydew melon, about 1-½ inches square
1 bottle Pure Leaf™ Not Too Sweet Honey Green Tea

step_by_step_instructions: Crush honeydew and mint with a wooden spoon in a 1-quart glass measuring cup.
Stir in the green tea.
Strain the mixture and serve over ice.
Garnish, if desired, with additional honeydew and mint sprigs.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a mixing bowl, combine almond flour, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and flour.
In another mixing bowl, whip the egg whites to soft peaks and add the sugar. Whip to medium peaks. Gently fold in the dry ingredients.
Spoon the mixture into a pastry bag set with plain tip. Pipe into rings on a parchment-lined baking sheet, and bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a mixing bowl, combine almond flour, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and flour.
In another mixing bowl, whip the egg whites to soft peaks and add the sugar. Whip to medium peaks.
Gently fold in the dry ingredients.
Spoon the mixture into a pastry bag set with plain tip.
Pipe into rings on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.

original_instructions: Heat a large pan over medium-high heat, and then pour in some oil. Add the bell peppers, garlic and shallots and sweat. Add the sausage, prawns and shrimp, pour in the white wine and bring to a simmer. Stir in the white rice, crawfish and butter. Season with the lemon juice and add cayenne, salt and black pepper to taste.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
Pour in some oil.
Add the bell peppers, garlic, and shallots and sweat.
Add the sausage, prawns, and shrimp.
Pour in the white wine and bring to a simmer.
Stir in the white rice, crawfish, and butter.
Season with the lemon juice and add cayenne, salt, and black pepper to taste.

recipe_title: Kale with Garlic, Anchovies and Ale
original_instructions: Heat extra-virgin olive oil in a small skillet over medium to medium-high heat. Add the anchovies and let them melt into the oil. Add the chile and garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the kale and let it wilt, turning it in the chile and garlic with tongs. Douse the pan with the ale and toss for 1 to 2 minutes more, than add nutmeg, and salt and pepper, to taste. Transfer the kale to a serving bowl and serve.
ingredients: 1 large bunch or black kale, lacinato or dinosaur, stemmed and thickly shredded
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Heat extra-virgin olive oil in a small skillet over medium to medium-high heat.
Add the anchovies and let them melt into the oil.
Add the chile and garlic and cook for 2 minutes.
Stir in the kale and let it wilt, turning it in the chile and garlic with tongs.
Douse the pan with the ale and toss for 1 to 2 minutes more.
Add nutmeg, and salt and pepper, to taste.
Transfer the kale to a serving bowl and serve.

original_instructions:
Make this spicy Korean condiment, then turn it into fried rice or serve it with your steak: Pulse 3 chopped red jalapenos, 4 garlic cloves, 1/4 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons chopped ginger, 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes and 2 tablespoons each fish sauce and salt in a food processor. Cut 1/2 head napa cabbage and 6 scallions into 2-inch pieces; toss with the jalapeno paste. Refrigerate at least 4 hours.
Photograph by Tina Rupp

step_by_step_instructions: Pulse chopped red jalapenos, garlic cloves, sugar, chopped ginger, red pepper flakes, fish sauce, and salt in a food processor until combined.
Cut napa cabbage and scallions into 2-inch pieces.
Toss the cabbage and scallions with the jalapeno paste.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a bowl add the strawberries, blueberries, sugar, grenadine, and lime juice. Stir to dissolve as much sugar as possible. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, stirring a couple of times to agitate and help create juices.
When ready to serve, divide the mixture among 4 low ball glasses. Pour 6 ounces beer into each glass and give a gentle stir. Drink!
ingredients: 2 (12-ounce) bottles beer, cold (recommended: Corona or a pilsner)

step_by_step_instructions: Chop the strawberries.
In a bowl, add strawberries, blueberries, sugar, grenadine, and lime juice.
Stir to dissolve as much sugar as possible.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, stirring a couple of times.
When ready to serve, divide the mixture among 4 low ball glasses.
Pour 6 ounces of cold beer into each glass.
Gently stir and serve.

original_instructions:
Special equipment: 12-cup punch bowl, hurricane glasses
In a 12-cup punch bowl, add the passion fruit juice, guava juice, orange juice, pineapple juice, dark rum, white rum, simple syrup and lime juice and stir. Fill each hurricane glass with ice and pour in the punch. Garnish with the orange wedges and passion fruit wedges.

step_by_step_instructions: In a 12-cup punch bowl, add the passion fruit juice, guava juice, orange juice, pineapple juice, dark rum, white rum, simple syrup, and lime juice.
Stir the mixture thoroughly.
Fill each hurricane glass with ice.
Pour the punch into the hurricane glasses over the ice.
Garnish with the orange wedges and passion fruit wedges.

recipe_title: Sesame Chicken Sate with Peanut Sauce
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
"Weave" a bamboo skewer through the length of each chicken strip (as you would run a straight pin through fabric). Mix the seeds, chili powder, salt and garlic powder in a shallow bowl. Dip chicken into warm water and roll into seed mixture. Bake on a lightly greased sheet pan until done.
Heat chicken broth. In a mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, Coco Lopez, soy sauce and honey and mix well. It will be thick. Slowly mix chicken broth into peanut butter mixture. It should be medium consistency for dipping skewered chicken.
ingredients: 6 boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1 1/2-inch wide strips

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
Weave a bamboo skewer through the length of each chicken strip.
Mix the sesame seeds, chili powder, salt, and garlic powder in a shallow bowl.
Dip chicken strips into warm water and roll into seed mixture.
Bake on a lightly greased sheet pan until done.
Heat chicken broth.
In a mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, Coco Lopez, soy sauce, and honey. Mix well until thick.
Slowly mix the heated chicken broth into the peanut butter mixture until it reaches a medium consistency for dipping.

original_instructions: Combine the butter, garlic, scallions, dill, parsley, lemon juice, salt and pepper in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Beat until mixed, but do not whip.
ingredients: 1/2 pound (2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature
1 tablespoon minced scallions (white and green parts)

step_by_step_instructions: Place the butter, garlic, scallions, dill, parsley, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Attach the paddle attachment to an electric mixer.
Combine the ingredients by beating them until they are mixed.
Ensure you do not whip the mixture.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Anytime before Thanksgiving, spoon the pumpkin pie filling into muffin cups, then cover the pan with aluminum foil and place it in the freezer.
When you're ready to make the smoothies, add the milk to a blender. Then add the yogurt. Pop 4 pieces of the frozen pumpkin pie filling out of the pan and add to the blender. (Save the rest of the pie filling for another time, or for a second batch of smoothies if one isn't enough to calm the hungry beasts.)
Next, add the cinnamon. Then blend the mixture until totally smooth and pour it into individual glasses.
Sprinkle the tops with graham cracker crumbs before serving.

step_by_step_instructions: Spoon the pumpkin pie filling into muffin cups before Thanksgiving.
Cover the muffin pan with aluminum foil and freeze.
When ready to make smoothies, add milk to a blender.
Add yogurt to the blender.
Pop 4 pieces of frozen pumpkin pie filling out of the pan and add to the blender.
Add cinnamon to the blender.
Blend the mixture until totally smooth.
Pour the mixture into individual glasses.
Sprinkle the tops with graham cracker crumbs before serving.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a chilled Champagne flute add cranberry juice and a squeeze of lime. Top off the glass with Champagne. Garnish with 3 or 4 cranberries.

step_by_step_instructions: Chill a Champagne flute.
Add 1-ounce cranberry juice to the flute.
Squeeze a wedge of lime into the flute.
Top off the glass with Champagne.
Garnish with 3 or 4 cranberries.

original_instructions:
Preheat a grill pan or grill.
Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the porcini mushrooms and saute until beginning to soften, 5 minutes. Tear the nipitella or other herbs and add to the pan. Add salt and pepper to taste and remove from the heat.
Toast the bread on the grill pan on both sides. Top with the sauteed porcini and garnish with chopped parsley and a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
4 medium porcini mushrooms, stems removed, tops cut into small pieces
2 sprigs fresh nipitella or a combination of fresh baby mint and thyme
1 loaf unsalted Tuscan bread, sliced into 3/4-inch slices
1 small bunch fresh flat-leaf parsley, roughly chopped

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a grill pan or grill.
Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add the porcini mushrooms and saute until beginning to soften, 5 minutes.
Tear the nipitella or other herbs and add to the pan.
Add salt and pepper to taste and remove from the heat.
Toast the bread on the grill pan on both sides.
Top with the sauteed porcini.
Garnish with chopped parsley and a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
HEAT oven to 350 degrees F. Spray cookie sheets with no-stick cooking spray. Combine flour, brownie mix, water, oil and egg in large bowl; blend well. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto prepared cookie sheets. Arrange 5 pecan pieces under each to resemble head and legs of turtle.
BAKE 8 to 12 minutes or until top of cookies appear almost set. Cool 1 minute; remove from cookie sheets. Cool 2 minutes or until completely cooled.
COMBINE caramels and 1 tablespoon water in small saucepan; cook and stir over low heat until melted and smooth, adding enough additional water for desired drizzling consistency. Stir in powdered sugar until smooth. Spoon over cookies. Let stand until frosting is set. Store cookies between sheets of waxed paper in tightly covered container.
High Altitude (above 3500 ft.):
INCREASE flour to 3/4 cup. Bake at 375 degrees F for 9 to 13 minutes.
ingredients: 1 (19.25 oz.) package Pillsbury® Family Size Chocolate Fudge Brownie Mix
1/2 cup Pillsbury BEST® All Purpose Flour

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Spray cookie sheets with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, combine flour, brownie mix, water, oil, and egg; blend well.
Drop dough by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto prepared cookie sheets.
Arrange 5 pecan pieces under each cookie to resemble the head and legs of a turtle.
Bake cookies for 8 to 12 minutes or until the top appears almost set.
Cool cookies for 1 minute on the sheets, then remove them.
Cool cookies for an additional 2 minutes or until completely cooled.
Combine caramels and 1 tablespoon water in a small saucepan.
Cook and stir over low heat until melted and smooth, adding water for drizzling consistency if needed.
Stir in powdered sugar until smooth.
Spoon caramel mixture over cookies.
Let cookies stand until the frosting is set.
Store cookies between sheets of waxed paper in a tightly covered container.

original_instructions:
Cut 2 fennel bulbs into 1-inch wedges; toss with 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon chopped thyme, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and a pinch of red pepper flakes on a rimmed baking sheet. Cover with foil and roast at 425 degrees F, 20 minutes. Uncover and toss; continue roasting until tender and golden, 15 to 20 minutes, sprinkling with 1/4 cup shredded parmesan during the last 5 minutes.
Photograph by Ryan Dausch

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Cut the fennel bulbs into 1-inch wedges.
Toss the fennel wedges with olive oil, chopped thyme, kosher salt, and red pepper flakes on a rimmed baking sheet.
Cover the fennel with foil and roast in the oven for 20 minutes.
Uncover the fennel, toss, and continue roasting for another 15 to 20 minutes until tender and golden.
Sprinkle the fennel with shredded parmesan during the last 5 minutes of roasting.

original_instructions: Combine the orange, cranberry, and pineapple juices in a large container. Add the 2 vodkas and the halved fruits to the punch. Transfer to the refrigerator and chill over night.

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the orange, cranberry, and pineapple juices in a large container.
Add the vodkas and the halved fruits to the punch.
Transfer to the refrigerator and chill overnight.

original_instructions:
1. Pour 1/4 cup Wish-Bone® Italian Dressing over chicken in large, shallow nonaluminum baking dish or plastic bag. Cover, or close bag, and marinate in refrigerator, turning occasionally, 30 minutes to 3 hours.
2. Meanwhile, combine tomatoes, onion, basil and 1/4 cup Dressing in medium bowl. Cover and marinate in refrigerator at least 30 minutes.
3. Remove chicken from marinade, discarding marinade. Grill or broil chicken, turning once and brushing frequently with remaining 1/4 cup Dressing, until chicken is thoroughly cooked, about 12 minutes. Serve tomato mixture over chicken.
For Marinated Chicken with Fresh Salsa, use cilantro instead of basil.
Cost per recipe*: $10.49.
Cost per serving*: $1.75.
*Based on average retail prices at national supermarkets.
ingredients: 6 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves (about 1-1/2 lbs.)
1 Tbsp. finely chopped fresh basil leaves* (optional)

step_by_step_instructions: Pour 1/4 cup Italian dressing over chicken in a large, shallow nonaluminum baking dish or plastic bag.
Cover or close the bag, and marinate in the refrigerator, turning occasionally, for 30 minutes to 3 hours.
Meanwhile, combine tomatoes, onion, basil, and 1/4 cup Italian dressing in a medium bowl.
Cover and marinate the tomato mixture in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Remove chicken from marinade, discarding marinade.
Grill or broil chicken, turning once and brushing frequently with the remaining 1/4 cup Italian dressing, until chicken is thoroughly cooked, about 12 minutes.
Serve the tomato mixture over the cooked chicken.

recipe_title: Crispy Whole Red Snapper with Charred Jalapeno-Basil Vinaigrette
original_instructions:
For the Charred Jalapeno-Basil Vinaigrette: Heat oil in a small saute pan until smoking. Add the jalapeno and cook until charred on all sides. Let the pepper cool and slice thinly. Place the pepper and the remaining ingredients in a medium bowl and whisk until blended.
For the Crispy Fish: Heat oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees F. Pat fish on both sides with paper towels to insure that it is totally dry. Season the fish on both sides with salt and pepper. Mix rice flour and water together. Dredge both sides of each fish in the batter and tap off any excess. Slowly lower the fish into the oil and fry for 6 to 7 minutes. Carefully remove, drain on plate lined with paper towels and drizzle immediately with the vinaigrette.
For the Grilled Vegetables: Toss vegetables with olive oil, salt and pepper, and grill until tender.
ingredients: 4 whole red snapper (about 1 pound each) cleaned and scaled

step_by_step_instructions: Heat olive oil in a small saute pan until smoking.
Add jalapeno and cook until charred on all sides.
Let the jalapeno cool and slice thinly.
Place the jalapeno, diced red onion, chopped garlic, Dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar, rice wine vinegar, 3/4 cup olive oil, sesame oil, basil, and ancho chile powder in a medium bowl.
Whisk until blended.
Heat canola oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees F.
Pat fish on both sides with paper towels to ensure they are dry.
Season the fish with salt and pepper.
Mix seasoned rice flour and water together to make a batter.
Dredge the fish in the batter and tap off excess.
Slowly lower fish into the oil and fry for 6 to 7 minutes.
Carefully remove and drain fish on a plate lined with paper towels.
Drizzle immediately with the jalapeno-basil vinaigrette.
Toss sliced red onion, sliced eggplant, cut fennel, cut red pepper, and cut yellow pepper with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Grill vegetables until tender.

original_instructions:
To make the aioli: Beat the yolk with the vinegar and mustard in a bowl. Whisk in the oil, drop by drop, to make a thick mayonnaise. Squeeze the garlic out of the roasted cloves into the mayonnaise and whisk smooth. Season the aioli with salt, pepper, and lemon juice, to taste.
To prepare the artichokes: Trim the artichokes, rubbing with lemon as you go, until you are down to the core with a bit of stem attached. Halve. While you're trimming, bring a pot of water to the boil. Squeeze the juice of a lemon into it and salt it. Drop in the artichokes and cook until tender, about 10 minutes, depending on the size. Drain, and pat dry. Heat the olive oil in a skillet and brown the artichokes on all sides. Transfer to paper towel to drain. Serve with the aioli.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
12 baby artichokes (poivrade variety, which are the tiny ones)

step_by_step_instructions: Beat the yolk with the vinegar and mustard in a bowl.
Whisk in the oil, drop by drop, to make a thick mayonnaise.
Squeeze the garlic out of the roasted cloves into the mayonnaise and whisk until smooth.
Season the aioli with salt, pepper, and lemon juice to taste.
Trim the artichokes, rubbing with lemon as you go, until you are down to the core with a bit of stem attached.
Halve the artichokes.
While trimming, bring a pot of water to the boil.
Squeeze the juice of a lemon into the boiling water and salt it.
Drop in the artichokes and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Drain the artichokes and pat them dry.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet and brown the artichokes on all sides.
Transfer the artichokes to a paper towel to drain.
Serve the artichokes with the aioli.

original_instructions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook as the label directs. Reserve 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain.
Combine the evaporated milk, eggs, havarti, Colby jack, 1/2 teaspoon salt and the nutmeg in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook, whisking constantly, until smooth and thickened, about 8 minutes. Remove from the heat.
Add the pasta and sour cream to the sauce; toss to coat, then let sit 5 minutes so the sauce thickens slightly. Add the reserved cooking water to loosen, if desired.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups grated Colby jack cheese (about 4 ounces)

step_by_step_instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the pasta and cook as the label directs.
Reserve 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain the pasta.
Combine the evaporated milk, eggs, havarti, Colby jack, 1/2 teaspoon salt and the nutmeg in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Cook, whisking constantly, until smooth and thickened, about 8 minutes.
Remove the saucepan from the heat.
Add the pasta and sour cream to the sauce; toss to coat.
Let the mixture sit for 5 minutes so the sauce thickens slightly.
Add the reserved cooking water to loosen, if desired.

original_instructions: Trim mushroom stems. If you are using shiitakes or portobellos and stems are not too tough, separate stems from caps and cut stems into thin slivers. First braise them in broth for 10 minutes before sauteing to tenderize stems. Keep caps whole or coarsely slice. If using cultivated mushrooms, simply trim 1/4-inch off of bottom stem; wipe caps with damp cloth of brush and slice coarsely. Heat oil or butter in large wide skillet and saute shallots for a minute. Add mushroom slices or mushroom caps and saute just over high heat until browned. (If appropriate, add stems and broth and evaporate over high heat.) Season to taste with salt and pepper and add herbs if you wish. To serve spoon over grilled chicken; use as base for tortellini soup or pizza topping.
ingredients: 1 pound cultivated, shiitake, or portobello mushrooms (choose one or several types)
1/2 cup chicken broth, optional for braising stems
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs like parsley or tarragon, optional

step_by_step_instructions: Trim the mushroom stems.
If using portobellos and stems are not too tough, separate stems from caps and cut stems into thin slivers.
Braise stems in broth for 10 minutes before sautéing to tenderize.
Keep mushroom caps whole or coarsely slice.
If using cultivated mushrooms, trim 1/4-inch off the bottom of the stem and wipe caps with a damp cloth or brush.
Slice mushrooms coarsely.
Heat oil or butter in a large wide skillet.
Sauté shallots for a minute.
Add mushroom slices or caps and sauté over high heat until browned.
If appropriate, add stems and broth mixture and evaporate over high heat.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add herbs if desired.
Serve over grilled chicken, or use as a base for tortellini soup or pizza topping.

original_instructions:
Preheat a deep fryer pot filled with the manufacturers recommended level of oil to 280 degrees.
Using an Asian vegetable slicer or a mandolin, slice the vegetables paper thin.
Fry the vegetables individually in small batches. Cook them until they begin to crisp and then remove. They will crisp even more as they air dry.
Season with salt and serve.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a deep fryer pot filled with the manufacturer's recommended level of oil to 280 degrees.
Using an Asian vegetable slicer or a mandolin, slice the vegetables paper thin.
Fry the vegetables individually in small batches until they begin to crisp.
Remove the vegetables from the oil.
Allow them to air dry so they crisp more.
Season with salt and serve.

original_instructions:
For the Picadillo:
Heat oil in a medium sized heavy saute or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and stir for 3 to 5 minutes until the color of the beef is brown and pink. Add recaito and stir. Lower flame to medium, add garlic and salt and pepper. Stir in the tomato sauce, oregano and olives and let simmer for 10 to 15 minutes. Store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
ingredients: 2 cloves fresh, peeled and crushed garlic
1/2 cup small Spanish olives with pimento

step_by_step_instructions: Heat oil in a medium-sized heavy sauté or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Add ground beef and stir for 3 to 5 minutes until the color of the beef is brown and pink.
Add recaito and stir.
Lower the flame to medium, add garlic and salt and pepper.
Stir in the tomato sauce, oregano, and olives and let simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.
Store in the refrigerator until ready to use.

original_instructions:
Puree the peaches, cottage cheese, milk, honey, lemon juice, a pinch of salt, the nutmeg and 2 cups ice in a blender until smooth, 2 to 3 minutes. Divide among glasses and sprinkle with more nutmeg.
Photograph by Andrew Mccaul
ingredients: 2 ripe peaches, halved, pitted and cut into chunks (with skins)
Pinch of freshly grated nutmeg, plus more for sprinkling

step_by_step_instructions: Puree the peaches, cottage cheese, milk, honey, lemon juice, a pinch of salt, the nutmeg and 2 cups ice in a blender until smooth, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Divide the mixture among glasses.
Sprinkle the top with more nutmeg

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a saute pan on medium heat, add the oil, bacon and onions and cook until the fat has rendered, the bacon is crisp and the onions are tender. Add the collards and sun-dried tomatoes to the pan and continue to cook until the greens wilt, about 2 minutes. Add in the balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve immediately.
ingredients: 4 slices bacon, cut into small pieces
1 bunch collards, trimmed, ribs discarded and thinly sliced
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: In a saute pan on medium heat, add the olive oil, bacon, and onions.
Cook until the fat has rendered, the bacon is crisp, and the onions are tender.
Add the collards and sun-dried tomatoes to the pan.
Continue to cook until the greens wilt, about 2 minutes.
Add in the balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a serving bowl and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Preheat grill over medium-high heat.
Cut peaches in half and remove the stone. Brush with oil and sprinkle with salt. Place on the hot grill. (If you don't have a grill use a hot saute pan.) Cook until soft but not falling apart, approximately 3 minutes on both sides. Set aside to rest.
In a small bowl mix the mascarpone, cream cheese and powdered sugar together until it reaches a smooth consistency. Use a little hot water to loosen, if mixture remains stiff.
To finish place 2 halves of the grilled peaches onto a plate. Top with cheese mixture and drizzle with raspberry sauce. Garnish with fresh chopped mint.
ingredients: 1/2 cup prepared raspberry sauce (ice cream topping sauce)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat grill over medium-high heat.
Cut peaches in half and remove the stone.
Brush the peach halves with oil and sprinkle with salt.
Place the peaches on the hot grill.
Cook the peaches until soft but not falling apart, approximately 3 minutes on both sides.
Set the grilled peaches aside to rest.
In a small bowl, mix mascarpone, cream cheese, and powdered sugar until smooth.
If the cheese mixture remains stiff, use a little hot water to loosen it.
To plate, place 2 halves of the grilled peaches onto a plate.
Top the peaches with the cheese mixture.
Drizzle the dish with raspberry sauce.
Garnish the dish with freshly chopped mint.

original_instructions:
Marinate the chicken in the buttermilk for at least 30 minutes. Preheat the deep fryer to 325 degrees F.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl mix the panko, pecans, salt and seasoned salt. Remove the chicken from the buttermilk and shake off excess liquid, then dip in the egg whites. Dredge the chicken in the panko mixture and then rest the chicken in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.
Place the chicken in the deep fryer and cook until golden brown, about 6 minutes. Finish off in the oven until the internal temperature of the chicken is 165 degrees F, 12 minutes.

step_by_step_instructions: Marinate the chicken in the buttermilk for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the deep fryer to 325 degrees F.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix the panko, pecans, salt, and seasoned salt.
Remove the chicken from the buttermilk and shake off excess liquid.
Dip the chicken in the egg whites.
Dredge the chicken in the panko mixture.
Rest the chicken in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.
Place the chicken in the deep fryer and cook until golden brown, about 6 minutes.
Finish off in the oven until the internal temperature of the chicken is 165 degrees F, approximately 12 minutes.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Partially cook the Brussels sprouts in a large pot of boiling salted water, about 4 minutes. Drain.
Meanwhile, heat the oil in a heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add the pancetta and saute until beginning to crisp, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and saute until pale golden, about 2 minutes. Add the Brussels sprouts to the same skillet and saute until heated through and beginning to brown, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Add the broth and simmer until the broth reduces just enough to coat the Brussels sprouts, about 3 minutes. Serve.
ingredients: 3 ounces paper-thin slices pancetta, coarsely chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Partially cook the Brussels sprouts in a large pot of boiling salted water for about 4 minutes, then drain.
Heat the olive oil in a heavy large skillet over medium heat.
Add the pancetta to the skillet and sauté until it begins to crisp, about 3 minutes.
Add the minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until it turns pale golden, about 2 minutes.
Add the drained Brussels sprouts to the skillet and sauté until they are heated through and begin to brown, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Add the chicken broth to the skillet and simmer until the broth reduces just enough to coat the Brussels sprouts, about 3 minutes.
Serve.

original_instructions:
Cut a small piece off the curved side of 4 unpeeled bananas so they'll sit level, then make a deep slit down the center of each through the peel; place on separate sheets of foil. Open the slits and brush the inside of each banana with melted butter, then sprinkle with sugar and 1 ounce chopped semisweet chocolate; fold up the foil. Grill the packets over high heat until the chocolate melts, 6 to 8 minutes (don't worry if the peel turns brown). Open the peels and top the bananas with ice cream, whipped cream, sprinkles and a cherry.
Photograph by Kang Kim

step_by_step_instructions: Cut a small piece off the curved side of 4 unpeeled bananas so they'll sit level.
Make a deep slit down the center of each banana through the peel.
Place each banana on a separate sheet of foil.
Open the slits and brush the inside of each banana with melted butter.
Sprinkle with sugar and 1 ounce chopped semisweet chocolate.
Fold up the foil to form packets.
Grill the packets over high heat until the chocolate melts, approximately 6 to 8 minutes.
Open the peels and top the bananas with ice cream, whipped cream, sprinkles, and a cherry.

original_instructions:
Heat oven to 375°F. Unroll dough on cookie sheet and separate into 4 rectangles; press each into 6x4-inch rectangle, firmly pressing perforations to seal.
Spread 1 tablespoon pizza sauce on half of each rectangle to within 1 inch of edge. Sprinkle each with 3 tablespoons cheese; top with 6 slices pepperoni. Fold dough diagonally over filling; firmly press edges with fork to seal. Sprinkle each triangle with ¼ teaspoon grated cheese. With fork, prick top of each to allow steam to escape.
Bake 13 to 15 minutes or until deep golden brown. Serve warm.
ingredients: 1 can (8 oz) Pillsbury® refrigerated crescent dinner rolls

step_by_step_instructions: Heat oven to 375°F.
Unroll dough on cookie sheet and separate into 4 rectangles; press each into a 6x4-inch rectangle, firmly pressing perforations to seal.
Spread 1 tablespoon pizza sauce on half of each rectangle to within 1 inch of edge.
Sprinkle each with 3 tablespoons cheese; top with 6 slices pepperoni.
Fold dough diagonally over filling; firmly press edges with fork to seal.
Sprinkle each triangle with ¼ teaspoon grated cheese.
With fork, prick top of each to allow steam to escape.
Bake 13 to 15 minutes or until deep golden brown.
Serve warm.

original_instructions:
In a food processor grate the potatoes. Line a sieve with cheesecloth and transfer potatoes to the sieve. Set sieve over a bowl, twist cheesecloth into a pouch, squeezing out some moisture. Let mixture drain for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, pour off liquid from the bowl but leave the white potato starch that settles in the bottom of the bowl.
To that starch add eggs, flour,herbs, 1-1/2 teaspoons of salt and freshly ground pepper. Return drained potatoes to this mixture and toss to combine.
Preheat oven to 200 degrees. Line a baking pan with paper towels. When you are ready to eat, in a large skillet heat 1/4 inch of oil over medium high heat until hot. Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of potato mixture and cook for 3 to 4 minutes a side; latkes should be golden and crisp on both sides. Eat right away or keep warm in oven.
Serve topped with slivers of roasted red peppers,and salsa.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons flour (or more) or matzo meal (during Passover)
2 tablespoons chopped herbs such as cilantro,
1 1/2 teaspoons salt and freshly ground black pepper
Rasoted red peppers and salsa for garnish

step_by_step_instructions: Grate the potatoes in a food processor.
Line a sieve with cheesecloth and transfer grated potatoes to the sieve.
Place the sieve over a bowl, twist cheesecloth into a pouch and squeeze out some moisture from the potatoes.
Let the mixture drain for 15 minutes.
After 15 minutes, pour off liquid from the bowl but leave the potato starch at the bottom.
Add eggs, flour, herbs, salt, and pepper to the potato starch.
Return the drained potatoes to this mixture and toss to combine.
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees.
Line a baking pan with paper towels.
In a large skillet, heat 1/4 inch of oil over medium-high heat until hot.
Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of potato mixture into the hot oil.
Cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until golden and crisp.
Eat the latkes right away or keep warm in the oven.
Serve topped with slivers of roasted red peppers and salsa.

original_instructions:
In large bowl, combine first 7 ingredients, and mix well. Set aside.
In large mixing bowl beat together with electric mixer on medium speed the sugar and shortening until fluffy; add the molasses and water, mixing well. Stir in the flour mixture until just mixed. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease baking sheets.
Roll about 1/4 of the dough 1/4-inch thick on lightly floured surface. Cut with a floured gingerbread cutter or other shaped cutters. Place about 2-inches apart on baking sheets. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until no indentation remains when touched. Transfer to wire racks to cool. Decorate with colored frosting, sugar and candies as desired.

step_by_step_instructions: In a large bowl, combine the first 7 ingredients (all-purpose flour, baking soda, ground ginger, salt, ground allspice, ground cloves, and ground cinnamon), and mix well. Set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, beat together with an electric mixer on medium speed the sugar and shortening until fluffy.
Add the molasses and water to the sugar mixture, mixing well.
Stir in the flour mixture until just mixed.
Cover and refrigerate the dough for at least 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease baking sheets.
Roll about 1/4 of the dough 1/4-inch thick on a lightly floured surface.
Cut with a floured gingerbread cutter or other shaped cutters.
Place cut dough about 2 inches apart on baking sheets.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until no indentation remains when touched.
Transfer cookies to wire racks to cool.
Decorate with colored frosting, sugar, and candies as desired.

original_instructions:
