Put flour into a bowl and season with salt and pepper. Stir in the beer, 1/2 half at a time, whisking to work out any lumps. Add the egg yolk and mix well to combine. The batter should be the consistency of heavy cream.
In a wok or deep fat fryer, heat a couple of inches of oil to 375 degrees F. Rinse and dry all ingredients to be fried. Fry the ingredients in the order listed. Coat ingredients with flour, shaking off the excess. Dip in batter and immediately place into hot oil. Do not overcrowd pan. Cook until golden: the herbs will cook quickly, the seafood will take a bit longer. Skim any loose pieces of batter from the oil. Drain on paper towels. Place on a large platter, season with salt and pepper, and squeeze over some lemon wedges. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 2 cups all purpose flour, plus more for dusting
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/2 pound medium shrimp, shelled, deveined and butterflied
1/2 pound fresh white anchovies or sardines, cleaned and filleted

step_by_step_instructions: Put flour into a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Stir in the beer, 1/2 at a time, whisking to work out any lumps.
Add the egg yolk and mix well to combine. The batter should be the consistency of heavy cream.
In a wok or deep fat fryer, heat a couple of inches of oil to 375 degrees F.
Rinse and dry all ingredients to be fried.
Fry the ingredients in the order listed.
Coat ingredients with flour, shaking off the excess.
Dip in batter and immediately place into hot oil.
Do not overcrowd pan. Cook until golden: the herbs will cook quickly, the seafood will take a bit longer.
Skim any loose pieces of batter from the oil.
Drain on paper towels.
Place on a large platter, season with salt and pepper, and squeeze over some lemon wedges.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a small bowl, mix together the horseradish, mustard, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
In large bowl, mix ground beef, onion, egg, and Worcestershire sauce. Add contents of small bowl and mix thoroughly. Add the bread crumbs and combine well.
Place mixture into a 1-pound loaf pan. Pour ketchup over top and place in oven.
Bake uncovered for 45 to 60 minutes.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a small bowl, mix together the horseradish, mustard, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
In a large bowl, mix ground beef, onion, egg, and Worcestershire sauce.
Add contents of small bowl to the large bowl and mix thoroughly.
Add the bread crumbs and combine well.
Place mixture into a 1-pound loaf pan.
Pour ketchup over the top of the mixture.
Place in oven and bake uncovered for 45 to 60 minutes.

original_instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine flour, baking soda and salt. In a large bowl beat butter with sugars. Add eggs and vanilla and mix well. Gradually beat in dry ingredients. Fold in chips. Pour batter into a greased 9 1/2x113-inch baking pan. In a small bowl mix condensed milk with coconut. Pour coconut topping over batter and smooth evenly. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool and cut into bars.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl beat butter with sugars.
Add eggs and vanilla and mix well.
Gradually beat in dry ingredients.
Fold in chips.
Pour batter into a greased 9 1/2x113-inch baking pan.
In a small bowl mix condensed milk with coconut.
Pour coconut topping over batter and smooth evenly.
Bake for 25 minutes.
Cool and cut into bars.

original_instructions:
Toss the cucumber, vinegar, sugar and 2 teaspoons salt in a medium bowl and set aside at room temperature, tossing occasionally, until juicy, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, put the almonds in a large skillet and heat over medium, swirling them around until golden and toasted in spots, about 3 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Add the oil and garlic, the cucumber mixture along with any collected juices, 6 ice cubes and all but 2 tablespoons each of the almonds and parsley to a blender. Blend on high until very smooth. Refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours.
Pour into 2-ounce shot glasses. Sprinkle each with the reserved almonds and parsley.
ingredients: 3 large cucumbers, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch chunks
1/2 small bunch parsley, leaves roughly chopped

step_by_step_instructions: Toss the cucumber, vinegar, sugar and 2 teaspoons salt in a medium bowl and set aside at room temperature, tossing occasionally, until juicy, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, put the almonds in a large skillet and heat over medium, swirling them around until golden and toasted in spots, about 3 minutes.
Set almonds aside to cool.
Add the oil, garlic, the cucumber mixture along with any collected juices, 6 ice cubes and all but 2 tablespoons each of the almonds and parsley to a blender.
Blend on high until very smooth.
Refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours.
Pour into 2-ounce shot glasses.
Sprinkle each with the reserved almonds and parsley.

ingredients: Plum and Pear Chutney, recipe follows

step_by_step_instructions: Arrange cheeses and fruit on a platter.
Serve with chutney.
In a medium heated saucepan, add butter, onions, and ginger.
Cook until onion softens, about 5 to 10 minutes.
Add pear, plums, and sugar to the saucepan.
Stir the mixture.
Turn heat down and add white wine, Worcestershire sauce, and white wine vinegar.
Stir well and let the mixture reduce for about 20 minutes until it reaches a jam consistency.
Once reduced, remove from heat and let it cool.
Serve chutney with the cheese platter.

original_instructions: Cook bacon in microwave oven or on stove top. Let cool and crumble into medium bowl. Add onion, parsley and bread crumbs. Chop up clams and add to breadcrumb mixture. Moisten with reserved clam liquor. Season with salt, pepper, squirt of lemon and a dash of Tabasco sauce. Fill clam shells with mixture and place in a baking dish. Top clams with dots of butter and more bread crumbs. Broil until browned. Serve.

step_by_step_instructions: Cook bacon in a microwave oven or on the stove top.
Let the bacon cool and crumble it into a medium bowl.
Add the chopped onion, chopped parsley, and fresh bread crumbs to the bowl.
Chop up the clams and add them to the breadcrumb mixture.
Moisten the mixture with the reserved clam liquor.
Season with salt, pepper, a squirt of lemon, and a dash of Tabasco sauce.
Fill clam shells with the mixture and place them in a baking dish.
Top the clams with dots of butter and more bread crumbs.
Broil until browned.
Serve.

original_instructions:
Sift the confectioners' sugar and meringue powder into a large bowl. Add the water and beat with a mixer on medium-high speed until soft glossy peaks form. Divide among bowls and tint with food coloring, if desired.
Transfer the icing to resealable plastic bags; snip off the corners. Pipe on the cookies.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons meringue powder (available in the baking aisle)

step_by_step_instructions: Sift the confectioners' sugar and meringue powder into a large bowl.
Add the water.
Beat with a mixer on medium-high speed until soft glossy peaks form.
Divide the mixture among bowls.
Tint with food coloring, if desired.
Transfer the icing to resealable plastic bags.
Snip off the corners of the bags.
Pipe the icing on the cookies.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Trim about 1 inch off the ends of the broccoli stalks and cut the broccoli lengthwise into spears. Arrange the broccoli on a nonstick cookie sheet, drizzle with some olive oil and season with a little bit of salt and a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper. Toss to coat evenly. Transfer to the oven and roast for 10 minutes.
Remove the broccoli from the oven and sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and bake until the cheese melt and forms a crisp shell over the broccoli, about 10 minutes. Lift the broccoli out onto a platter with a spatula and drizzle with fresh lemon.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Trim about 1 inch off the ends of the broccoli stalks and cut the broccoli lengthwise into spears.
Arrange the broccoli on a nonstick cookie sheet.
Drizzle with some olive oil and season with a little bit of salt and a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper.
Toss to coat the broccoli evenly.
Transfer to the oven and roast for 10 minutes.
Remove the broccoli from the oven and sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top.
Bake until the cheese melts and forms a crisp shell over the broccoli, about 10 minutes.
Lift the broccoli out onto a platter with a spatula.
Drizzle with fresh lemon juice.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 250 degrees F.
Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper. Pour half of mixture into hot skillet. When egg starts to cook, lift edges with a spatula to allow uncooked egg to slide underneath. When almost cooked through, top 1 half with desired toppings. Fold over untopped side and cook 2 minutes, until egg is cooked through and cheese melts (if using cheese). Transfer omelet to a baking sheet and place in a warm oven while you prepare second omelet.
Slice omelets in half and serve.
ingredients: 8 slices turkey bacon, cooked until crisp (in the microwave or skillet)
1/2 cup diced tomatoes or leftover tomatoes

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 250 degrees F.
Heat 2 teaspoons of oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper.
Pour half of the mixture into the hot skillet.
When the egg starts to cook, lift edges with a spatula to allow uncooked egg to slide underneath.
When almost cooked through, top one half with desired toppings.
Fold over untopped side and cook for 2 minutes, until egg is cooked through and cheese melts if using.
Transfer omelet to a baking sheet and place in a warm oven while preparing the second omelet.
Slice omelets in half and serve.

original_instructions:
Wash strawberries and place in a paper towel-lined colander. Cover with another paper towel and place in the refrigerator for 4 hours.
Break your dry ice into small pieces, and toss with berries in a large bowl. Place into a container and cover with a towel. Place this in a cooler for 25 to 30 minutes. Remove berries and put into sealable bags and store in the freezer.

step_by_step_instructions: Wash strawberries and place in a paper towel-lined colander.
Cover with another paper towel and refrigerate for 4 hours.
Break dry ice into small pieces.
Toss strawberries with dry ice in a large bowl.
Place strawberries and dry ice mixture into a container and cover with a towel.
Place container in a cooler for 25 to 30 minutes.
Remove strawberries from container.
Put strawberries into sealable bags and store in the freezer.

original_instructions:
Cook onions in simmering, salted water for 5 minutes, then drain. Heat olive oil in a small saute pan, add onions and sugar, toss to coat. Cook, tossing occasionally, until onions are tender and golden brown.
In a large bowl mix the ground lamb with the flour, beaten egg, ground nutmeg and salt and pepper. Separate the mixture into 4 equal patties. On a hot grill or barbecue grill patties for approximately 5 minutes on each side (for a medium rare burger) or until desired degree of doneness.
After cutting the focaccia into rounds, slice each round in half. Lay the grilled lamburgers on top of focaccia. Crumble the feta over patties. Top with caramelized onions (cut in half), a drizzle of olive oil and fresh mint leaves. Replace remaining rounds of focaccia.
Suggested Drink: Banrock Station Southeast Australia Shiraz, 1997
ingredients: Focaccia bread, cut into 4 to 5 inch rounds

step_by_step_instructions: Cook onions in simmering, salted water for 5 minutes, then drain.
Heat olive oil in a small saute pan, add onions and sugar, toss to coat.
Cook, tossing occasionally, until onions are tender and golden brown.
In a large bowl, mix the ground lamb with the flour, beaten egg, ground nutmeg, and salt and pepper.
Separate the mixture into 4 equal patties.
On a hot grill, grill patties for approximately 5 minutes on each side for a medium rare burger or until desired degree of doneness.
After cutting the focaccia into rounds, slice each round in half.
Lay the grilled patties on top of focaccia.
Crumble the feta over the patties.
Top with caramelized onions, a drizzle of olive oil, and fresh mint leaves.
Replace remaining rounds of focaccia.

original_instructions: In a shallow non-reactive dish whisk together all marinade ingredients. Add chicken breasts and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for up to 3 hours. Remove chicken from marinade and grill until tender and cooked through.

step_by_step_instructions: In a shallow non-reactive dish, whisk together all marinade ingredients.
Add chicken breasts and turn to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for up to 3 hours.
Remove chicken from marinade.
Grill chicken until tender and cooked through.

recipe_title: Aida's Corn, Tomato and Avocado Salad
original_instructions:
Combine the dressing ingredients in a blender, using 2 teaspoons salt, and pepper to taste; process until smooth. Combine the salad ingredients in a large bowl and toss with the dressing. Let sit at least 15 minutes before serving, or cover and refrigerate for up to 4 hours.
Photography by Kate Sears
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Combine 2 teaspoons of salt, pepper, fresh cilantro, extra-virgin olive oil, fresh lime juice, and finely grated lime zest in a blender.
Blend the mixture until smooth to form the dressing.
In a large bowl, combine corn kernels, halved grape tomatoes, diced fresh mozzarella, and diced avocados.
Toss the salad ingredients with the prepared dressing.
Let the salad sit for at least 15 minutes before serving, or cover and refrigerate for up to 4 hours.

original_instructions:
Sift the flour with the salt, and knead into a soft dough by adding the yogurt, butter, and water.
Cover with a moist cloth and let rise for 1/2 an hour.
Meanwhile, combine ingredients for the potato filling in a bowl and refrigerate until needed.
Knead the dough again, and divide into 8 equal parts, rolling them into small balls. Using a rolling pin, roll out each ball into a round disc approximately 3 inches in diameter.
Place the potato filling in the center of 4 of them, cover with the remaining disks, and roll out into a 4 to 5 inch discs. Brush the breads with soft butter.
Place the stuffed breads on non-stick or well-seasoned cast iron pan on medium-high heat. They can also be cooked on a charcoal grill or pancake griddle. Cook till both sides are golden brown, approximately 2 to 3 minutes per side.
ingredients: 1 potato, baked, cooled, peeled and mashed

step_by_step_instructions: Sift the flour with the salt.
Knead into a soft dough by adding the yogurt, butter, and water.
Cover the dough with a moist cloth and let it rise for 30 minutes.
Combine the ingredients for the potato filling in a bowl and refrigerate until needed.
Knead the dough again and divide into 8 equal parts, rolling them into small balls.
Using a rolling pin, roll out each ball into a round disc approximately 3 inches in diameter.
Place the potato filling in the center of 4 discs, cover with the remaining discs and roll out into 4 to 5 inch discs.
Brush the stuffed breads with soft butter.
Place the stuffed breads on a non-stick or well-seasoned cast iron pan on medium-high heat.
Cook till both sides are golden brown, approximately 2 to 3 minutes per side.

original_instructions:
Glaze: Add all the ingredients to a small bowl and stir until smooth. Set the bowl aside.
Cake: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Lightly grease a Bundt pan or tube pan.
In a bowl, mix together the apples, walnuts, vanilla, and cinnamon. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Using an electric mixer beat the sugar, oil, and eggs in a large bowl. Add in the dry ingredients and beat until completely combined. Fold in the apple mixture.
Scrape the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 1 hour and 30 minutes or until a tester inserted into the middle of the cake comes out clean.
Allow the cake to fully cool in the pan, about 1 hour, and then turn it out onto a plate.
Drizzle the apple cake with some of the honey glaze, serve and enjoy!
ingredients: 3 cups diced Granny Smith apples, about 2 apples

step_by_step_instructions: Add confectioners' sugar, honey, and milk to a small bowl and stir until smooth. Set aside.
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
Lightly grease a Bundt pan or tube pan.
In a bowl, mix together apples, walnuts, vanilla, and cinnamon.
In a separate bowl, sift together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Using an electric mixer, beat sugar, oil, and eggs in a large bowl.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture and beat until completely combined.
Fold in the apple mixture.
Scrape the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour and 30 minutes or until a tester inserted in the middle of the cake comes out clean.
Allow the cake to fully cool in the pan for about 1 hour.
Turn the cake out onto a plate.
Drizzle the apple cake with the honey glaze and serve.

original_instructions: In a small saucepan combine the corn syrup and heavy cream. Bring to a simmer and add the chocolate. Stir until smooth. Remove from the heat and add the vanilla extract.
ingredients: 12 ounces dark chocolate, chopped into small pieces

step_by_step_instructions: In a small saucepan, combine the corn syrup and heavy cream.
Bring to a simmer and add the chocolate.
Stir until smooth.
Remove from the heat and add the vanilla extract.

original_instructions:
Cut the prosciutto slices in half crosswise and arrange in a fan on 4 dinner plates, 5 half slices per plate. Stretch plastic wrap tightly around each plate and refrigerate until needed. To save space, the plates can be stacked.
Place the peaches in a bowl and season, to taste, with salt and pepper. Pour the lemon juice and water over peaches and cover.
Heat the butter over medium heat until the foam subsides and the butter has turned light brown. Add the bay leaf, thyme, vinegar, and salt and pepper, to taste. Cook for 1 minute then add peaches and baby spinach and toss to coat.
Divide evenly among the 4 plates of prosciutto and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 pound peaches (about 3), at room temperature, peeled and cut into 8 wedges
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh thyme leaves

step_by_step_instructions: Cut the prosciutto slices in half crosswise.
Arrange in a fan on 4 dinner plates, using 5 half slices per plate.
Stretch plastic wrap tightly around each plate and refrigerate until needed.
Place the peaches in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Pour lemon juice and water over peaches and cover.
Heat the butter over medium heat until the foam subsides and the butter turns light brown.
Add the bay leaf, thyme, vinegar, and salt and pepper to the butter. Cook for 1 minute.
Add peaches and baby spinach to the pan and toss to coat.
Divide the peaches and spinach evenly among the 4 plates of prosciutto.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions: In a bowl combine cornmeal, Cheddar, onion, bell pepper, salt, and cayenne. Stir in boiling water and mix thoroughly. In a deep heavy pan or deep fryer heat 3 inches of vegetable oil to 350 F. Drop 6 spoonfuls of the batter into the oil and fry for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown. Transfer fritters to paper towels to drain. Season with additional salt if desired. Serve warm with hot sauce.;
ingredients: Louisiana-style hot sauce, for example Crystal brand

step_by_step_instructions: In a bowl combine cornmeal, Cheddar, onion, bell pepper, salt, and cayenne.
Stir in boiling water and mix thoroughly.
In a deep heavy pan or deep fryer, heat 3 inches of vegetable oil to 350 F.
Drop 6 spoonfuls of the batter into the oil and fry for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown.
Transfer fritters to paper towels to drain.
Season with additional salt if desired.
Serve warm with hot sauce.
required_tools: deep heavy pan or deep fryer

original_instructions: In 4 medium size glasses, place two to three scoops of chocolate ice cream into each. Slowly pour cherry vanilla soda over ice cream and top with chopped malted milk balls and a maraschino cherry. Serve with long spoons and a straw.

step_by_step_instructions: In 4 medium size glasses, place two to three scoops of chocolate ice cream into each.
Slowly pour cherry vanilla soda over ice cream.
Top with chopped malted milk balls and a maraschino cherry.
Serve with long spoons and a straw.

original_instructions: Spread bean dip on a flour tortilla, top with shredded cheddar and roll up. Brush with vegetable oil and bake 10 minutes at 400 degrees F. Serve with salsa.

step_by_step_instructions: Spread bean dip on a flour tortilla.
Top with shredded cheddar.
Roll up the tortilla.
Brush with vegetable oil.
Bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees F.
Serve with salsa.

original_instructions:
1.Wash and cut potatoes into wedges, do not peel. Dry potato slices on paper towels.
2.In a large bowl, toss potatoes with Mrs. Dash® Extra Spicy Seasoning Blend, olive oil, and garlic.
3.Spray baking sheet with no-stick cooking spray and lay wedges on baking sheet.
4.Place potatoes in preheated 425 degrees F oven and bake for 20 minutes. Turn the potatoes and bake another 15 minutes or until potatoes are browned and tender.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp. Mrs. Dash® Extra Spicy Seasoning Blend

step_by_step_instructions: Wash and cut potatoes into wedges, do not peel.
Dry potato slices on paper towels.
In a large bowl, toss potatoes with Mrs. Dash Extra Spicy Seasoning Blend, olive oil, and minced garlic.
Spray baking sheet with no-stick cooking spray and lay wedges on baking sheet.
Place potatoes in preheated 425 degrees F oven and bake for 20 minutes.
Turn the potatoes and bake another 15 minutes or until potatoes are browned and tender.

original_instructions:
COMBINE peanut butter, salsa, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder and water in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat, stirring until well combined.
STIR in cooked pasta. Garnish with cheese just before serving.
ingredients: 1/4 cup Jif® Creamy Reduced Fat Peanut Spread
1/2 pound dry rotelle or rotini pasta (2-1/2 cups dry), cooked according to package directions and drained

step_by_step_instructions: Combine peanut butter, salsa, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, and water in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat, stirring until well combined.
Stir in cooked pasta.
Garnish with cheese just before serving.

original_instructions:
Heat the oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic, parsley and black pepper and cook until the onion is tender-crisp, stirring often. Stir the stock in the skillet and heat to a boil. Remove the skillet from the heat.
Place the beef in a roasting pan and brush with the stock mixture. Roast at 350 degrees F for 1 hour or to desired doneness, brushing occasionally with the stock mixture. Remove the beef from the roasting pan.
Stir the flour in the skillet. Stir the flour mixture in the roasting pan. Cook and stir over medium heat until the mixture boils and thickens. Serve the gravy with the beef.

step_by_step_instructions: Heat oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion, garlic, parsley, and black pepper to the skillet.
Cook until the onion is tender-crisp, stirring often.
Stir the beef stock in the skillet and heat to a boil.
Remove the skillet from heat.
Place the beef roast in a roasting pan and brush with the stock mixture.
Roast at 350 degrees F for 1 hour or until desired doneness, brushing occasionally with the stock mixture.
Remove the beef from the roasting pan.
Stir flour into the skillet.
Stir the flour mixture into the roasting pan.
Cook and stir over medium heat until the mixture boils and thickens.
Serve the gravy with the beef.

original_instructions: Cut a stencil out of a plastic coffee can lid in the shape of a 3-inch disk. Whip the egg whites until stiff and chill. In a mixer, cream the butter, then add the sugar and continue mixing. Add the flour and blend in, then add the vanilla and blend again. Add the chilled egg whites and mix on low until well incorporated and the batter is smooth. With a small offset spatula, spread batter through the stencil so it is a circle onto a silpat or parchment paper, about 6 per cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350-degree oven until light golden brown, 7 to 8 minutes. Quickly remove the pan from the oven and one at time place a fortune across the center with a bit hanging out. Fold cookie circle in thirds over fortune with flaps only slightly overlapping each other. Turn over and bring opposing sides together and pinch. Let cool.

step_by_step_instructions: Cut a stencil out of a plastic coffee can lid in the shape of a 3-inch disk.
Whip the egg whites until stiff and chill.
In a mixer, cream the butter.
Add the sugar to the creamed butter and continue mixing.
Add the flour and blend in.
Add the vanilla and blend again.
Add the chilled egg whites and mix on low until well incorporated and the batter is smooth.
With a small offset spatula, spread batter through the stencil so it is a circle onto a silpat or parchment paper, about 6 per cookie sheet.
Bake in a preheated 350-degree oven until light golden brown, 7 to 8 minutes.
Quickly remove the pan from the oven and one at a time place a fortune across the center with a bit hanging out.
Fold cookie circle in thirds over fortune with flaps only slightly overlapping each other.
Turn over and bring opposing sides together and pinch.
Let cool.

original_instructions:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Beat together cookie dough and peanut butter in large bowl until blended and smooth. Stir or knead in mini chips, peanut butter chips and peanuts until evenly distributed.
Drop 1 heaping tablespoon of dough for each cookie onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool slightly on baking sheets. Then transfer to wire rack and cool.
ingredients: 1 package (about 18 ounces) prepared sugar cookie dough

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, beat together the cookie dough and peanut butter until blended and smooth.
Stir or knead in mini chocolate chips, peanut butter chips, and peanuts until evenly distributed.
Drop 1 heaping tablespoon of dough for each cookie onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
Cool the cookies slightly on the baking sheets.
Transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the Parmesan, olive oil, chile paste, lemon zest, oregano and salt. Add the shrimp and toss gently to coat.
Spread the shrimp evenly on a rimmed baking sheet. Bake until the shrimp are pink and opaque throughout, 8 to 10 minutes. Squeeze the lemon half over the shrimp while still hot. Serve warm.
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined, tails on

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the Parmesan, olive oil, chile paste, lemon zest, oregano and salt.
Add the shrimp and toss gently to coat.
Spread the shrimp evenly on a rimmed baking sheet.
Bake until the shrimp are pink and opaque throughout, 8 to 10 minutes.
Squeeze the lemon half over the shrimp while still hot.
Serve warm.

original_instructions: Blanch and shock spinach. Squeeze out all water from spinach. Place spinach, cream, sour cream and cilantro in a food processor. Puree until smooth. Season with salt, L.A spice and lime juice.;

step_by_step_instructions: Blanch spinach in boiling water.
Shock spinach in ice water.
Squeeze out all water from the spinach.
Place spinach, heavy cream, sour cream, and cilantro in a food processor.
Puree the mixture until smooth.
Season with salt, L.A. spice, and lime juice.

recipe_title: Grilled Corn with Maple and Chipotle
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Peel away the outer husks on the corn without actually removing them. Remove the inner silky threads, then wrap the outer husk back around the ear. Soak the ears in water for 1 hour.
In a small saucepan, combine the maple syrup, butter, chiles and garlic and season with salt and pepper. Allow to simmer over medium heat for about 8 minutes. Remove from the heat and keep warm.
Preheat a grill for medium heat. Grill the corn, turning occasionally, until the kernels are slightly charred, about 20 minutes. Brush with the maple butter.
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, chopped to a paste
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Peel away the outer husks on the corn without actually removing them.
Remove the inner silky threads from the corn.
Wrap the outer husk back around the ear.
Soak the ears of corn in water for 1 hour.
In a small saucepan, combine maple syrup, butter, chiles, and garlic.
Season the mixture with salt and pepper.
Allow the mixture to simmer over medium heat for about 8 minutes.
Remove the mixture from the heat and keep it warm.
Preheat a grill for medium heat.
Grill the corn, turning occasionally, until the kernels are slightly charred, about 20 minutes.
Brush the grilled corn with the maple butter.

recipe_title: Rajas de Chiles y Queso Manchego
original_instructions:
Over a medium high heat, in a medium-size cast iron skillet, heat the oil until it smokes. Add the whole epazote leaves and fry until they wilt, stirring all the time, about 2 minutes. Add the chile strips and salt and fry about 3 minutes, stirring all the time.
Reduce the heat to low. Stir in the cream and milk. Add the pieces of cheese and cook until the cheese melts.
Serve hot, over Arroz Blanco.
ingredients: 9 poblano or Anaheim chiles, roasted, peeled, seeded, and cut in strips
1 teaspoon sea salt, or to taste
12 ounces Queso Manchego or Muenster cheese, cut into thick slices

step_by_step_instructions: Over a medium high heat, in a medium-size cast iron skillet, heat the oil until it smokes.
Add the whole epazote leaves and fry until they wilt, stirring all the time, about 2 minutes.
Add the chile strips and salt and fry about 3 minutes, stirring all the time.
Reduce the heat to low.
Stir in the cream and milk.
Add the pieces of cheese and cook until the cheese melts.
Serve hot, over Arroz Blanco.

recipe_title: Arugula Salad with White Truffle Oil, Marcona Almonds and Shaved Parmesan
original_instructions:
Whisk together the lemon juice, mustard and some salt and pepper in a large bowl; slowly whisk in the olive oil.
Add the arugula, almonds and raisins and toss gently to coat. Transfer to a serving platter. Drizzle with the truffle oil, scatter the Parmesan on top and serve.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together the lemon juice, mustard, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
Slowly whisk in the olive oil.
Add the arugula, almonds, and raisins to the bowl and toss gently to coat.
Transfer the salad to a serving platter.
Drizzle with truffle oil.
Scatter Parmesan on top.
Serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix together the filling ingredients and set aside.
Remove the excess fat and rib meat on chicken breast. Lightly and evenly pound chicken breast to 3/8-inch thickness.
Lay the breast flat on the table (shiny side down), and place filling on 1/2 of the breast. Fold the chicken in 1/2 and tuck in corners.
In a bowl, beat together the egg and milk to make an egg wash. Lightly dust the chicken in flour and shake off excess flour. Dip chicken in egg mix, shaking off excess. Coat the chicken in Japanese bread crumbs. Place on a baking pan and lightly drizzle with butter. Bake until golden brown and the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 170 degrees F. Remove from the oven and place on serving dish. Top with bearnaise sauce.
ingredients: 2 ounces cream cheese (or other cheese if desired)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix together the cream cheese, garlic, salt, black pepper, basil, and oregano for the filling and set aside.
Remove the excess fat and rib meat on the chicken breast.
Lightly and evenly pound the chicken breast to 3/8-inch thickness.
Lay the breast flat on the table, shiny side down.
Place filling on one half of the breast.
Fold the chicken in half and tuck in corners.
In a bowl, beat together the egg and milk to make an egg wash.
Lightly dust the chicken with flour and shake off excess flour.
Dip the chicken in the egg mix, shaking off excess.
Coat the chicken in Japanese bread crumbs.
Place on a baking pan and lightly drizzle with butter.
Bake until golden brown and the internal temperature reaches 170 degrees F.
Remove from the oven and place on a serving dish.
Top with bearnaise sauce.

original_instructions:
Cut the cantaloupe in half and remove all seeds from 1/2 with a spoon. Slice a tiny bit off the bottom so it sits flat like a bowl. Place on a plate.
Place cantaloupe half with seeds, seed side down on a plate.
In a bowl, whisk together yogurt and honey; pour into the cantaloupe bowl for dip.
To make wands, slide cubes of fruit onto skewers, leaving 1 inch at both ends of each skewer. Stick 1 end into cantaloupe half, top the skewer with a strawberry.
ingredients: 1 (2-pound) container pre-cut mixed fruit cubes (such as pineapple, cantaloupe, melon, watermelon)

step_by_step_instructions: Cut the cantaloupe in half.
Remove all seeds from one half using a spoon.
Slice a tiny bit off the bottom of the seedless cantaloupe half so it sits flat like a bowl.
Place the seedless cantaloupe half on a plate.
Place the other cantaloupe half, seed side down, on a plate.
In a bowl, whisk together yogurt and honey.
Pour the yogurt and honey mixture into the cantaloupe bowl for dip.
To make fruit wands, slide cubes of mixed fruit onto skewers, leaving 1 inch at both ends of each skewer.
Stick one end of each skewer into the cantaloupe half.
Top the skewer with a strawberry.

original_instructions:
Vanilla Dough preparation:
Beat cake mix, oil, melted butter, egg, and vanilla in large bowl until dough forms. Stir in walnuts.
Chocolate Dough preparation:
Beat cake mix, oil, melted butter, egg, and vanilla in large bowl until dough forms. Stir in walnuts.
Cookie preparation:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Scoop 1 teaspoon of vanilla dough into ball. Scoop 1 teaspoon of chocolate dough into ball. Gently press dough balls together, then roll gently to form one ball. Place 20 balls on an ungreased baking sheet, spaced evenly apart. Bake for 10 minutes, or just until cookies begin to brown. Cool cookies on cookie sheets for 5 minutes. Transfer cookies to cooling racks and cool completely. Repeat with remaining chocolate and vanilla dough, forming about 6 dozen cookies total. Store in airtight container at room temperature up to 2 days, or freeze up to 3 months.

step_by_step_instructions: Vanilla Dough preparation: Beat cake mix, oil, melted butter, egg, and vanilla in a large bowl until dough forms. Stir in walnuts.
Chocolate Dough preparation: Beat cake mix, oil, melted butter, egg, and vanilla in a large bowl until dough forms. Stir in walnuts.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Scoop 1 teaspoon of vanilla dough into a ball.
Scoop 1 teaspoon of chocolate dough into a ball.
Gently press dough balls together, then roll gently to form one ball.
Place 20 balls on an ungreased baking sheet, spaced evenly apart.
Bake for 10 minutes, or just until cookies begin to brown.
Cool cookies on cookie sheets for 5 minutes.
Transfer cookies to cooling racks and cool completely.
Repeat with remaining chocolate and vanilla dough, forming about 6 dozen cookies total.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature up to 2 days, or freeze up to 3 months.

original_instructions:
Lightly wipe the caps clean with a paper towel. Cut into 1/2-inch slices, place in a large zip-top bag and add 3/4 cup of balsamic dressing. Squeeze air from bag and seal. Lightly massage the mushrooms to ensure they are all evenly coated. Marinate in refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours.
Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium high heat. Add the marinated mushrooms and saute for about 6 to 8 minutes until tender.
Meanwhile in a small bowl, stir together ricotta, 2 tablespoons balsamic dressing, and Italian seasoning; season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Spread crostini with the ricotta mixture. Top each crostini with a portobello slice and cross with a red pepper strip. Garnish with oregano leaf.
ingredients: 3/4 cup light roasted garlic balsamic salad dressing, plus 2 tablespoons divided
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/2 cup roasted red bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch wide strips

step_by_step_instructions: Lightly wipe the mushroom caps clean with a paper towel.
Cut the mushrooms into 1/2-inch slices.
Place the mushroom slices in a large zip-top bag and add 3/4 cup of balsamic dressing.
Squeeze air from the bag and seal it.
Lightly massage the mushrooms to ensure they are evenly coated.
Marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours.
Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium high heat.
Add the marinated mushrooms to the pan and saute for about 6 to 8 minutes until tender.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, stir together ricotta, 2 tablespoons balsamic dressing, and Italian seasoning.
Season the ricotta mixture with salt and pepper and set aside.
Spread the crostini with the ricotta mixture.
Top each crostini with a portobello slice.
Cross each with a red pepper strip.
Garnish with an oregano leaf.

original_instructions:
Combine the yogurt, olive oil, lemon zest and juice, rosemary, salt, and pepper in a large non-reactive bowl. Add the lamb, making sure it is covered with marinade. Marinate in the refrigerator, covered, overnight or for up to 3 days.
Bring the lamb to room temperature. Prepare a charcoal grill with hot coals. Scrape the marinade off the lamb, wipe the meat with paper towels, and season it generously with salt and pepper. Brush the grill with oil to keep the lamb from sticking, and grill on both sides until the internal temperature is 120 to 125 degrees for rare. This will take 40 minutes to 1 hour, depending on how hot the grill is.
Remove the lamb to a cutting board, cover with aluminum foil, and allow to rest for 20 minutes. Then slice and serve.
ingredients: 2 pounds (2 pints) plain yogurt (regular or low-fat)
1/2 cup good olive oil, plus more for brushing grill
1/2 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (3 lemons)
3/4 cup fresh whole rosemary leaves (2 large bunches)
1 (5-pound) butterflied leg of lamb (9 pounds bone-in)

step_by_step_instructions: Combine yogurt, olive oil, lemon zest and juice, rosemary, salt, and pepper in a large non-reactive bowl.
Add the lamb to the bowl, ensuring it is fully coated with the marinade.
Cover the bowl and marinate the lamb in the refrigerator overnight or for up to 3 days.
Bring the marinated lamb to room temperature.
Prepare a charcoal grill with hot coals.
Scrape off the marinade from the lamb and wipe the meat with paper towels.
Season the lamb generously with salt and pepper.
Brush the grill with olive oil to prevent sticking.
Grill the lamb on both sides until the internal temperature is 120 to 125 degrees for rare, approximately 40 minutes to 1 hour.
Remove the lamb from the grill and place it on a cutting board.
Cover the lamb with aluminum foil and let it rest for 20 minutes.
Slice the rested lamb and serve.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Spread hazelnut spread on 1 side of each tortilla.
In a large pan over medium heat add 2 tablespoons of butter and let it melt until bubbly. Add 2 of the tortillas with the chocolate hazelnut spread side facing up. Using an imaginary line add 1/3 cup of marshmallows down 1 half of each tortilla, making sure to keep them in a single layer. Allow the tortilla to slightly bubble on the pan and check underneath for a golden, toasted color. Fold the tortilla over to form a half circle and slightly press down to seal. Cook until marshmallows start to melt but don't lose their shape. Transfer them to a cutting board. Repeat with the remaining tortillas.
Meanwhile, put the hazelnuts on a plate. Cut the tortillas in half, then quickly press the opened sides into the chopped hazelnuts. Arrange them on a serving platter and serve immediately.

step_by_step_instructions: Spread hazelnut spread on one side of each tortilla.
In a large pan over medium heat, add 2 tablespoons of butter and let it melt until bubbly.
Add 2 tortillas with the chocolate hazelnut spread side facing up.
Using an imaginary line, add 1/3 cup of marshmallows down one half of each tortilla, making sure to keep them in a single layer.
Allow the tortilla to slightly bubble on the pan and check underneath for a golden, toasted color.
Fold the tortilla over to form a half circle and slightly press down to seal.
Cook until marshmallows start to melt but don't lose their shape.
Transfer them to a cutting board.
Repeat steps 2-7 with the remaining tortillas.
Meanwhile, put the hazelnuts on a plate.
Cut the tortillas in half, then quickly press the opened sides into the chopped hazelnuts.
Arrange them on a serving platter and serve immediately.

recipe_title: Biscuit Crumble with Chocolate and Raspberries
original_instructions:
Add the sugar, cocoa powder, flour, vanilla and salt to a small pot. Add the milk and cook over low heat, whisking, until thick.
Divide the raspberries among 4 bowls and serve topped with crumbled biscuits and the warm chocolate gravy.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
In a bowl and using your fingers, mix the flour and coconut oil together very well until the mixture feels crumbly. Add the milk and mix (but don't overmix). Knead the dough just a couple of times, then roll it out to a thickness of 1/2 inch on a floured surface. Cut into 3-inch rounds and put the rounds on a baking sheet.
Bake for about 3 minutes, then liberally brush the biscuits with melted butter. Bake until golden, about 12 more minutes.
ingredients: Biscuit scraps or whole biscuits, store-bought or homemade, recipe follows, for crumbling
2 cups self-rising flour, sifted, plus more for flouring work surface
1/4 cup cold coconut oil (refrigerate to solidify prior to measuring)

step_by_step_instructions: Add sugar, cocoa powder, flour, vanilla, and salt to a small pot.
Add milk and cook over low heat, whisking until thick.
Divide raspberries among 4 bowls.
Top raspberries with crumbled biscuits and warm chocolate gravy.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
In a bowl, mix flour and coconut oil using your fingers until the mixture feels crumbly.
Add milk to the flour mixture and mix lightly.
Knead the dough just a couple of times.
Roll out dough to a thickness of 1/2 inch on a floured surface.
Cut dough into 3-inch rounds and place on a baking sheet.
Bake biscuits for about 3 minutes.
Brush biscuits with melted butter.
Bake until golden, about 12 more minutes.

original_instructions:
Place the sausages in a large pan. Pour the red wine over the sausages. Add the garlic, onions, and parsley. Drizzle the olive oil over the mixture, making sure everything is evenly coated. Marinate for 24 hours in the refrigerator.
Preheat the grill to medium heat.
When the grill is hot, add the sausages and cook, turning occasionally, until cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes.
ingredients: 2 heads garlic, top cut off to reveal cloves
1 bunch fresh flat-leaf parsley, gently mashed

step_by_step_instructions: Place the sausages in a large pan.
Pour the red wine over the sausages.
Add the garlic, onions, and parsley.
Drizzle the olive oil over the mixture, making sure everything is evenly coated.
Marinate for 24 hours in the refrigerator.
Preheat the grill to medium heat.
When the grill is hot, add the sausages.
Cook, turning occasionally, until cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes.

original_instructions: Trim green beans and rinse. Melt butter. Add beans and water. Steam until tender.

step_by_step_instructions: Trim the green beans and rinse them.
Melt the butter in a pan.
Add the green beans and water to the pan.
Steam the green beans until they are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

original_instructions: Heat the butter in a large heavy saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the butternut squash and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Cook until the squash is beginning to caramelize, about 6 to 8 minutes. Add the apples and continue to brown, another 5 minutes. Stir in 1 cup of water and the sugar. Cover, then reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Add the cinnamon and cook until the squash and apples are coated in a deep golden brown glaze, about 5 minutes more. Transfer the stew to a serving bowl and serve.
ingredients: 1/2 butternut squash, peeled, seeds removed and cut into 1-inch chunks
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
3 Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored and chopped into 1-inch chunks

step_by_step_instructions: Heat the butter in a large heavy saute pan over medium-high heat.
Add the butternut squash and season with salt and pepper.
Cook until the squash is beginning to caramelize, about 6 to 8 minutes.
Add the apples and continue to brown, another 5 minutes.
Stir in 1 cup of water and the sugar.
Cover, then reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until tender, about 15 minutes.
Add the cinnamon and cook until the squash and apples are coated in a deep golden brown glaze, about 5 minutes more.
Transfer the stew to a serving bowl and serve.

original_instructions: Wet the rusks and dry with a clean towel. Grate the tomato and combine with the feta. Spread on the rusks. Sprinkle with the oil, salt, oregano and a little grated onion, if using.
ingredients: 1 medium white or yellow onion, grated, optional

step_by_step_instructions: Wet the rusks.
Dry the rusks with a clean towel.
Grate the tomatoes.
Combine the grated tomato with the crumbled feta cheese.
Spread the tomato and feta mixture on the rusks.
Sprinkle with olive oil.
Add salt.
Sprinkle with oregano and optionally, grated onion.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a cocktail shaker add all of the ingredients, except the grenadine. Add ice and shake, then pour into glasses filled with ice.
Top each with a splash of grenadine and garnish with an orange twist.

step_by_step_instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add orange vodka, Danish cherry liqueur, ginger liqueur, freshly squeezed lime juice, pineapple juice, and bitters.
Add ice to the cocktail shaker.
Shake the mixture well.
Pour the shaken mixture into glasses filled with ice.
Top each glass with a splash of grenadine.
Garnish each drink with an orange twist.

original_instructions:
For the champagne flutes: Bring 1 cup water to a boil in a saucepan. In a medium bowl, whisk together the boiling water, honey and gelatin. Refrigerate until the mixture is cooled slightly but still liquid, about 30 minutes.
Stir in the champagne. Pour the mixture into 6 champagne flutes. Let set for 20 more minutes in the fridge. Place a raspberry in the bottom of each flute. Let sit in the fridge until fully set, about 3 hours.
For the whipped cream: Begin to beat the heavy cream with an electric mixer in a large bowl. Gradually add the sugar and keep beating until you have soft peaks of whipped cream.
To serve: Top the champagne flutes with whipped cream and gold sugar sprinkles.
ingredients: Gold sugar sprinkles or gold leaf, for garnish

step_by_step_instructions: Bring 1 cup water to a boil in a saucepan.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the boiling water, honey, and gelatin.
Refrigerate until the mixture is cooled slightly but still liquid, about 30 minutes.
Stir in the champagne.
Pour the mixture into 6 champagne flutes.
Let set for 20 more minutes in the fridge.
Place a raspberry in the bottom of each flute.
Let sit in the fridge until fully set, about 3 hours.
Begin to beat the heavy cream with an electric mixer in a large bowl.
Gradually add the sugar and keep beating until you have soft peaks of whipped cream.
Top the champagne flutes with whipped cream and gold sugar sprinkles.

original_instructions: Put ice in a highball glass or mug. Add the Pimms and then the ginger ale and soda. Stir and garnish with cucumber. Serve.
ingredients: 2 ounces lemon lime soda or club soda
1/4 cup cucumber pieces or 1 cucumber spear

step_by_step_instructions: Put ice in a highball glass or mug.
Add the Pimms.
Add the ginger ale and soda.
Stir the mixture.
Garnish with cucumber.
Serve.

original_instructions:
Bring water and stock to a boil, then reduce heat to low to keep warm.
In a large skillet, heat oil and butter over medium to medium high heat. Add onions and saute 3 minutes. Add arborio rice and saute, 2 or 3 minutes more. Add wine or sherry and allow liquid to absorb, 1 minute. Add 1/2 the stock or broth and reduce heat slightly. Simmer, stirring frequently until liquid is absorbed, then add more liquid, a few ladles at a time. When liquid cooks out, ladle in a bit more.
When risotto has cooked almost to al dente, about 18 minutes, fold in spinach, basil and parsley. Season risotto with nutmeg, salt and pepper and stir in any remaining broth. Risotto will cook 22 minutes, total. Stir in cheese and serve immediately.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 2 turns of the pan
1/2 cup dry white wine or dry sherry
1 cup loosely packed basil leaves, chopped or torn
1/2 cup flat-leaf parsley, a couple of handfuls, chopped
Coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/2 to 2/3 cup grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, 2 or 3 handfuls

step_by_step_instructions: Bring water and stock to a boil, then reduce heat to low to keep warm.
In a large skillet, heat oil and butter over medium to medium high heat.
Add onions and saute for 3 minutes.
Add arborio rice and saute for 2 or 3 minutes more.
Add wine and allow the liquid to absorb for 1 minute.
Add half of the stock or broth and reduce heat slightly.
Simmer, stirring frequently until the liquid is absorbed, then add more liquid, a few ladles at a time.
When liquid cooks out, ladle in a bit more.
When risotto has cooked almost to al dente, about 18 minutes, fold in spinach, basil and parsley.
Season risotto with nutmeg, salt, and pepper and stir in any remaining broth.
Risotto will cook for 22 minutes in total.
Stir in cheese and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Toss the potatoes with the butter and mustard on a baking sheet until coated; season with salt and pepper. Roast, stirring once halfway through, until the potatoes are browned and tender, about 25 minutes. Stir in the spinach and garlic and continue to roast until the spinach is wilted, 1 to 2 minutes more. Adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper.
Copyright 2016 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Toss the potatoes with the butter and mustard on a baking sheet until coated.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roast, stirring once halfway through, until the potatoes are browned and tender, about 25 minutes.
Stir in the spinach and garlic and continue to roast until the spinach is wilted, 1 to 2 minutes more.
Adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper.

original_instructions:
Heat the olive oil or butter in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook the onions with the salt until they start to caramelize, 10 to 15 minutes. Add the plantains or bananas and cook 10 minutes longer. Stir in the garlic, oregano, thyme, and rosemary and cook just until aromatic, about 3 minutes longer.
Add the tomatoes, bread chunks and chicken or vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook, stirring frequently, until the bread has softened and the flavors are well blended, about 45 minutes. Ladle the soup into bowls, then squeeze a wedge of lime into each and toss in the wedge. Serve hot.
ingredients: 1 bunch fresh oregano, leaves only, chopped, or 1/2 tablespoon dried
1/2 bunch fresh thyme, leaves only, chopped, or 1/2 tablespoon dried
Small sprig of fresh rosemary, leaves only, chopped, or 1/4 teaspoon dried
1 1/2 cups canned tomatoes, diced, with the juices
6 ounces baguette (about 1/3 loaf), cut into 1/2-inch chunks (with crust)
6 cups chicken stock or vegetable stock
2 limes, cut into quarters, for garnish
1/4 cup olive oil or 4 tablespoons unsalted butter
2 ripe plantains or bananas, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch slices on the diagonal

step_by_step_instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat.
Cook the onions with the salt until they start to caramelize, 10 to 15 minutes.
Add the plantains and cook 10 minutes longer.
Stir in the garlic, oregano, thyme, and rosemary and cook just until aromatic, about 3 minutes longer.
Add the tomatoes, bread chunks, and chicken stock.
Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook, stirring frequently, until the bread has softened and the flavors are well blended, about 45 minutes.
Ladle the soup into bowls, then squeeze a wedge of lime into each and toss in the wedge.
Serve hot.

original_instructions: Fill a Collins glass with ice. Add the vodka, peach schnapps and cranberry juice.

step_by_step_instructions: Fill a Collins glass with ice.
Add the vodka to the glass.
Add the peach schnapps to the glass.
Add the cranberry juice to the glass.

original_instructions:
With hands crush each bag of chips separately into a shallow dish. In another shallow dish, add 1 cup of flour and in another shallow dish; beat 3 eggs. Dredge chicken strips in flour, then egg and finally into the crushed tortillas. Dredge half the chicken in the spicy chips and the other half into the blue corn chips. Transfer to plate. Sprinkle with Big Daddy seasoning.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add oil. Add chicken strips 1 at a time and pan-fry until golden and cooked through, about 3 minutes on each side. Remove from pan onto a plate and reserve.
In a large bowl, toss together lettuce, field greens, beans, plum tomatoes, Cheddar, avocados, jalapenos and fresh cilantro. Top with cooked chicken and peppercorn dressing.
In a large bowl, mix ingredients together.
ingredients: 4 boneless/skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch strips
1 to 2 tablespoons Big Daddy Seasoning, recipe follows
1 (12-ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed

step_by_step_instructions: Crush each bag of chips separately into a shallow dish.
In another shallow dish, add 1 cup of flour.
In another shallow dish, beat 3 eggs.
Dredge chicken strips in flour, then egg, and finally into the crushed chips.
Dredge half the chicken in the spicy chips and the other half into the blue corn chips.
Transfer to plate. Sprinkle with Big Daddy seasoning.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add oil.
Add chicken strips 1 at a time and pan-fry until golden and cooked through, about 3 minutes on each side.
Remove from pan onto a plate and reserve.
In a large bowl, toss together lettuce, field greens, beans, plum tomatoes, Cheddar, avocados, jalapenos, and fresh cilantro.
Top with cooked chicken and peppercorn dressing.

original_instructions:
Lay peppers on their sides on racks of gas burners and turn flames on moderately high. Roast, turning frequently with tongs, until skins are blackened, 5 to 8 minutes. (Or broil on rack of a broiler pan about 4 inches from heat, turning frequently, 15 to 20 minutes.)
Transfer to a bowl, then cover, and let steam 10 minutes. Alternatively, place peppers in resealable plastic bags to steam. Peel peppers and discard stems and seeds. Cut lengthwise into 1-inch-wide strips.
In a bowl, place cleaned peppers. Douse with balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper, to taste.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Lay peppers on their sides on racks of gas burners.
Turn flames on moderately high.
Roast, turning frequently with tongs, until skins are blackened, 5 to 8 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl, then cover, and let steam for 10 minutes.
Peel peppers and discard stems and seeds.
Cut lengthwise into 1-inch-wide strips.
In a bowl, place cleaned peppers.
Douse with balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper to taste.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Place the almonds, goji berries, pumpkin seeds, walnuts and apricots in a medium bowl, and toss together.

step_by_step_instructions: Place the almonds in a medium bowl.
Add the goji berries to the bowl.
Add the pumpkin seeds to the bowl.
Add the walnuts to the bowl.
Quarter the apricots and add them to the bowl.
Toss all ingredients together.

original_instructions:
Soak the couscous in cold water for 10 minutes to loosen the grains. Then steam over a saucepan of boiling water or stock for a further 5 minutes. This prevents the couscous from getting sticky and lumpy.
Meanwhile burn the outside of the pepper over a naked gas flame. When the skin is black place pepper into plastic bag and seal. Rub from the outside to remove all the pepper skin.
Roast the aubergine and zucchini in a preheated 220 degrees F oven.
When all vegetables are ready finely chop them up and mix into the couscous. Add salt, tumeric, cumin, and black pepper, to taste. Steam for a further 5 minutes. Garnish with sliced tomatoes and serve.

step_by_step_instructions: Soak the couscous in cold water for 10 minutes to loosen the grains.
Steam the couscous over a saucepan of boiling water or stock for 5 minutes.
Burn the outside of the pepper over a naked gas flame until the skin is black.
Place the burned pepper into a plastic bag, seal, and rub from the outside to remove the skin.
Roast the eggplant and zucchini in a preheated 220 degrees F oven.
Finely chop the prepared vegetables and mix into the couscous.
Add salt, turmeric, cumin, and black pepper to taste.
Steam the couscous and vegetable mixture for a further 5 minutes.
Garnish with sliced tomatoes and serve.

original_instructions: Place the lettuce in a bed on the bottom of the hot dog roll. Layer the lobster meat on top of the lettuce and place a dab of mayonnaise on top of the meat. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 hot dog roll, toasted (recommended: "New England-style" hot dog roll, no crust, split on top)
3 to 4 ounces freshly picked lobster meat (1 lobster's worth)

step_by_step_instructions: Place the lettuce in a bed on the bottom of the hot dog roll.
Layer the lobster meat on top of the lettuce.
Place a dab of mayonnaise on top of the meat.
Enjoy!

original_instructions:
In a medium saucepan, combine the butter, vanilla, and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring and watching closely until the butter browns, 8 to 10 minutes. Strain the butter into a medium bowl; cool to room temperature. (Discard solids.)
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line a 9 by 2-inch cake pan with parchment paper and pack the apples in a dish.
Whisk the yolks and sugar in a large mixing bowl until thick and bright yellow. Gradually whisk in the butter until combined. Stir in the flour and sesame seeds until incorporated. Pour over the apples to cover completely and smooth the top. Bake 20 minutes, then rotate the dish from front to back. Bake 20 to 25 minutes more or until the top is golden and the filling is just set.

step_by_step_instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine the butter, vanilla, and 1 teaspoon salt.
Cook over medium heat, stirring and watching closely until the butter browns, 8 to 10 minutes.
Strain the butter into a medium bowl and cool to room temperature. Discard solids.
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
Line a 9 by 2-inch cake pan with parchment paper.
Pack the apples in the dish.
Whisk the yolks and sugar in a large mixing bowl until thick and bright yellow.
Gradually whisk in the butter until combined.
Stir in the flour and sesame seeds until incorporated.
Pour the mixture over the apples to cover completely and smooth the top.
Bake for 20 minutes, then rotate the dish from front to back.
Bake for an additional 20 to 25 minutes until the top is golden and the filling is just set.

original_instructions:
Over a double boiler, combine miso, sugar, sake, and mirin and whisk until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and let cool. Refrigerate for a few hours so that marinade is cold and add black cod fillets or fillet pieces. Marinate for 24 to 48 hours in refrigerator.
Remove from marinade and scrape off most of marinade that is coating the fish. Preheat oven to broil (oven should be very hot and heat should be coming from the top down). Place fish on a greased foil-lined baking sheet. Place baking sheet approximately 6 inches away from top heating element. Broil 7 to 10 minutes, until browned. Depending on the thickness of the fish, fish should flake away; otherwise, bake an additional few minutes.
ingredients: 6 to 8 black cod fillets or fillet pieces

step_by_step_instructions: Over a double boiler, combine miso, sugar, sake, and mirin.
Whisk the mixture until the sugar dissolves.
Remove from heat and let the mixture cool.
Refrigerate the mixture for a few hours until it is cold.
Add black cod fillets to the cold marinade.
Marinate the fish for 24 to 48 hours in the refrigerator.
Remove the fish from the marinade and scrape off most of the marinade.
Preheat the oven to broil with heat coming from the top down.
Place the fish on a greased, foil-lined baking sheet.
Position the baking sheet approximately 6 inches away from the top heating element.
Broil the fish for 7 to 10 minutes until browned.
Check if the fish flakes away; if not, bake for a few additional minutes.

original_instructions: Cook sugar, syrup and water until mixture thickens and bubbles (about 230 degrees). Add butter and pecans. Stir continuously and continue cooking until nuts begin to brown or start popping (290 degrees). Remove from heat. Add vanilla and soda and stir thoroughly. Pour quickly in several pieces on large buttered surface. Do not spread with knife or spoon. Allow to cool slightly. Stretch and pull with hands until very thin. (The thinner it is stretched, the more brittle it will be.) When cooled and hardened, break into small pieces. Store in airtight container.

step_by_step_instructions: Cook sugar, syrup and water until mixture thickens and bubbles (about 230 degrees).
Add butter and pecans.
Stir continuously and continue cooking until nuts begin to brown or start popping (290 degrees).
Remove from heat.
Add vanilla and soda and stir thoroughly.
Pour quickly in several pieces on large buttered surface.
Allow to cool slightly.
Stretch and pull with hands until very thin.
When cooled and hardened, break into small pieces.
Store in airtight container.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat a griddle over medium heat and brush it with some oil.
Whisk the eggs in a large mixing bowl. Stir in the chicken, mushrooms, bean sprouts, bok choy, carrots, scallions, bell pepper, grated ginger and garlic. Season with salt and pepper.
Using a large spoon, drop about 1/2 cup of the mixture onto the griddle for each "pancake". Cook until golden, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
Meanwhile, mix the cornstarch with a splash of chicken stock to dissolve. Combine the remaining stock, the cornstarch mixture, tamari, hot sauce and sliced ginger in a small saucepan. Boil until thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, about 3 minutes. Discard the sliced ginger.
Put 2 pancakes on each plate and top with the gravy.
ingredients: 4 ounces thinly sliced deli chicken, turkey, ham or roast beef, finely chopped
4 ounces shiitake mushrooms, stemmed and thinly sliced
1 bunch scallions, thinly sliced on an angle
1/4 red bell pepper, very thinly sliced
One 1-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated, plus 2 thin slices
1 large clove garlic, grated or made into a paste

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a griddle over medium heat and brush it with oil.
Whisk the eggs in a large mixing bowl.
Stir in the chicken, mushrooms, bean sprouts, bok choy, carrots, scallions, bell pepper, grated ginger, and garlic.
Season with salt and pepper.
Using a large spoon, drop about 1/2 cup of the mixture onto the griddle for each pancake.
Cook until golden, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
Mix the cornstarch with a splash of chicken stock to dissolve.
Combine the remaining stock, the cornstarch mixture, tamari, hot sauce, and sliced ginger in a small saucepan.
Boil until thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, about 3 minutes.
Discard the sliced ginger.
Put 2 pancakes on each plate and top with the gravy.

original_instructions: In a frying pan, combine the almonds and oil at room temperature. Place the pan on burner and slowly bring to a boil. When the almonds begin to brown, remove them to a colander to drain. Salt the almonds and serve warm but not hot.;

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the almonds and oil in a frying pan at room temperature.
Place the pan on the burner and slowly bring to a boil.
When the almonds begin to brown, remove them to a colander to drain.
Salt the almonds.
Serve the almonds warm but not hot.

original_instructions:
Mix 3/4 cup mayonnaise, the zest and juice of 1 lemon, 1 teaspoon Old Bay Seasoning, 1 minced scallion and a few drops of hot sauce.
Photograph by Levi Brown

step_by_step_instructions: Mix 3/4 cup mayonnaise.
Add the zest and juice of 1 lemon.
Stir in 1 teaspoon Old Bay Seasoning.
Incorporate 1 minced scallion.
Add a few drops of hot sauce and mix well.

original_instructions: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass. Add ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with rosebuds.

step_by_step_instructions: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass.
Add ice to the mixing glass.
Shake the mixture vigorously.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish the cocktail with rosebuds.

recipe_title: Baked Catfish in Spicy Bbq Sauce
original_instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper. Place fish in an oval casserole dish. Melt butter in small saucepan. Add remaining ingredients and simmer about three minutes. Spoon sauce over fish and cook fish in 375 degree oven for about 10 to 12 minutes (or until done). Sprinkle with chopped parsley.

step_by_step_instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper.
Place fish in an oval casserole dish.
Melt butter in a small saucepan.
Add Worcestershire sauce, garlic, jerk seasoning, Dijon mustard, catsup, and balsamic vinegar to the saucepan and simmer for about three minutes.
Spoon the sauce over the fish.
Cook the fish in a 375-degree oven for about 10 to 12 minutes or until done.
Sprinkle with chopped parsley.

original_instructions: Drop 1 to 3 raspberries in each of 4 Champagne flutes. Add 1 to 2 teaspoons of creme de cassis in the bottom of each glass. Top off each glass with some prosecco. Serve immediately.

step_by_step_instructions: Drop 1 to 3 raspberries in each of 4 Champagne flutes.
Add 1 to 2 teaspoons of creme de cassis in the bottom of each glass.
Top off each glass with some prosecco.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Mash 6 hard-boiled egg yolks, 1/3 cup creme fraiche, 1/4 cup crumbled cooked bacon, 1 teaspoon Sriracha (hot Asian chili sauce), 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro, 1/2 teaspoon dijon mustard, 1/4 teaspoon lime zest, 1 teaspoon lime juice and salt. Spoon into the egg whites; top with more lime zest.
Photographs by Levi Brown

step_by_step_instructions: Mash the hard-boiled egg yolks.
Add creme fraiche, crumbled cooked bacon, Sriracha, chopped cilantro, dijon mustard, lime zest, lime juice, and salt to the mashed yolks.
Mix everything well.
Spoon the mixture into the egg whites.
Top with more lime zest.

original_instructions: Preheat oven: 400 degrees F. Line loose bottom tart pan with dough rolled out 1/8-inch thick. Spread bottom of pastry with shredded cheese and sprinkle with basil. Cover with tomato slices, arranging to cover as evenly as possible. Sprinkle tomatoes with salt and pepper and drizzle with olive oil. Bake 20 to 30 minutes. Watch carefully. When crust is golden and cheese is bubbly, remove. Garnish with fresh basil. Slice in wedges and serve warm.
ingredients: 1 store-bought or homemade dough for tart shell
2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil, plus extra for garnish

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Line loose bottom tart pan with dough rolled out 1/8-inch thick.
Spread the bottom of the pastry with shredded cheese.
Sprinkle with chopped basil.
Cover with tomato slices, arranging to cover as evenly as possible.
Sprinkle tomatoes with salt and pepper.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Bake for 20 to 30 minutes, watching carefully.
When crust is golden and cheese is bubbly, remove from oven.
Garnish with fresh basil.
Slice in wedges and serve warm.

original_instructions:
Zest the orange, then supreme the sections (remove the fruit from the white pith completely). Place the orange zest and sections into a food processor and process 3-4 seconds, it should remain chunky. Place the cranberry mixture, sugar and water in a saucepan. Cover the saucepan and cook on medium-low, stirring every couple minutes, for 15 minutes. Pour into *sterilized canning jars and seal as directed. Label the jars and tie ribbons around them for gift giving.
*Follow the directions on your canning jars for sterilization.

step_by_step_instructions: Zest the orange.
Supreme the orange sections to remove the fruit from the white pith completely.
Place the orange zest and sections into a food processor.
Process the orange in the food processor for 3-4 seconds until chunky.
Place the cranberry mixture, sugar, and water in a saucepan.
Cover the saucepan and cook on medium-low, stirring every couple of minutes, for 15 minutes.
Pour the mixture into sterilized canning jars and seal as directed.
Label the jars and tie ribbons around them for gift giving.

original_instructions:
In a large Dutch oven heat the oil and brown the ribs on all sides. Add the carrots, celery, onion, and garlic. Continue to cook for about 2 to 3 minutes. Add the tomato paste and cook stirring slowly for 3 more minutes. Optional: you can dust the short ribs at this time with flour to help thicken the sauce. Add the rest of the ingredients and cover. Cook for about 2 hours on low heat (simmer) or until the meat begins to pull from the bone. When done remove from the pan and strain the liquid. You can now thicken the sauce or leave as is and season with salt and pepper. Serve with truffle mashed potatoes and haricots verts.
Truffle mashed potatoes are standard mashed potatoes with chopped black truffles and a little truffle oil added to them.
ingredients: Beef broth, enough to cover the ribs

step_by_step_instructions: Heat the oil in a large Dutch oven.
Brown the ribs on all sides in the Dutch oven.
Add the carrots, celery, onion, and garlic to the Dutch oven.
Continue to cook for about 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the tomato paste and cook, stirring slowly for 3 more minutes.
Optionally, dust the short ribs with flour to help thicken the sauce.
Add the rest of the ingredients, including the bay leaf and thyme, and cover the Dutch oven.
Cook on low heat (simmer) for about 2 hours, or until the meat begins to pull from the bone.
When done, remove the ribs from the pan and strain the liquid.
You can now thicken the sauce or leave as is and season with salt and pepper.
Serve with mashed potatoes.

original_instructions:
Special equipment: 1 saucepan 1 mixing bowl (that will sit on top of saucepan) Measuring cup Measuring spoons Whisk Fondue serving set Fondue skewers Handy fuel or denatured alcohol
Put approximately 4 inches of water in the saucepan and bring to a slow boil. Place the mixing bowl on top and pour in the heavy cream; let heat. Meanwhile, break up or chop chocolate into small pieces. When the cream feels hot to the touch, add chocolate and whisk until smooth. Whisk in vanilla and brandy. Pour into the fondue pot and light the handy fuel underneath; keep the flame low as not to burn the fondue. Arrange strawberries, bananas, pineapple, brownies, marshmallow, cookies or any of your favorite items on a platter and enjoy.
ingredients: 1 pound premium semisweet chocolate (recommended: Lindt or Callebaut)

step_by_step_instructions: Put approximately 4 inches of water in the saucepan and bring to a slow boil.
Place the mixing bowl on top of the saucepan and pour in the heavy cream; let heat.
Meanwhile, break up or chop the chocolate into small pieces.
When the cream feels hot to the touch, add chocolate and whisk until smooth.
Whisk in vanilla and brandy.
Pour the melted chocolate mixture into the fondue pot and light the handy fuel underneath; keep the flame low as not to burn the fondue.
Arrange strawberries, bananas, pineapple, brownies, marshmallow, cookies or any of your favorite items on a platter.
Enjoy with fondue skewers.

recipe_title: Broccoli and Cauliflower Gratin Mac n Cheese
original_instructions:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil over medium heat. Salt the water and add the broccoli and cauliflower florets. Boil the vegetables for 5 minutes, then remove them with a spider or a strainer and drain. Add the pasta to the water and undercook by about 2 minutes, drain.
Meanwhile, combine the sour cream in a large bowl along with the mustard, chives, garlic, hot sauce and salt and pepper, to taste. Add the pasta and cauliflower and 2/3 of the cheese. Stir to combine, then transfer it to a casserole or baking dish and cover with the remaining cheese. Cool and chill for a make-ahead meal.
To heat and eat, put the casserole on baking sheet and bake it in the middle of a preheated 375 degree F oven until deeply golden and bubbly, about 40 to 45 minutes.
ingredients: 1 small head or bundle broccoli, trimmed into florets
1 small head cauliflower or half a large head, trimmed and cut into florets
1 pound whole-wheat macaroni or penne or other short cut pasta
2 cups sour cream or reduced-fat sour cream
2 cloves garlic, peeled and grated or crushed into paste

step_by_step_instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil over medium heat.
Salt the water and add the broccoli and cauliflower florets.
Boil the vegetables for 5 minutes, then remove them with a spider or a strainer and drain.
Add the pasta to the water and undercook by about 2 minutes, then drain.
Meanwhile, combine the sour cream, mustard, chives, garlic, hot sauce, and salt and pepper in a large bowl.
Add the pasta and cauliflower to the bowl with 2/3 of the cheese and stir to combine.
Transfer the mixture to a casserole or baking dish and cover with the remaining cheese.
Cool and chill for a make-ahead meal.
To heat and eat, put the casserole on a baking sheet and bake it in the middle of a preheated 375 degree F oven until deeply golden and bubbly, about 40 to 45 minutes.

recipe_title: Lamb Chops with White Beans and Gremolata
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Pat lamb chops dry and season with salt and pepper. Lightly spray a large, shallow, flameproof casserole or heavy ovenproof skillet (about 12 inches in diameter) with vegetable oil and heat over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking. In casserole, brown lamb chops about 1 1/2 minutes on each side and transfer to a plate. Add onion to casserole and cook, stirring, over moderately low heat until softened. Add tomatoes, garlic, and rosemary and cook over moderate heat, stirring, 1 minute. Stir in broth and beans, and simmer, stirring occasionally, 3 minutes.
Arrange lamb chops on top of bean mixture and roast, uncovered, in middle of oven for 5 minutes for medium-rare. Let lamb chops and bean mixture stand, loosely covered, for 5 minutes. Transfer lamb chops to another plate and toss bean mixture with gremolata.
Serve lamb chops with haricots vertes.
ingredients: 8 rib lamb chops, frenched and trimmed of all fat (1 1/2 pounds total)
3/4 pound plum tomatoes, finely chopped (about 2 cups)
1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh rosemary leaves
1 cup chicken broth, skimmed of fat
2 cups rinsed and drained canned small white beans (about one and a half 15-ounce cans)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
Pat lamb chops dry and season with salt and pepper.
Lightly spray a large, shallow, flameproof casserole or heavy ovenproof skillet with vegetable oil and heat over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking.
Brown lamb chops in the casserole for about 1 1/2 minutes on each side and transfer to a plate.
Add onion to the casserole and cook, stirring, over moderately low heat until softened.
Add tomatoes, garlic, and rosemary to the casserole and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Stir in broth and beans, and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes.
Arrange lamb chops on top of the bean mixture and roast, uncovered, in the middle of the oven for 5 minutes for medium-rare.
Let the lamb chops and bean mixture stand, loosely covered, for 5 minutes.
Transfer lamb chops to another plate and toss the bean mixture with gremolata.
Serve lamb chops with haricots vertes.

original_instructions:
In a blender process 1 tablespoon of the vinegar, garlic and chilies to a paste. Add remaining vinegar and next 7 ingredients and season with pepper; process until combined. In a large bowl place beef and pour blender contents over; toss to combine. Marinate, covered, 2 hours at room temperature or refrigerate overnight.
In a large skillet heat ghee over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute 10 minutes, or until lightly browned. Sprinkle meat with poppy seeds and toss to coat. Turn heat to medium and add meat, marinade, bay leaf and cloves. Cook, turning beef often, 5 minutes. Stir in tomato paste. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook 1 1/2 hours or until beef is very tender. Serve with rice.
ingredients: 2 pounds boned beef chuck, cut in 1-inch cubes
2 tablespoons ghee (available in Indian and specialty food stores)

step_by_step_instructions: In a blender, process 1 tablespoon of the vinegar, garlic, and chilies to a paste.
Add remaining vinegar, sugar, mustard, turmeric, ginger, coriander, cumin, and lemon juice to the blender.
Season with pepper and process until combined.
Place beef in a large bowl and pour the blender contents over it; toss to combine.
Marinate, covered, for 2 hours at room temperature or refrigerate overnight.
In a large skillet, heat ghee over medium-high heat.
Add onion and sauté for 10 minutes or until lightly browned.
Sprinkle meat with poppy seeds and toss to coat.
Turn heat to medium and add meat, marinade, bay leaf, and cloves to the skillet.
Cook, turning beef often, for 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 1 1/2 hours or until beef is very tender.
Serve with rice.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Butter and flour a 9 by 13-inch baking dish.
Using the grater attachment on a food processor, grate the potatoes and put in a large bowl. Add the flour, coconut, raisins, vanilla, cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg and mix well.
Heat the sugar, coconut milk, and evaporated milk in a saucepan over low heat until the sugar is dissolved, about 4 minutes.
Pour the coconut milk mixture into the potato mixture and mix well. Pour the mixture into the baking dish, smooth the top, and bake until set, about 1 1/2 hours.
ingredients: 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, plus more for the pan
3 pounds white-fleshed sweet potatoes, called boniato or batata

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Butter and flour a 9 by 13-inch baking dish.
Grate the potatoes using the grater attachment on a food processor and put them in a large bowl.
